loans.name: Donadi

texts.es:
el señor Donadi Y. tiene 44 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad de su ultimo matrimonio, tambien tiene otros hijos del matrimonio anterior. El ayuda economicamente a todos sus hijos ya que dice que es su responsabilidad educarlos y darles todo hasta que ellos puedan valerse por si solos en la vida. Dice sentirse muy bien con su nuevo hogar.
Donadi se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene dos puestos que compro en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome Valle. Esta solicitando el credito ya que quiere surtir un poco mas su negocio y con ello obtener mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su hogar y para cubrir con todos los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Donadi Y. is 44 years old. He has a four year old daughter from his latest marriage. He also has other children from a previous marriage. He helps all of his children economically. He says it is his responsibility to educate them and give them everything until they can manage on their own in life. He feels very good in his new home. Donadi sells clothes. He bought two stands outside of the Nacaome Valle municipal market. He is requesting the loan because he wants to stock his business a little more. That way he will get more earnings, which he needs to support his household and cover all of the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jean, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, and socks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Ernesto P. labora en la actividad de Operador de consola en el Banco Central de Nicaragua desde hace 8 año el cual con este trabajo sustenta a su familia y ha luchado por mejorar su vivienda, empieza a laborar de 9am a 9pm .  

Este crédito que solicito es para Mejor su Vivienda reparación de cuarto y el plan de inversión es Compra de Materiales de Construcción como es cemento, hierro,perlin, zinc, arena, Bloque, cerámica, piedrín
texts.en:
Luis Ernesto P. has worked as a computer operator in the Banco Central de Nicaragua for 8 years. This employment makes it possible for him to support his family; he works from 9am to 9pm. He has struggled to make home improvements. The loan will be used to make home improvements, to repair a room. He intends to buy building materials like: cement, iron, zinc metal sheeting and tubing, sand, concrete blocks, tile, gravel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco S. U.  se dedica a brindar servicio de Contabilidad a empresas y personas Naturales, el  horario de trabajo de este cliente es de 8am a 5pm, tiene su pequeña oficina en su casa de habitación, tiene 4 año de laborar en esta actividad.  

Este crédito que solicito es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda realizar repello de la casa , y el plan de inversión es Compra de cemento, arena , pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Francisco S. U. is a public accountant; he provides services to individuals and to businesses. He works from 8 am until 5 pm. He has a small office in his home and has been in this line of work for 4 years. The loan will be used to make improvements to his house; particularly sealing the walls. He plans to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Gabriel

texts.es:
La joven Ana Gabriel es madre soltera comerciante desde hace 3 años tiene su negocio quien con ayuda de sus padres con lo cual ha logrado salir adelante en su hogar y le ha permitido continuar con sus estudios universitarios y darle un mejor por venir a su hijo.
Este préstamo es para la compra de mercadería como arroz , azúcar , frijoles etc. lo cual le permitirá mejorar su negocio y así aumentar sus ganancias para el mejoramiento de su hogar
texts.en:
Miss Ana Gabriel is a single mother and businesswoman; for the past 3 years she's had her business that, with the help of her parents, has helped her to progress at home and allowed her to continue with her university studies and give her son a better future. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise, such as rice, sugar, beans, etc., that will allow her to improve her business and thus increase her profits in order to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumer goods

loans.name: Araujo 4 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Araujo 4 esta ubicado en la colonia Araujo de la ciudad de Choluteca, sus integrantes son 3 mujeres las cuales son muy amigas y tienen varios años de conocerse, decidieron unirse en grupo y solicitar un credito para salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Derys M.  es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, se levanta 
a las 5 de la mañana para empezar su produccion de tortillas, luego a las 7 de la mañana manda a sus 2 hijos de 8 y 10 años para la escuela. con este tipo de actividad a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos,   el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

la sra. Edelmina H. se dedica a la fabricacion de tortillas, Edelmina se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para fabricar sus ricas tortillas y venderlas en la comunidad en donde vive,  el prestamo lo nesecita  para incrementar su produccion y por ende sus ventas y asi tener mejores utilidades.

la sra. Candida M. es  madre soltera,  tiene 3 hijos  y tambien se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Candida lucha para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos para darles un futuro mejor. Sus hijos estan en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven, en los tiempos libres sus hijos le ayudan a doña candida. quiere incrementar su negocio por eso es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
The Araujo 4 group is located in the Araujo neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. The members are three women who are good friends and have known one another for several years. They decided to come together as a group and apply for a loan in order to advance their businesses and families. Here are the details of their different businesses:

Doña Derys M. is an enterprising woman who dedicates herself to her work and her family. She wakes up at 5:00 in the morning to begin making tortillas. Later, at 7:00 a.m., she takes her two children, ages 8 and 10, to school. With this work she has succeeded in getting ahead for her children. She needs the loan in order to purchase more materials for making tortillas.

Sra. Edelmina H. is involved in making tortillas. Edelmina wakes up at 5:00 in the morning to make her delicious tortillas and sell them in the community in which she lives. She needs the loan in order to increase her production and her sales and, thus, have better earnings.

Sra. Candida M. is a single mother with three children. She also is engaged in the sale of tortillas. Candida fights to make progress in order to give her children a better future. Her children are in school in the community in which they live. In their free time they help Doña Candida. She wants her business to grow, and that’s why she is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, corn flour and lime

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nidia Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora Nidia Mariana Hernández de una pulpería ubicada entrada san Antonio 1km al Norte Ponedora el cual empieza a laborar de 7am a 6pm y al mismo se dedica a preparar el alimento para su familia.  
También se dedica ala actividad de ganadería.
Este crédito que solicito es para ampliar mas su negocio y el plan de inversión es Compra de Producto de la canasta básica,  y golosinas, gaseosas.
Para mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia Mariana Hernández has a local store located at the San Antonio entrance 1km from North Ponedora. She works from 7am to 6pm and prepares the food for the family. She also raises livestock. This loan that she is asking for is to expand her business and the investment plan is to purchase basic food products, candy and fizzy drinks. This is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products, candy, fizzy drinks

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Cecilia C. M. se dedica a tender el Negocio de la Pulpería desde la 7am a 6pm el cual con este negocio sustenta las necesidades de la familia esta señora tiene 15 año de trabajar en esta actividad.  

Este crédito que solicito es para ampliar su inventario de su negocio y su plan de  inversión es Compra de producto de la canasta básica , licores y golosina.
texts.en:
Carmen Cecilia C. M. has a local store and works from 7am to 6pm. This business sustains the family's needs. She has spent 15 years working in this business. This loan that she is asking for is to increase her stock and her investment plan is to purchase basic food products, alcohol and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products, alcohol and candy

loans.name: Denis Rafael

texts.es:
El joven Denis se desempeña como profesor de personas discapacitada( sordo – mudo) el cual estos alumnos oscilan entre las edades de 4-12 años donde tiene dos años de laborar para el ministerio de educación es casado con una hija de 3 años de edad.

Este crédito es para sufragar los gastos de su hogar ya que actualmente quiere meter en su casa los tubos para las aguas residuales y así mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Denis teaches disabled students (deaf-mute) whose ages range between 4-12 years. He has worked for the ministry of education for two years. He is married with a three year old daughter. This loan is to cover household expenses as he currently wants to put sewage water pipes in his house in order to improve the housing conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing expenses

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia inicia su actividad  a las 6:00 am ofreciendo sus productos en las diferentes unidades inter urbanas y públicos en general en su puesto fijo ubicado frente a la parada de Buses León - Chinandega.
Este crédito que solicito la señora A. es para incrementar el negocio comprando producto Diana  así  como caramelos surtidos para ofertar los nuevos y mejores productos que salen al mercado. 

Un hecho relevante de la señora María Eugenia es que este negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante con un pequeño capital de C$ 500.00 actualmente se encuentra en puesto fijo y con un buen inventario lo que ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia que está compuesta por dos hijo además de ser madre soltera ha logrado salir adelante con el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Eugenia begins her work at 6:00 am, offering her products to several transportation lines from her stall located in front of the León - Chinandega bus stop. This loan that Mrs. A. asked for is to increase her business by buying Diana brand products, such as assorted candies, to offer the newest and best products out on the market. A relevant fact about María Eugenia is that she began this business as a traveling salesperson with a small amount of capital, 500 córdobas. Currently she has a fixed spot and a good inventory, which has allowed her to improve her family's standard of living. Her family is composed of two children. Besides being a single mother, she has managed to help her children succeed in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carbonated beverages, variety of juices, Diana brand products, candy and cigars

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es:
Las Peras es un grupo unido, trabajador, esforzado y con el deseo de seguir adelante. La coordinadora es la señora Silvia Elena López B. quien inicio su negocio con venta de sopa ya sean de res, mondongo, pollo, hueso, cola, queso….etc. los domingos con lo cual pudo crear un pequeño capital para invertir en una comideria. 

Los otros integrantes son Miriam A. tiene una fritanga, Fátima Solórzano vende cosméticos y Cruz Alfonso L. R. vende ropa.
texts.en:
Las Peras is a united, vigorous and hardworking group with the desire to progress. The coordinator is Mrs. Silvia who started her business selling soup, such as beef, tripe, bone, beef tail or cheese soup, on Sundays. With this business she was able to create some capital to be used to invest in an eatery. The other members are Miriam, who has a fried food shop, Fatíma, who sells cosmetics and Crux, who sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María, se dedica a la Venta de Ropa, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo en el mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde temprana hora finalizando al medio día ,la tarde es dedicada a su familia. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para aumentar su inventario para ofertar a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor de María sells clothing every day in a stall in the Terminal-León Market, where she offers her products from early in the morning until mid-day. In the afternoons, she spends time with her family.

She seeks this loan in order to increase her inventory to offer her clients a wider variety of products and thus satisfy their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blouses, t-shirts, ankle bracelets, and undergarments

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra, se dedica a la Venta de Frutas, todos los días realiza su compra del producto a las 5 de la mañana se ubica en puesto fijo en la terminal de buses de León, le ayudan las hijas a la venta de su producto  movilizándose ambulante en las diferentes paradas de buses. 
Este crédito lo solicita para realizar compra de su producto al por mayor con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias y de esta forma ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Isidra sells fruits. Each day, she buys the products at 5 a.m. and sets up in a stall in the León bus station, where she helps her daughters sell the fruits and takes the product to the different bus stations.

She seeks this loan to purchase more product wholesale with the objective of increasing her earnings and thereby improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina G. R.  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, negocio esta ubicado del centro de salud primero de mayo 1c. Al norte,  trabaja cada día de la  7 am a exhibir su mercadería al público y finaliza a las 6 pm.
 
 Este crédito lo solicito para  compra de dos pacas de ropa usada de mejor calidad y así obtener mayor ganancia para el sustento de su hijo.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora G. R.  esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con ropa de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. R. sells used clothing. Her business is located near the "primero de mayo" health center 1c north. She works every day from 7 a.m. to display her merchandise to the public and she finishes at 6 p.m.

She seeks this loan to purchase two bales of used clothes at a higher quality, and obtain better earnings to support her son.

It's important to mention that she is very grateful for the loans with Ceprodel that have helped her grow her business with higher-quality clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bales of used clothes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y cuatro D. sus seis hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a vender pan y embutidos en los exteriores del mercado del distrito D. Pimentel, este distrito queda ubicado a media hora D. la zona en donD. vive. Ella nos comenta que inició el negocio en una iniciativa propia D. ayudar al sostenimiento D. su familia. Su esposo es panadero y ella le acompañaba a ofrecer sus productos por el distrito D. Monsefú y los distritos aledaños, fue entonces cuando decidio complementar el negocio D. su marido con el D. la venta D. embutidos.

Antonia va desD. muy temprano al distrito D. Pimentel junto a su esposo: mientras el venD. el pan y los productos que ha horneado el dia anterior, ella venD. los embutidos (queso, sachicha y mantequilla) a sus clientes. El negocio es rentable y D. mucha utilidad a los clientes ya que encuentran en un solo lugar los productos que necesitan para la preparación D. sus desayunos.

Antonia desea ampliar su negocio con la venta D. mas queso, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante honrada y amable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos hasta que estos terminen sus estudios superiores. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 51 years old, married and lives with her husband and four of her six children in the Monsefu district, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past twelve years she has sold bread and sausages in the outsiD. market in the Pimental District. This district is located a half hour from the zone where she lives. She started this business of her own free will in order to help with the maintenance of her family. Her husband is a baker. She accompanied her husband in order to sell his products in the Monsefú district and the other neighboring districts. This was when she decided to add to her husband's business by selling sausages. Antonia leaves very early to go to the Pimentel district with her husband. While he sells bread and other products that he bakes the day before, she sells sausages as well as cheese, spicy sausage and butter, to her customers. The business is profitable and is very convenient for her customers as they can buy all the ingredients to prepare breakfast in one place. Antonia wishes to grow her business buy selling more cheese. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles which she will use to meet this objective. Antonia is very honorable and friendly. Her main desire is to continue supporting her children until they finish their higher education. Previously she worked with our institution. She has shown punctuality and responsibility from the very moment that she began paying back her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sausages in order to increase her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El Señor José Luis C. López  inicia a laborar 8:00 am  como cajero central en la empresa Lydia Ludic de Nicaragua el cual con este trabajo sustenta la alimentación de su familia y se esfuerza para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
Este crédito que solicito el Señor  José Luis C. López  es para la compra de materiales de Construcción como es Cemento, arena, cerámica, laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
Jose Luis begins working as a cashier in the “Lydia Ludic de Nicaragua” company at 8:00 am. With this job he is able to feed his family and he works hard to improve his home a little at a time. Jose is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials such as cement, sand, and zinc sheet metal.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.es:
El grupo Orquídea está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras provenientes de  Masaya conocida como Ciudad de la Flores. La  coordinadora del grupo es la señora Cándida Paulina Velázquez  quien desde hace 8 años tiene un vivero el cual ha ido creciendo y mejorando. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de rosas, pinos, ciprés, esqueletos, helechos…et. 

Las otras integrantes son María Auxiliadora G. Velázquez quien vende ropa y Ángela de Carmen G. vende cosméticos. Ambas desean que sus negocios crezcan y se desarrollen.
texts.en:
The Orquídea (Orchid) group is made up of three women who are from Masaya, known as the City of Flowers. The group coordinator is Cándida Paulina Velázquez who, for the last 8 years, has had a nursery which has been growing and improving consistently. She will use the funds to buy roses, pines, cipresses, ferns, trellises, etc. The other members are: María Auxiliadora G. Velázquez, who sells clothing and Ángela de Carmen G., who sells cosmetics. Both want their businesses to grow and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plants like: roses, cypresses, pine, ferns, etc.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Nubia de los Santos Sáenz vende agua y gaseosas en la parada de buses León Managua desde las 6 am y finaliza a las 5pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra productos como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, cola shale y cosadehorno. Así para realizar mayor venta y tener más ganancia para el sustento de su familia.

 La Señora Sáenz esta muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por que ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nubia de los Santos Sáenz sells water and soft drinks in the León Managua bus station from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m.

She seeks this loan to purchase more products like soft drinks, juices, bottled waters, cola, and baked goods so that she can have better sales and higher earnings to sustain her family.

Ms. Sáenz is very satisfied with the support that Ceprodel has afforded her and helped her grow her business and improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various soft drinks, juices, colas, bottled waters, and baked goods.

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florida está conformado por tres personas emprendedoras, trabajadoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Aracely del Carmen M. Martínez quien se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra con lo cual le proporciono estudios a sus tres hijos que son profesionales. Ella invertira el credito en ampliar el negocio e invertir en mayores productos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Rosa Argentina López la cual tiene un pequeño taller de calzado y Pablo Antonio R. C. quien vende productos Avon pero sueño de el llegar a tener una tienda de ropa deportiva. Ellos invertirán  en sus respectivos negocios para ampliarlos.
texts.en:
The Florida group is made up of three, hard-working, enterprising and tenacious people. One of them is Aracely del Carmen M. Martínez, who buys scrap for resale. This work made it possible for her to educate her three children, who are now all professionals. The other group members are: Rosa Argentina López, who has a small shoe repair shop and Pablo Antonio R. C., who sells Avon products but who dreams with having a sports clothing store. They will invest in their respective businesses in order to expand them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scrap.

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Yolanda R. se dedica a la venta de refresco, gaseosas en el mercado la terminal. Trabaja cada día desde 6 de la mañana a las 5 de la tarde.

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar mayor los  productos que vende  tales como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, y cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora R. esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela Yolanda sells soft drinks in the terminal market. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily. She is asking for this loan in order to buy goods in quantity, such as soft drinks, juices, bottle water, coco, payana, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit for refreshments. She wants to improve her income. She is grateful because her loans through CEPRODEL have helped her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and ingredients

loans.name: Facundo Edipcia

texts.es:
La señora Facunda Edipcia F. B. inicia desde la 6: oo am a vender ambulante en los buses en el  mercado la terminal y finaliza a las 11:00 am. 

Además de la venta de cosadehorno viaja a San Carlos Ríos San Juan dos veces por mes  a vender Ropa interior tales como: tobillera, blúmer, camisetas, bóxer, bikini, brasier.

 La Señora F. esta  satisfecha con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha brindado, por que ha logrado a tener otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Facunda begins working at 6:00 am, selling [baked goods] on buses in the market. She finishes at 11:00 am. Besides selling baked goods, she travels to San Carlos Ríos San Juan twice a month to sell under clothes, such as: socks, bloomers, t-shirts, boxers, bikini, and brassier. She is satisfied with the loans that CEPRODEL has helped her get because they have helped her start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Baked goods and underclothing

loans.name: Francis Lisibeth

texts.es:
La señora Campo inicia a descremar la leche desde las 4:00 am. Para luego realizar las cuajadas, se traslada desde su comarca donde vive hasta el  mercado de la terminal con el objetivo de ofertar a su clientela la variedad de productos lácteos, finalizando su venta a las 2:00pm que es la hora que ingresa el ultimo vehículo en su comarca donde vive.
Este crédito que solicito es  para  incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera ofertar producto de mejor calidad.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Francis es madre soltera de dos hijas la cual ella trabaja arduamente para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Francis begins separating milk cream at 4:00 am in order to make milk curd. She travels from her home to the terminal market in order to sell a variety of milk products to her customers. She finishes at 2:00 pm, when she boards the last vehicle to her neighborhood. She is asking for this loan in order to increase her working capital and be able to provide better quality products. Francis is a single mother of two girls and works hard to give the best to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. C., se dedica a dar servicio de vulcanización y venta de llanta trabajando las 24 hrs. día en turno de 6:00am a 10:pm el Sr. C. y un segundo turno le ayudan los hijos de 10:00Pm – 6:00am del día siguiente, esto con el objetivo de dar buen servicio al cliente y estar anuente en el momento que lo amerite el caso. Su puesto está ubicado en un punto estratégico Parque posada del Sol 1c, al Sur donde está la mayor afluencia de vehículo.

Este es su primer crédito que solicita a la institución el Sr. C. se siente agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha brindado para lograr incrementar su negocio con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancia y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida de toda su familia que está compuesto por 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio does vulcanization and sells tires. He does 24 hour shift work from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and his sons work the 10:00 pm to 6:00 am shift. He wants to be able to give good service to his customers and be available when they need his services. His shop is located in a strategic location in the Parque Posada del Sol 1c, an area where there are many vehicles. This will be his first loan through this institution and he is grateful for the support he has received which has helped him to grow his business and improve his income. This has allowed him to improve his family’s life. He has four children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires for his business

loans.name: Miriam De Jesús

texts.es: La señora López V., es profesora de primaria, cuenta con más de 25 años de ser educadora, el esposo es de oficio chofer de camiones, sus hijos son mayores de edad, pero tiene a su cargo dos nietos, el préstamo lo necesita para realizarle una reparación del techo de la cocina da la casa, para protegerse del invierno que empieza en los próximos dos meses. Con los préstamos que se le han atendido en CEPRODEL, ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. López V. is an elementary school teacher and has more than 25 years of experience as an educator. Her husband works as a truck driver. They have two adult children who take care of their two grandchildren.

She is requesting a loan to repair the roof above her kitchen so that it will be protected during the winter, which begins within the next two months. With her loans from CEPRODEL, she has improved her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof above her kitchen

loans.name: Sonia Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Trabaja en Mantenimiento de la casa comercial Mc. GREGOR S.A, un día de trabajo para ella es dar mantenimiento a la oficina además de movilizarse en los diferentes Bco. de la ciudad  de león para realizar gestiones del comercial.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para gastos de estudio universitario de su hija ya que está realizando módulos de Admón. de Empresa  la cual es de gran importancia para la formación profesional de su hija.

 Cabe mencionar que este es el cuarto crédito con nuestra institución, los anteriores han sido destinados para mejoras de vivienda ya que fue de gran ayuda para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia works as a business manager for McGregor S.A. Her work day involves maintaining the office as well as traveling to different parts of the city of León to conduct business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the university expenses of her daughter, who is taking classes in Business Administration. It is of great importance for her daughter to receive professional training.

It should be mentioned that this is Sonia’s fourth loan with our Institution. Her previous loans were used for home improvements and they have already been a great help in providing better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's university expenses

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Don Jorge de edad de 35 años, trabajador se gana día a día recorriendo la capital de Managua ofreciendo su servicio de taxi., su esposa le tiene una hija, también trabaja como supervisora de cocina ya que ambos ahorran para lograr el objetivo de tener su propia casa. Para don Jorge se le hace difícil a veces su trabajo ya que las carreras están bajas ya que el cliente no quiere pagar lo que se pide. Así como también hay días buenos. El taxi es de su propiedad el cual adquirió con ahorros y liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Para el es importante mantener su vehiculo en buen estado ya que es su sustento de cada día. Con este préstamo lograra pintar el carro en la parte trasera, comprar amortiguadores, y sistema de dirección, para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes, y poder andar en mejores condiciones de trabajo para evitar accidentes. Esta contento con los financiamientos por los beneficios que le genera el poder hacer esta inversión ya que por falta de dinero no había hecho las mejoras de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Jorge, 35, provides taxi services throughout the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have a daughter. His wife works as a kitchen supervisor because they both work in order to earn enough to buy their own house. Jorge's work is sometimes difficult because customers don't want to pay what he asks for to ride. Sometimes he has good days, though. The taxi is his; he purchased it with savings and with his severance pay from his previous job. For him, it's important to have his taxi in good conditions because it is his source of income. He will use the funds to paint the rear of the car, to buy shock absorbers and for the steering system in order to provide better customer service and drive under better conditions to avoid accidents. He is happy with the financing because of the benefits it generates being able to make this investment in vehicle repairs which, for lack of funds, he hadn't been able to do before.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint the rear of his car, for shock absorbers and steering system.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonso se dedica a la venta de granos básicos muy de mañana abre el negocio para recibir a su clientela y ofertar la variedad de productos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la estación. 

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de un maíz, bolsas plásticas y otros, ya que se lo ofrecieron a un buen precio.
Algo relevante del señor Pedro, es que cuando inicio su negocio vendía ambulante hoy en día tiene su propio tramo.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso sells basic grains. He opens his business early each morning so that he can meet his customers and offer them a variety of products. His establishment can be found at the station market.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy corn, plastic bags, and other products that he already offers at a good price. Something relevant about Pedro is that he used to travel when he started his business. Today he has his own place where he makes his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, plastic bags, and other items

loans.name: Kastalia Carolina

texts.es: La señora C. G., trabaja como conserje, el salario que recibe es un poco bajo, que no le permite realizar la mejora en su casa con sus ingresos, teniendo que recurrir a este préstamo para poder realizarlo y después ir pagando en abonos suaves, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. El crédito lo necesita para instalar una puerta y una ventana en la entrada de su habitación, para darle mayor seguridad y protección a la familia
texts.en:
Sra. C. G. has two school age children and works as a janitor. Her salary is a bit low, so her income does not allow her to make improvements to her house. She can only do this with the help of a loan and then repay it in installments. The money will be used to install a door and a window at the entrance of her home, thereby providing greater security and protection for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a door & a window at the entrance of her house

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Ramón R. H., tiene 44 años de edad, casado, es maestro Escuela Primaria de una comunidad Rural que se llama los Zanjones, lugar de donde él también es origunario, tiene dos hijos, una mayor y una menor, la cual está cursando la escuela secundaría.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los que cuales le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This gentleman is Sr. Juan Ramón R. H.. He is 44 years old, married, and works as an elementary school teacher in the rural community where is originally from – Los Zanjones. Juan has two children. One is an adult, while the other is still a minor and currently attends high school.

He has obtained from our Institution three loans which have been used to take care of personal expenses. The most recent one will be used for home improvements. It should be mentioned that Juan met his obligations with his two previous loans and handled them very responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Antonia Patricia

texts.es: La señora L. N., es de oficio domésticos, trabaja como conserje (limpieza) en una empresa, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. El préstamo lo necesita para compra de unas hojas de zinc, para cambiarlas en el techo de la casa, ya que se encuentran dañadas y el invierno esta pronto a venir, por lo que necesita proteger de la lluvia a su familia. Con los préstamos que ha tenido en CEPRODEL viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Es una joven madre responsable y dedicada a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. L. N. provides housekeeping services. She works as a janitor for a business and has a son who is in school. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sheets of zinc so that she can replace the roof of her house. It is currently in disrepair, and with winter approaching, she needs to protect her family from the rain. With her loans from CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions. This young mother is responsible and dedicated to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets of zinc to replace her roof

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Karla C. es conserje en el instituto I N O de león en donde comienza sus labores a las 6am y la termina a las tres de la tarde de conserje. 

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de útiles escolares y pago de adelanto de colegiatura de su hijo 

Algo relevante de la señora Karla , es que  es madre soltera  y quiere sacar adelante a su hijo y además de de ser conserje también da servicios de lavado y planchado.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla C. is a janitor at the INO Institute in León. She starts working at 6am and ends at 3pm. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy school supplies and pay for her son’s tuition.

Something to know about Sra. Karla is that she is a single mother who wants to get ahead for her son. In addition to being a janitor, she also provides laundry and ironing services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies & pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia P. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos  tales como abanicos, planchas, radios, bolsos, entre otros iniciando sus labores todos los días desde tempranas horas sacando parte de sus electrodomésticos a orillas de la acera de su tramo para poder ofertarlos en el mercado de León.   

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de dichos electrodomésticos para continuar comercializandolos en su local y así generar sus respectivos ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucrecia sells electrical appliances. In the early morning hours, she moves some of her inventory out to the sidewalk near her store to offer to customers. Her business is open from 8am to 5pm. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy appliances such as fans, irons, radios, and other items. In addition to this business, Sra. Lucrecia also operates a diner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances to sell

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Ana  se levanta de horas tempranas 4:30am para elaborar los diferentes sabores de comida y refresco para luego trasladarse a las 6am a su puesto de venta en el mercado la estación finalizando a las 10:30 am.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles,  carne, pollo,  y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana wakes up in the early morning hours so that she can begin preparing different flavors of food and beverages by 4:30am. By 6am, she has arrived at her vending post at the market station where she stays until 10:30am.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: El señor R. U., es de oficio transportista, cuenta con un camión en el cual traslada materiales de construcción, brindando servicio de forma particular al que lo necesite, sus hijos son mayores de edad, pero tiene a su cuido dos nietos que está educando, con este préstamo construirá un muro en el patio de su casa, para darle seguridad a su familia. Con los prestamos que anteriormente ha solicitado viene realizando mejora a su casa y con el servicio de transporte viene realizando sus abonos.
texts.en:
Sr. R. U. is a truck driver who has his own vehicle for hauling construction materials. He provides this particular service to anyone who needs it. His children are grown, but they are taking care of and paying for the education of his two grandchildren.

With this loan, he will build a wall in his backyard in order to provide his family with security. His previous loans have been used to make improvements to his house. With the income he generates from providing transport services, Carlos is able to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall in his backyard

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esta señora es Obrera, tiene 50 años de edad, es casa y trabaja para una compañía productora de Ron, su marido es agricultor, tiene dos personas a su cargo los cuales están en escuela de secundaria, ella ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Es bueno señalar que en los dos créditos obtenidos anteriormente su comportamiento de pago ha sido excelente, por lo que se le ha estado considerando como cliente A.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is 50 years old, married, and a worker who is employed by a company that produces rum. Her husband is a farmer and they have two dependent children who are attending high school. Martha has received a total of three loans, all of which have been used for home improvements.

It is nice to point out that Martha demonstrated a good payment history with her two previous loans. For this reason, she is considered to be an “A” client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
La señora Santos M. se levanta de horas tempranas a las 5:00am  para la elaboración de tortillas para luego trasladarse a su puesto de venta en el mercado la estación finalizando a las 11:00 pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de maíz , leña, cal  y otros.

Tiene el apoyo de su hija que se pone en otro tramo para vender más y terminar temprano ya que tienen buena clientela por el buen sabor de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos M. wakes up in the early morning hours to begin making tortillas by 5am. She later sells them at her vending post at the station market until 11pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy corn, wood, lime, and other items. She has the support of her daughter, who has another location for selling more her products. Santos finishes early because she has a good customers who enjoy the great taste of her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, wood, lime, and other items

loans.name: Jania María

texts.es: La señora E. L., trabaja como conserje en un escuela de preescolar, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad más de diez año, con su trabajo y el apoyo de su esposo vienen mejorando su vivienda, este préstamo lo invertirá en la educación o pago de colegiatura de su hija, ya que la están preparando para el futuro para que sea una profesional. Con los préstamos anteriores que se le han atendido en CEPRODEL le ha servido de una estabilidad económica, ya que con estos préstamos han logrado salir adelante en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Sra. E. L. has been working as a janitor at a nursery school for more than ten years. Through her work and the support of her husband, she has been able to make improvements to her home. This loan will be invested in education by paying for her daughter’s tuition, since she is preparing to become a professional in the future. With her previous loans she received from CEPRODEL, Jania has achieved financial stability and was able to meet her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Howard Joel

texts.es:
Este joven tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, con tres hijos, los tres son menores de edad, aún no están en edad escolar, vive en un municipio llamado Posoltega de donde son originarios su señora y él, trabaja en la Alcaldía de este municipio desde hace cuatro años desempeñándose como Responsable de Administración Tributaria, su esposa trabaja en la casa en un pequeños negocio que juntos llevan a cabo, el negocio consiste en un Ciber y Juego de Nintendo. 

Los dos primeros créditos otorgados fueron para compra de equipos para el negocio y ampliación del mismo, este último es para realizar mejoras en el local, como repello de paredes y puesta del piso de cerámica.

En los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente este joven ha sido muy responsable.
texts.en:
This young man is 28 years old, married, and has three dependent children who are not yet in school. He lives in the town of Posoltega, which is where he and his wife are originally from. Howard has been working for the municipal government for four years and serves as the Head of Tax Administration. His wife manages a small business at home that they started together. It consists of a cyber-café and a Nintendo game parlor.

The first two loans he received were used to buy equipment for the business and pay for expansion costs. This latest loan will be used to improve his home by plastering the walls and installing a ceramic floor. Howard was very responsible with his two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to plaster the walls of his house and install a ceramic floor

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven muy noble y responsable, tiene 27 años y es cuarto de 9 hermanos, vive en la casa de sus padres y está al pendiente de las necesidades de sus progenitores, ya que es un hijo muy amoroso.

Desde pequeño ha trabajado con mucha responsabilidad en los cultivos, sembrando higos, manzanas y mangos en su pueblo natal. Con el correr de los años sus padres migraron con él y sus hermanos a la ciudad de Lima, por lo que dejó de dedicarse íntegramente a la agricultura y se compró un motocarro. Desde entonces, hace dos años, trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de pasajeros; su labor inicia a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche, de lunes a viernes. En estos dos años se ha acostumbrado a este trabajo, además las buenas ganancias que obtiene lo mantienen con el ánimo de prosperar; por ello, para más adelante va a comprar otro motocarro y lo dará en alquiler para aumentar sus ingresos. 

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y cabe recalcar que es él único varón dentro de su banco comunal, por lo que todas sus compañeras lo engríen y bromean con él. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su motocarro, ya que desde hace un año no le realiza ningún mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Cristian, 27, is a good-hearted, responsible young man; he is the fourth of nine siblings. He lives with his parents and is watchful of their needs, since he is a very loving son. From a very early age, he worked very diligently farming figs, apples and magoes in his native town. As years went by, his parents moved to the city of Lima with him and his siblings. This led him to completely stop farming and he bought a vehicle. Since then, for two years now, he has provided passenger transportation services. His workday begins at 6am and ends at 10pm from Monday through Friday. In these two years he has become accustomed to this work. Besides, the good profits he earns keep him motivated to succeed. He plans to buy another vehicle in the future to lease out to increase his income. This is his 6th loan with MFP. It is important to stress that he is the only male member of his communal bank which leads to his being teased and joked with by the other members. He will use the funds requested to buy spare parts for his car because it's been a year since its last service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 48 años y vive con el padre de su único hijo, en su casa rústica ubicada en su chacra.

Desde niña trabaja en las labores agrícolas como le enseñaron sus padres, y le gusta mucho esa actividad. Para ello, junto a su esposo, acude muy temprano a sus campos de cultivo, ya que los higos, manzanas y mangos que produce requieren de sus cuidados. Asimismo, recolecta “cochinillas” (insecto que se usa para producir colorante natural) de las tunas, logrando acumular al día hasta un kilo, vendiéndolo entre 150 y 200 soles. Cuando esperan la cosecha de sus frutas, se dedican a la recolección de este animalito, pues tiene gran demanda. De este modo, es como se gana la vida esta pareja y logran cubrir la educación de su hijo en la ciudad. Para el futuro, Graciela anhela comprarse un terreno en la ciudad para estar más cerca de su hijo y cuidar de que no pase necesidades.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, todos sus créditos anteriores los ha pagado con puntualidad y asiste a todas las reuniones de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar fertilizantes químicos para aplicar a sus chacras de fruta.
texts.en:
Graciela, 48, is a very responsible woman; she lives with the father of her only son in a rustic house built on her farmlands. Ever since she was a young child, she worked alongside her parents doing farming chores; she enjoys her work very much. She, together with her husband, goes to their fields very early because the figs, apples and mangoes she produces require care. In addition, she gathers "cochinillas" (cochineal, an insect used to produce a natural dye) off prickly pears sometimes gathering up to a kilogram a day, that she sells for between 150 and 200 soles. While they wait for harvest time of their fruits, they collect these little animals because they are in high demand. This is how this couple earns their livelihood and are able to pay for their son's education in the city. For the future, Graciela hopes to buy a lot in the city to be closer to her son so that she can insure that he has everything he needs. This is her 5th loan with MFP; she has repaid all her previous loans on time and she attends all the group meetings. She will use these funds to buy chemical fertilizers for her fruit crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia tiene 60 años, es madre de 7 hijos, 5 de ellos son mayores y viven fuera y los 2 menores viven con ella y su esposo en su casa que está, aun, a medio construir.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, mientras su esposo trabaja en sus campos de cultivo; juntos reúnen el dinero necesario para cubrir los gastos familiares. Diariamente, después del medio día, es cuando Hortencia camina largos tramos de casa en casa realizando sus cobranzas y ofreciendo sus productos con sus catálogos en mano. A ella le gusta lo hace y tiene clientes muy responsables, lo cual la motiva a seguir con su trabajo. Sin embargo, su deseo a futuro es vender ropa, ya que sus clientes se lo han pedido, pero por el momento no cuenta con un ambiente donde pueda guardar las prendas sin que sufran deterioro.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando con la misma honestidad y responsabilidad como hasta ahora. Asimismo, está feliz de integrar un banco comunal, ya que todas sus compañeras son personas muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una vitrina donde pueda guardar y exhibir sus productos en su casa, sin que se empolven.
texts.en:
Hortencia, 60, has 7 children, 5 of whom are adults and live away from home, and 2 who are minors and still live with her and her husband in their still-unifinished house. For the last 20 years she has sold beauty products while her husband has worked farming their farmlands. Together, they earn enough to meet basic family needs. Every day, after noon, Hortencia walks the long distances from house to house collecting her payments due and offering her products, catalgue in hand, for sale. She enjoys what she does very much and has very responsible customers which motivates her to continue with her work. However, her dream for the future is to sell clothes, since her customers have requested this, but she currently does not have a proper place to store clothing without it being damaged. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue working with the same degree of honesty and responsibility as she has to date. She is happy to be part of a communal bank because all her fellow-members are very responsible people. She will use the funds requested to buy a display case to keep and display her wares at home without them getting dusty.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case for her products.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 44 años, es una mujer de buen carácter y una madre muy amorosa. Está casada con el padre de sus 2 hijos y todos viven en su casa propia ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias líneas de belleza. Cuando se inició en el negocio padeció mucho porque no tenía clientes, entonces su esposo, que es chofer, la apoyó con el dinero para pagar sus primeros pedidos de productos. Posteriormente y poco a poco empezó a ganar clientes, hasta que ascendió en la empresa de belleza y pasó de vendedora a ejecutiva de ventas. Ahora tiene a su cargo a dos jóvenes señoritas que trabajan para ella. Isabel está feliz con su trabajo, ya que le gusta mucho conversar  con las personas y eso le ayuda a vender sus productos fácilmente, pues gracias a su habilidad de persuasión puede captar más clientela. En adelante, piensa comprar unas vitrinas para exhibir sus productos en su casa.

Este es su 16avo préstamo con MFP, donde hace el compromiso de seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos, como hasta ahora. Asimismo, señala que está contenta con el trabajo de sus compañeras de crédito, ya que son personas que se conocen y son responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 44 years old, is easygoing, and is a loving mother. She is married to the father of her two children and they live in a house they own in a crowded neighborhood located south of Lima. She has been selling cosmetics from different beauty lines for years. When she started her business she suffered since she didn't have customers so her husband, a driver, supported her with money to pay for her first orders. Little by little, she began getting more and more customers, rising through the ranks of the beauty company and becoming a sales executive. Now she manages two young ladies who work for her. Ysabel is happy with her work since she enjoys talking to people, helping her sell products easily and get more customers with her persuasiveness. In the future she plans to purchase display cabinets to showcase her products at home. This is her 16th loan with MFP to whom she's made the commitment to keep being responsible with her payments, as she has been so far. Furthermore, she mentions that she is happy with her credit peers since they all know each other and are responsible. She plans to use the loan she is asking for to increase her stock of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 39 años, vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos, en casa de sus suegros. 
Nueve meses al año, junto a su esposo, se dedica a sus cultivos de manazas, mangos y uvas. Pero los 3 meses de verano trabaja en un recreo campestre al sur de Lima, cerca las playas, donde le pagan buen sueldo. Pero lo que más le agrada a Jenny es el comercio, por ello todos sus productos agrícolas, después de cada cosecha, los vende de manera ambulante y a otros comerciantes mayoristas. Es por ello que para más adelante, con su esposo, planean enviar sus frutas directamente al mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad, ya que consideran que sus ganancias serían mayores.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido responsable con sus pagos y promete seguir siéndolo. Actualmente es la secretaria de su banco comunal y es muy apreciada por sus compañeras. El dinero que solicita esta vez será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus frutales.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old and lives with the father of her two children at her in-laws' house. For nine months during the year she, along with her husband, grows apples, mangoes, and grapes. During the three months of summer she works in a country estate near the beaches in the south of Lima, where she receives a good pay. However, what Jenny enjoys the most is selling which is why she sells all her crops on her own and to wholesalers. That is why, later on, she and her husband plan to sell her fruits directly to a fruit wholesaler in the city as they think their profits would be higher. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been responsible with her payments and she promises to continue to be. Currently, she is the secretary of her communal bank and is well appreciated by her fellow members. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for fruit trees.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es:
Jovanna es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, tiene 26 años y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres.

Es amante de la agricultura, ya que la realizó desde su infancia; siembras higos, mangos, paltas y manzanas en la chacra de sus padres. Después de cada cosecha, laboriosamente encajona los higos y demás frutas que siembra para enviarlos al mercado de frutas de la ciudad. Hace ya 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y una vez por semana compra y vende otras frutas con la finalidad de captar mayores utilidades. Por el momento trabaja con la ayuda de sus hermanos y el apoyo de su padre, pero para más adelante quiere independizarse y dedicarse el mayor tiempo a la compra y venta de frutas, ya que lo considera muy rentable.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y no ha tenido problemas de retraso en sus pagos, pues en todo este tiempo ha participado satisfactoriamente en su banco comunal, ya que es la presidenta de la junta directiva. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos, además de incrementar el capital para su negocio de venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a woman devoted to her work. She is 26 years old, is a single mom with two children, and lives in her parents' house. She loves agriculture as she has been involved in it since her childhood. She sows figs, mangoes, avocados, and apples in her parents' farm. After each harvest, she diligently packages the figs and other fruits to send them to the fruit market in the city. She has been working in this line of business for four years. She buys other kinds of fruit once a week to sell in an effort to increase her earnings. At the moment her brothers and father support her but in the future she would like to be fully independent and devote more time to the purchase and sale of fruit as she considers it very profitable. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She hasn't been late in her payments and has participated responsibly in her communal bank where she is president of the executive board. With the loan she is asking she will purchase chemical fertilizer for her crops and increase the investment in her fruit business.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una buena mujer de 51 años, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos viven en otra ciudad y ella vive con su esposo y una de sus hijas que es madre soltera.

Anteriormente trabajaba como ama de llaves, con este sueldo apoyó en los gastos del hogar a su esposo (planchador de carros) y ambos cubrieron la educación de sus hijos. Ahora acaba de empezar en el negocio de la venta de ropa en el puesto de una amiga situado en el mercado de su localidad. Por el momento Juana está tratando de captar clientela para que en adelante se independice y trabaje junto a su hija.

Este es segundo crédito con MFP y promete cumplir con responsabilidad en sus pagos, como con el primero. Asimismo, manifiesta estar agradecida con las demás integrantes de su banco comunal y promete no defraudar su confianza. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de prendas de vestir y de ese modo incrementar el capital de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, is a terrific person. She has 4 children, 3 of whom live in another city. She lives with her husband and one of their daughters, a single mother. Juana used to work as a housekeeper and, with the money she earned, she helped her husband pay for household expenses and their children's school fees. She has just started a business selling clothing in a stall owned by a friend at a local market. For now, she is trying to establish a customer base so that she can build an independent business that she can ultimately share with her daughter. This is Juana's second MFP loan and she is committed to repaying this one, just like she did the first one. She says, too, that she feels indebted to the other members of her community bank and she promises not to betray their trust. She will use the money that she is applying for to buy articles of clothing and, in turn, build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, la mayor se casó y hace poco se mudó, los 3 menores siguen a su cuidado. Su casa está ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Anteriormente tenía una tienda de ropa, en un local céntrico de su localidad, pero no le resultó rentable porque no podía juntar para pagar el alquiler mensual. Entonces optó por mudar toda su mercadería a su casa y vender desde allí. Ahora, cada vez que tiene la oportunidad, carga su bolso de ropa y visita a sus amistades para ofrecer sus prendas. Esta metodología le ha resultado mucho mejor y es una actividad que le gusta mucho, y junto a las ganancias de su esposo como albañil, pueden suplir las necesidades de sus hijos. Para más adelante está pensado en comprar vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus prendas en su casa.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y una vez más reitera su compromiso de seguir siendo muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que desea seguir contando con posteriores préstamos. A su vez, está contenta de ser parte de su grupo, pues no tiene quejas de sus compañeras de crédito. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes, por ser campaña escolar y de ese modo pueda captar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha, 51, is married and has 4 children. The oldest is married and recently moved away. The 3 younger children still live with her. Her house is in the south part of Lima. Martha used to have a clothing store in a commercial zone of her neighborhood but it wasn't viable because she couldn't cover the store's monthly rent. She subsequently decided to move the business to her house and sell from there. Whenever she has the chance now, she loads up her clothing bag and calls on friends and acquaintances to buy whatever she has on offer. This approach has worked much better and it's work that she very much likes doing. With her husband's income from his construction work, they are able to provide the things their children need. Martha is considering buying display cases so that she can better show her merchandise at home. This is Martha's fifth MPF loan. She has promised to go on being responsible about repaying her loans because she wants to ensure that she can get new loans in the future. At the same time, she is happy to be part of her group and she has no complaints about any of the other members. She will use the loan to buy uniforms that she can sell during the coming school year and, in turn, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva es una mujer emprendedora de 44 años, está casada y es madre de dos hijos mayores y profesionales. Actualmente viene construyendo su casa propia, ya techó el primer piso, anteriormente era de esteras.

Ella se ha dedicado a infinidad de negocios, inclusive tuvo una pequeña bodega, pero la cerró porque no tenía mucha mercadería y no le era rentable. Desde entonces, ínter diario, realiza la limpieza de casas de familias adineradas, lo cual le es muy rentable y los días que no trabaja vende quesos, los cuales son hechos en su pueblo y por su sabor son muy solicitados. Trabajar de este modo le ese muy conveniente y sus ingresos son mayores. De esta manera pudo ayudar  a su esposo, carpintero de oficio, a cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. 
Por el momento, su meta y la de su pareja, es de terminar de construir su casa para que toda la familia viva más segura y donde podrá reinstalar su tienda.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y ha demostrando, hasta el momento, ser una cliente muy responsable y participativa en su grupo. Asimismo menciona su gratitud diciendo: “sin los créditos, su negocio seguiría igual hasta ahora”. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas y bebidas para empezar a abastecer su nueva bodega, ahora que ya tiene techo.
texts.en:
Nelva, 44, is a natural entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of two grown children, both with professional careers. She is in the middle of building a house of her own and has just finished the first floor. She is originally from Esteras. Nelva has made a living doing many things. She even had a small general store but it closed because there wasn't much merchandise and she couldn't earn a living at it. Since then, from time to time, she has made a living cleaning houses for wealthy families, a job that does pay well, and selling cheeses that she buys in the town that she's from and that are much sought after. Working this way suits her very well and increases her income. She is able to help her husband, a carpenter by trade, cover the expenses of educating their children. For now, her goal and her husband's is to finish building the house so that their family can live more securely and where they can possibly open another store. This is Nelva's fourth MFP loan and she has shown herself, up to now, to be a responsible borrower and a full participant in the group. She has expressed her thanks, saying "without the loans, my business wouldn't have grown". She is considering using the loan to buy snacks and drinks so that she can open a new general store because she now has space in her house for one.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer D. 44 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 6 hijos, vive en su pequeña casa D. un piso, pero D. material noble.

Hace 10 años labora como empleada del hogar, este trabajo no es fácil ya que tiene que lidiar con los malos tratos D. algunas personas, pero sigue trabajando porque debe ayudar a cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil.  A ella le gustaría tener un propio negocio y dedicarse a la costura, actividad que le apasiona desD. su niña, pero por el momento debe seguir esforzándose junto a su esposo para ahorrar lo necesario para que en el futuro pueda comprar lo necesario para su taller D. costura y brindarles a sus hijos una  mejorar su calida D. vida.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Asimismo, manifiesta su agradecimiento a todos los integrantes D. su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte del grupo y asegura que no defraudará su confianza. Con el dinero que solicita comprará maderas para el armado D. los pisos que realiza su esposo, así podrá realizar mejores acabado en sus trabajos y captará más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is married to the father of her 6 children; she lives in her small, one-story house maD. of substantial materials. For the last 10 years she has worked as a domestic employee; this isn't easy work because she has to put up with being treated poorly by some people but she continues to work because she has to contribute to household expenses while her husband works as a bricklayer. She would like to have her own tailor shop, an activity that has been her passion since she was a little girl, but for the moment must continue to make the effort with her husband to save what they need so that in the future she can buy what she needs for her sewing shop and proviD. her children with a better quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also states her gratituD. to all the members of the communal bank for allowing her to be part of the group and assures them that she will not disappoint them. She will use the funds requested to buy wood for her husband to install flooring so that he can proviD. better finishes and thus capture more customers..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband to use in installing floors.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda A. is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Alda owns and operates an agriculture business. The main source of income for the business comes from planting banana trees and harvesting bananas for sale. Alda has been doing this for more than three years and earns approximately 9000 PHP per month for these activities. Alda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Alda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be Alda's fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business growing and selling bananas

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel V. is from the village of Poblacion IV in the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental province, the Philippines. She is a single 28-year-old who has been running a general store offering products such as bread, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, and candy for over 3 years now. She earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Raquel joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services that would help to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 7000 PHP and is now requesting a 10000 PHP loan to help expand her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her general store.

loans.name: Limy

texts.en:
Limy S. is from Ozamiz City outside of Manabay, Philippines. She is a 34-year-old married mother of 4 school-aged children. She runs a general store, selling products like shampoo, snacks, candy, coffee, and tissue, and she has been in business for over 3 years, earning about 15000 PHP a month.

Limy joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Limy has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 15000 PHP and she is now requesting her third loan, for 20000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Limy from GDMPC. She hopes to earn additional revenue so she can improve the living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in her general store.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan A. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin in Misamis Occidental. He is a 37-year-old married father of 2 school-aged children. Jonathan earns a living by providing tricycle transport services. He has been doing so for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Jonathan joined GDMPC IN 2009 to gain access to financial services that would help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC, and he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicles for better service.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To repair transport vehicles for his business.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy C. is from Oroquieta City. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Roy offers motor transport services. He has been doing so for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.  Roy joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 23000 PHP, and is now requesting his third loan, for 12000 PHP, to be used to repair his vehicle for better service.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his business vehicle.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando T. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion in Lopez Jaena. He is a 35-year-old married father of 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fernando runs a sari-sari store where he sells basic needs such as shampoo, noodles, and sugar. Fernando has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

Fernando has just joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernando is requesting his first loan, in the amount of 3000 PHP, to use as additional capital for his sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita D. C. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 41 years old. Nenita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fresh fish in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to buy another fish net. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
