loans.use: To buy another fish net

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita Q. is from the village of Dalisay, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Anita is single and has one adult child. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked food in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sheday's Group

texts.en:
Sheday G. is from Barangay Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Sheday is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sheday is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Sheday owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables like "sayote", squash, string beans, root crops, etc for sale. Sheday has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sheday joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheday is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Sheday's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Bangko, Panaon, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 51 years old. Ruth is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ruth is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing like blouses, skirts, pants etc. to local community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be Ruth's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Anselma's Group

texts.en:
Anselma C. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Anselma is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anselma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Anselma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, sardines, etc. in the local community. Anselma is just starting this business.

In 2010, Anselma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anselma is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anselma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en: To make a living, Maylin A. works in someone else's specialized retail store selling food supplements to local community members. She is 52 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from Oroquieta City. Maylin has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Maylin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Maylin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maylin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Delfa's Group

texts.en: Delfa T. is from the village of Mohon Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Delfa is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Delfa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delfa operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Delfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Delfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delfa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Delfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa and Anwar are a couple form Rafah in the Gaza Strip. Samah, Ahmed, Mohammad, and Maha who are respectively 10, 8, 4 and 2 years old, are their beautiful children. The couple own and run a bakery in Rafah which provides the neighboring areas with bread and tasty pastries. 

When Safa and Anwar opened their bakery two years ago, it quickly moved from serving the neighborhood where it's located to serving a wider range of customers. The bakery blockbuster encouraged Safa to ask for a loan in order to expand the bakery and purchase larger quantities of ingredients. 

Safa hopes the bakery continues to prosper as it's their only source of income. Anwar appears in the picture at their bakery.

loans.use: Expand their bakery

loans.name: Kabotar Group

texts.en:
Bebe Asefa is a member of Kabotar Group. She is a 50 year old woman, married with six children, who lives in 9th district of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Bebe Asefa is a hardworking woman. She has a quilt-sewing business and she has been involved in this business for more than twenty-five years. She is very skillful and quite popular among her neighbors.

Bebe Asefa needs the loan to purchase different kinds of cloth and necessary materials for her business because mostly she designs the quilts of brides which is a custom in Afghanistan. She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop instead of working in her house.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a school teacher from Qalqilia. One of his sons works as a tailor while the other three sons and a daughter are still college students. Talal used the first loan he took from FATEN to pay his sons' and daughter's college tuition fees and he is now taking the second one for the same purpose. 

Talal hopes that he will be able to help his sons and daughter receive their degrees and find good jobs since they are brilliant students and deserve a good chance. He is hoping that they will help him bear life's expenses soon.

The picture above of Talal was taken at FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Nasir Khan Number Chahar Group

texts.en:
This is the Nasir Khan Number Chahar Group. This group is made up of three members.

Khatera, who is in the middle in the photo, is the group leader. She is a woman who is 34 years old. She is married with five children: two sons and three daughters. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Khatera runs an embroidery business and has been working in this business for more than three years with full experience in embroidery. Now she wants to support all her family as well.

With this loan Khatera wants to buy more white cloth and other necessary things for her business. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To buy more white cloth and other necessary things

loans.name: Khafifa Mukhtar Group

texts.en:
Hamida, daughter of M. H., is the group leader of Khafifa Mukhtar Group. She is 19 years old and single. Her father is dead and she lives with her whole family of nine members.

Hamida runs a tailoring business and she has been working in this business for more then two years. Now she wants to take a loan to expand her business and support the whole family economically.

When she was informed about the AFS lending program, Hamida came to AFS and requested a loan. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fakhroodin Noori Group

texts.en:
This is Fakhroodin Noori Group. Emamudin, who is the leader of this group, is 46 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Emamudin has a retail shop. When he started this business, he had a small business and it was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business. And still he is furthering his business, attracting a good number of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time.

Therefore Emamudin has requested his second loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

Emamudin is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more food for his shop

loans.name: Jamal Nasir

texts.en:
Jamal Nasir son of H. S. is married and is the father of seven children: three sons and four daughters. His youngest son is a college student in first year and the others are students at school.

Jamal Nasir has a small retail shop and has the responsibility of paying for all the household expenses. Besides that, he has to pay the school fees and expenses of his children. Now he wants buy a taxi for his youngest son, but he can’t.

When he was informed about the loan process that is supporting the people, Jamal Nasir came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani to buy a taxi for his youngest son. He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To buy a taxi for his son

loans.name: Farid Faizi Group

texts.en:
Farid Jan, the leader of Farid Faizi Group is 29 years old. He is married and is the father of four children. He lives with his own family.

Farid Jan is a very honest, hardworking and talented man. He is a taxi driver working in Kabul and has been working in the same area for more than seven years. During this time, he has not been able to buy new parts to repair his taxi.

Farid Jan applied for a loan to start working on his taxi. He is happy with this loan and would like to thank both Kiva and AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Azima Jan Group

texts.en:
Azima is a member of Azima Jan Group. She is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She has eight kids who are all in school.

Azima has a tailoring business. In this business she makes different kinds of dresses. Today she needs a loan because she needs more stock of cloth to make dresses. With her loan she will be able to buy fifteen new rolls of cloth and this will allow her to grow her business.

Azima hopes that if her business grows she will be able to send her children to secondary school and maybe one day she will have a store where she makes dresses. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan and say that it’s a big help for small businesses.

loans.use: To buy fifteen new rolls of cloth to expand her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César es un hombre de 34 años, vive con su pareja Susana de 29 años y sus 3 menores hijos en una casa alquilada que les facilitó un familiar de ella.

César está seguro que sólo se sale adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, y mejor aún cuando se trabaja en lo que mejor se sabe hacer. Por eso, desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa, siembra en terrenos arrendados papa y arveja, y también crían tres asnos que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrícolas hacia sus terrenos. Lo que más lo motiva es cosechar, pues le permite apreciar la calidad de producción que obtuvo. Por otro lado le disgusta tener que caminar hasta más de una hora para labrar su chacra, pero no se da por vencido porque considera que su labor le es muy rentable, ya que nunca ha perdido lo invertido sino por el contrario le alcanza para solventar la educación de sus hijos, cubrir los gastos domésticos e incluso para ahorrar. Para más adelante planea construir su casa propia y comprar más hectáreas de tierra que le den mayores ingresos para que pueda brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.    

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está muy gustoso de continuar laborando activamente con su grupo, el cual está integrado por personas que respetan lo establecido en su reglamento interno y son puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero ahora solicitado tiene pensado comprar una bolsa y media de semilla de arveja, cinco sacos de fertilizantes y tres botellas de insecticidas para fumigar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
César is 34 years old. He lives with his 29-year-old wife Susana and their 3 small children in a house that they rent from a relative of hers. César is sure that he can get ahead with effort and dedication, because when he works he knows that it is what he does best. For 10 years now he and his wife have planted potatoes and peas on the fields that they rent, and have also raised three donkeys that help them to transport the supplies and agricultural tools to the fields. What motivates César the most is harvesting, since it allows him to appreciate the quality of the crop that he has obtained. On the other hand, what he doesn’t like is having to walk for mO. than an hour to work on his farm. He doesn’t give up, though, because he considers his work very worthwhile, since he has never lost what he has invested; on the contrary, he has managed to pay for his children’s education, meet his household’s expenses, and even to save some money. To get further ahead he plans to construct his own house and purchase mO. hectares of land that would give him mO. income. This would allow him to provide his family with an adequate quality of life. This is the fourth loan that César has received from Kiva partner MFP, and that is why he already knows his communal bank’s work methodology. He is very happy to continue to work actively with his group, which is made up of people who respect the group’s established rules and who are punctual in their payments. He will use the money he is now asking for to purchase one and a half bags of pea seeds, five sacks of ferilizer, and three bottles of insecticide so that he can fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un hombre de 60 años, quien vive con su segunda pareja y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia construida de madera y hojas de “humiro” (árbol de hojas extensas y fuertes). Su vivienda está ubicada a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad.   

Él cuenta con tierras propias donde cultiva café y plátano, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, quienes le ayudan principalmente en la cosecha, ya que a diario su pareja se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa y sus hijos estudian. 
Lo que más le gusta es mantener sus tierras limpias y colocar nuevas plantas, pero lo que le disgusta es cuando alguna plaga o las inclemencias del clima perjudican sus frutos; sin embargo, para Darío esto es un reto, pues en 20 años ninguna plaga o mal clima lo ha vencido.
El café es su producto más rentable debido a que anualmente, luego de comercializarlo, le deja buenos ingresos económicos con los que compra más chacras. Por otro lado, cada quince días, el plátano es el que le sirve para solventar sus gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos.
Más adelante, con el financiamiento de un programa gubernamental, piensa concretar un proyecto de reforestación con plantas maderables que viene cuidando en su vivero.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que en cada pago seguirá demostrando su responsabilidad y puntualidad, pues está bastante agradecido con la entidad y con las personas de su banco comunal porque siempre se muestran solidarios con cada uno de los integrantes. Con el dinero ahora solicitado comprará mil plantas de café, 400 plantas de frutas cítricas y contratará operarios para preparar sus terrenos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Dario is a 60-year-old man who lives with his wife and their five children in their own house, made of wood and humiro leaves (a tree with long, sturdy leaves). Their home is located 20 kilometers from the city. He has his own land where he cultivates coffee and plantain. He works with the help of his wife and four of their children, who mainly help him during the harvest, since his wife tends to the domestic chores on a daily basis and their children study. The thing he likes most is keeping his lands clean and planting new crops, but he doesn't like when a plague or the harshness of the climate harms his fruits. However, Dario considers it a challenge. In 20 years, neither plague nor bad weather has defeated him. Coffee is his most profitable product, and each year after selling it, it leaves him with a good income with which he purchases more farmland. On the other hand, every 15 days the plantains allow him to cover his domestic expenses and the education of his children. In the future, with the financing of a governmental program, he plans to create a reforestation project with timber-yielding plants that he has been raising in his nursery. This is the the fourth loan that he has requested through MFP, and he assures that with each payment he will continue demonstrating his responsibility and punctuality. He is quite grateful to the organization and the people in his communal bank, because they always show solidarity with each one of the members. With the money that he is currently requesting, he will purchase 1,000 coffee plants, 400 citric fruit plants, and he will contract workers to adequately prepare his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee and fruit plants

loans.name: Hida

texts.es:
Hida tiene 30 años, vive con Paúl de 29 años y sus 4 hijos menores de edad. Esta familia vive en su casa propia construida con madera y hojas de plátano.

El deseo de brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos mediante una actividad que le gusta y conoce, motivaron a Hida y a su esposo a que se dediquen al cultivo de plátanos y café. Los terrenos que usan son propios y otra parte son arrendados, aun así con el pago del alquiler, con las ganancias obtenidas solventan los gastos domésticos, la educación de sus hijos y les permite ahorrar para cubrir alguna eventualidad en el futuro.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años y aunque a veces le disgusta que sus plantaciones sean atacadas por alguna plaga, es perseverante y no se deja vencer. A diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y trasladarse a su chacra hasta que caiga la noche, sin embargo en la época de cosecha se va a vivir a la choza que tienen junto a sus cultivos porque contrata operarios y los tiene que atender para que respondan eficientemente al trabajo.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y señala que ha podido progresar gracias a su esmero y al apoyo de su banco comunal, integrado por personas muy responsables, con quienes le gusta trabajar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará decenas de plantas de plátano, café y sacos de abono para sus nuevas plantaciones.
texts.en:
Hida is 30 years old and lives with her husband Paul, who is 29 years old, and their 4 young children. The family lives in their own house, built with wood and plantain leaves. The desire to provide an adequate quality of life to her children through an activity that she likes and knows, motivated Hida and her husband to begin cultivating plantains and coffee. The lands that they use are their own, and another part is rented, but even with the rent payment, their earnings can cover their domestic expenses, the education of their children, and allow them to save money to cover any eventuality in the future. Hida has made a living in agriculture for 4 years, and although sometimes she gets upset when her lands are attacked by a plague, she is persistent and never gives up. On a daily basis, she wakes up at 5:00 in the morning to prepare food and go to her farmland until night falls. However, during the harvest season, she goes to live in the hut that they have near their crops, because she contracts workers and has to see to it that they work efficiently. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she indicates that she has been able to progress thanks to its care and also to the support of her communal bank, made up of very responsible people with whom she enjoys working. With the money that she is currently requesting, she will purchase dozens of plantain and coffee plants, and sacks of fertilizer for her new plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plantain and coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 32 años, por el momento vive sólo, sus padres murieron hace varios años. En busca de comodidad, él mismo construyó su casa a base de madera, ubicada en una zona de selva.

Perder a sus padres le afectó duramente, pero esta circunstancia le sirvió para valerse por sí mismo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar yuca, plátanos y café en sus terrenos propios, donde labora con la ayuda de operarios, a quienes contrata para preparar sus terrenos para la siembra y la cosecha.
Lo que más le gusta a Jaime de su actividad es mantener limpios sus terrenos, pues así asegura que sus productos sean de buena calidad y le resulten muy rentables. Con estas ganancias puede adquirir más bienes e inclusive está ampliando su pequeña casa, también está ahorrando para cuando tenga su propia familia no les haga faltar nada. Para más adelante planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas donde siembre maíz en grandes cantidades, asimismo desea convertirse en un exitoso comerciante de frutas y otros productos comestibles.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, en su banco comunal se siente bien y gracias a las charlas educativas que recibe de su asesor de crédito ha podido invertir adecuadamente el dinero. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará decenas de plantas de frutas cítricas, además preparará los terrenos que recientemente adquirió para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Jaime is 32 years old and, for the moment, he lives alone. Several years ago, his parents passed away. In search of comfort, he himself built a house out of wood, located in a forested area. Losing his parents affected him greatly, but these circumstances helped him to be able to manage life on his own. For the last 10 years he has made a living by cultivating yuca, plantains, and coffee on his own land, where he labors with the help of workers who he contracts to prepare his land for planting and the harvest. The thing that Jaime likes the most about this activity is keeping his land clean, thereby assuring that his products will be of good quality and very profitable. With these earnings he can acquire more property and expand his small house. Also, he is saving money for when he has a family so that they will not be lacking anything. Further down the road, he plans to buy more agricultural land to plant corn in large quantities. Likewise, he wishes to become a successful merchant of fruits and other edible products. This is his third loan with MFP. He feels well about his communal bank, and thanks to the educational talks that he received from his credit advisor, he has been able to adequately invest the money. With the money that he is currently requesting, he will purchase dozens of citric fruit plants, and will also prepare his recently acquired lands to plant corn.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit plants

loans.name: Mene

texts.es:
Mene es un hombre laborioso de 28 años, vive con su esposa (27), sus 4 menores hijos y su hijastra de 12 años. Está familia tiene su casa propia construida con madera y hojas, muy característico de la selva central del Perú.

Con la esperanza de disfrutar aún más de sus hijos y de tener una vejez tranquila, Mene trabaja incansablemente. “Ahora, estando en mi juventud quiero trabajar todo lo que puedo, hasta donde mis fuerzas lo permitan, porque si malgasto el dinero de qué voy a vivir, por eso invierto bien los montos que llegan a mis manos”, menciona. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa y desde hace 10 años, cultiva café, plátanos, palta, yuca y maíz en sus terrenos propios, productos que le resultan bastante rentables, ya que los cuida con dedicación para obtener buenas cosechas.
Para el futuro piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad, además desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en un espacio de su vivienda, con el generaría otros ingresos económicas aparte de la agricultura.

Este es el cuarto préstamo tiene con MFP, él está muy orgulloso y seguro de que el trabajo en su banco comunal le ayudó a ser más responsable en sus pagos, actitud que también puso en práctica en cada decisión de su vida cotidiana. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de cientos de plantas de frutas cítricas y varios sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Mene is a hard working, 28-year-old man who lives with his 27-year-old wife, their 4 young children, and his 12-year-old stepdaughter. The family has their own house, built with wood and leaves, which is very characteristic of the central forest of Peru. With the hope of enjoying his time with his children even more and living calmly when he gets older, Mene works tirelessly. "Now, being young, I want to work as much as I can, to the point my energy allows me. If I waste my money, how will I live? For this reason, I invest wisely the money that reaches my hands", he mentions. With the help of his wife, for the last 10 years he has cultivated coffee, plantains, avocados, yucca, and corn on his own land. These products are quite profitable for him, since he cares for them with dedication in order to obtain good harvests. In the future, he plans to plant in greater quantity, and furthermore, he desires to set up a grocery store in a space in his home. With this, he would be able to generate other income aside from agriculture. This is the fourth loan he has requested through MFP. He is very proud and certain that the work in his communal bank helped him to become more responsible in his payments; an attitude that he also puts in practice in every decision of his everyday life. The money that he is currently requesting, he plans to invest in the purchase of hundreds of citric fruit plants and several sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nérida es una mujer de 26 años, se caracteriza por ser alegre y muy luchadora, está casada con Efraín de 26 años y tienen 4 menores hijos. Todos viven en la comodidad de su casa propia en un zona alta de la selva central peruana.

Café, plátanos, maíz, yuca y fréjol son los productos que cultiva desde hace 10 años, en compañía de su esposo; ambos desde tempranas horas de la mañana salen rumbo a sus chacras localizadas aproximadamente a una hora de camino desde su casa. Esta caminata diaria le gusta mucho a Nérida porque en el trayecto conversa mucho con su pareja y siente que eso fortalece su relación y les brinda estabilidad emocional a sus hijos, puesto que existe confianza. Asimismo, juntos administran los ingresos que perciben en cada cosecha, invirtiendo el dinero buscando el bienestar de toda la familia, además de mantener un ahorro constante para adquirir algunos bienes en el futuro.

Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, Nérida es la titular del crédito, pero siempre asiste junto a su esposo a las reuniones del banco comunal y es como si él también fuera parte, pues son bastante unidos y les gusta trabajar en cada proyecto que emprende el grupo, como por ejemplo; ahora se está organizando para un proyecto de reforestación en su zona. Con el dinero solicitado comprarán cuatrocientas plantas de frutas cítricas y doscientas de café, puesto que ya cuenta con un vivero donde las colocará conforme vaya plantando.
texts.en:
Nerida is a 26-year-old woman, characterized as being very happy and having a fighting spirit. She is married to Efrain, who is 26 years old, and they have 4 young children. They all live in the comfort of their own home in the upper zone of the central forest of Peru. Coffee, plantains, corn, yucca, and beans are the products that she has cultivated for the last 10 years, with help from her husband. They both leave early in the morning for their farmland, located approximately an hour away from their house. Nerida likes this daily walk a lot, because on the way, she and her husband talk a lot, and she feels that this strengthens their relationship and provides emotional stability to their children, since there is trust. Likewise, together they manage the income that they receive during each harvest, investing the money with regard to the well-being of the entire family. Also, they maintain a savings account in order to acquire some goods in the future. This is the fourth loan that they have with MFP. Nerida is the loan holder, but she always attends the communal bank meetings together with her husband, and it is as if he were also a part of it. They are very united, and they like to work on each project that the group undertakes. For example, currently they are getting organized for a reforestation project in their region. With the money they are requesting, they will purchase 400 citric fruit plants and 200 coffee plants, since they already have a nursery in which to plant them.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit and coffee plants

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 30 años, está casado con Jovana, también de 30 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una zona de la selva central del Perú.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a cultivar café, plátanos, maíz y achote en sus terrenos propios; eventualmente le ayuda su esposa y también contrata operarios, principalmente para el plantado, mantenimiento y cosecha de sus tierras. La agricultura le gusta mucho y le es rentable porque le ha permitido construir su casa y comprar algunos muebles, pero sobretodo cubrir la educación de sus hijos y los gastos domésticos sin problema.
Para más adelante se proyecta a construir la otra parte de su casa, acondicionando los espacios para poder convertirse en un comerciante mayorista de frutas, además continuará con su proyecto de construir un vivero bien amplio.

Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, reconoce que los integrantes de su banco comunal son bastante unidos, es por eso que le gusta trabajar con ellos en busca de un futuro mejor para cada uno y para toda su comunidad. Con los dos mil soles que solicita comprará decenas de bolsas para empacar el café, también adquirirá 5 sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 30, is married to Jovana, who is also 30. They have four minor children. They all live in their own house, which is in an area of the central jungle of Perú. For six years he has been growing coffee, bananas, corn, and “achote” (annato, a spice) on his own land. Sometimes his wife helps him, and he also contracts workers to primarily plant, maintain, and harvest his land. He really likes farming, and it is profitable for him. It has allowed him to build his house and buy some furniture. But, most of all, it covers his children’s education and the household expenses with no problem. Later he plans on building another part of his house and setting up spaces for him to be able to become a fruit wholesale merchant. Also, he will continue with his project of building a large nursery. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He realizes that the members of his communal bank are very united, and that is why he likes to work with them. They are looking for a better future for each one and for all of their community. He will use the 2,000 PEN that he is requesting to buy dozens of bags to pack the coffee. He will also get five sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and bags for packing coffee

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
SANTA ROSA es una alcancía comunal de once personas quienes integran desde hace un año y cuatro meses, tiempo que han demostrado responsabilidad, solidaridad entre ellos. Aunque cada uno tiene objetivos distintos se caracterizan por ser personas muy luchadoras, conozcamos en esta oportunidad a Amalia y Rebeca. 

Amalia trabaja ayudando a su tía en el negocio de alquiler de vestido para compromisos sociales como matrimonio, quince años, promoción de colegio, instituto y universidades, lo hace cuatro años, durante el tiempo transcurrido el negocio ha cambiado mucho al principio contaba con una mercadería de veinticincos vestidos y treinta ternos era todo lo que tenía. El empeño que puso en este negocio conjunto con su tía hicieron que creciera de a poquito, no fue sencillo lograrlo porque en este negocio la mercadería se renueva cada cierto tiempo hablamos de cada cuatro meses por lo menos o dependiendo la tendencia de la moda o el gusto de la clientela. Los préstamos que recibió le ayudaron para invertir en zapatos y accesorios que le faltaba. Con este trabajo Amalia apoya a su pareja en lo gatos de su familia, la responsabilidad que tienen ambos de criar y educar a sus tres hijos de 14, 13 y 11 años de edad, quienes aún estudian en el colegio.
En la actualidad su mercadería asciende a doscientos cincuenta entre prendas de caballeros, damas y niñas y 40 pares de zapatos. Se acerca la época escolar en donde Amalia necesita matricular, comprarle el uniforme y útiles escolares a sus hijos y a veces no es suficiente el dinero, por ello Amalia necesita del préstamo en esta oportunidad para comprarles los útiles escolares con la mitad del préstamo y la diferencia en algunos vestidos cortos de acuerdo a la estación que estamos (verano).

Rebeca también está inmersa en el negocio de prendas en alquiler hace año y medio a sus treinta y dos años es madre soltera de una hija de siete años, fue este el motivo que decidió trabajar así, primero empezó a vender comida en un puesto cerca de un mercado solo estuvo un año así, lo tuvo que cerrar porque los ingresos que generaba no cubría con sus necesidades. 
El actual negocio de alquiler de ropa le resulta mejor, claro que en ocasiones tuvo algunos altibajos pero el trato que brinda Rebeca a sus clientes la ayudado en conservar su negocio, lo mejoró y progresó no penó alcanzar a tener trescientos vestidos y ciento cuarenta zapatos además carteras lo que en un inicio tenía veinte vestidos y 15 zapatos lo hizo con la ganancias que obtenía y préstamo que obtuvo. Seguir invirtiendo en mercadería para luego alquilar otro puesto con la finalidad de darle lo mejor a su niña es su objetivo de Rebeca.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Communal Bank is comprised of 11 people who have been members for one year and four months. During that time they have demonstrated responsibility and teamwork. Even though they each have different objectives, they are characterized as being tenacious people. We take this opportunity to get to know Amalia and Rebeca. Amalia works helping her aunt in her business of renting clothes for social events like weddings, celebrating 15th birthdays, and promotions for schools, institutes and universities. She has done this for four years. During that time the business has changed a lot. In the beginning their merchandise consisted of 25 dresses and 30 suits. That was all they had. The effort that she put into this business, along with her aunt’s effort, made the business grow a bit. It was not easy to do because in this business the merchandise is updated every so often. We are talking about at least four months, depending on the style or the customer’s preferences. The loans that she received helped her to invest in the shoes and accessories that she needed. With this work Amalia helps her life partner with the family expenses. It is the responsibility that they both have to raise and educate their three children. The children are 14, 13, and 11. They go to school. Currently, her merchandise has risen to 250 outfits for men, women, and children and 40 pairs of shoes. School season is approaching, and Amalia needs to register her children and buy them school uniforms and school supplies. At times she does not have enough money. That is why she now needs the loan to buy school supplies with half of the loan. She will use the rest of the money to buy short dresses that correspond to the season we are in (summer). Rebeca has also been involved in the business of renting outfits. She has done this for one and a half years. She is 32 years old, and she is the single mother of a seven year old daughter. This was her motivation for deciding to work this way. First she started selling food in a stand close to a market. She only did that for a year. She had to close because the income generated did not cover their necessities. Her current business of renting clothes is better for her. Of course, she has had some ups and downs, but the service Rebeca gives her customers has helped her keep her business. She improved and developed it until she had 300 outfits, 140 pairs of shoes, and purses. When she started she had 20 outfits and 15 pairs of shoes. She did it with the earnings she obtained and the loan she got. She will keep investing in merchandise in order to rent another stand. Rebeca’s objective is to give her little girl the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy short dresses

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. (0) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Banyubiru, Jembrana, Bali. Ni Putu is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ratna S. Group (MUK-0008).

Ni Putu is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


*****************************************************
NI PUTU A. (0) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota BANYUBIRU-JEMBRANA-BALI. NI PUTU adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah RATNA S. (MUK-0008).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI PUTU sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI PUTU menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, NI PUTU bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI PUTU meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,400,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Despite the challenges she faces every day because of being poor, Preciosa remains energetic and is enjoying a simple life together with her husband and three children, whose ages range from 5 to 10 years old. Her heart is filled with dreams and inspiration because of the love and support she receives from her family. It keeps her moving on and to achieving the vision of success beyond poverty.

With the use of her tribike (bicycle with a sidecar), at times together with her children and husband, Preciosa roams around the entire village to buy junk and scrap. A large volume of this will be sold to the owner of a huge junk shop. Therefore she is requesting a loan which will be used to finance the growth of her scrap/junk buy-and-sell business.

Preciosa’s kind of business is friendly to the environment since it helps people manage their garbage well by separating it and selling that which is recyclable. Aside from providing income to her family, her business can also provide income to people and children in their village and around the town.

Through her business, Preciosa and her husband are happy to collect junk from all over the town and make money from it.

loans.use: To purchase more junk and recyclable items to sell

loans.name: Ma. Rosita Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Rosita Fe B. is a young and simple woman who is married to a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver. When asked why she married a driver, she said that he is a sweet lover and a father to their three children whose ages are from three months old to three years old. Her husband and children give her reason to live happily, despite being poor. They are her inspiration to aim for a better kind of life someday by growing her own business and being more productive.
 
In 2008, Rosita has able to achieve her goal of putting up her own “sari-sari” (variety) store business. This was made possible through a loan she received through ASHI after she became a member. Unfortunately, it did not prosper after a year because it had accumulated a huge amount of receivables from her customers who live in the neighborhood. Worst was the fact they they are also very poor economically. Thus, Rosita has nothing to do for them to pay back.

Though Rosita had struggled from losing her business while still paying for her loan and supporting the needs of her family, still she was able to cope because of the support of her husband. Now, she is requesting another loan from Kiva through ASHI because she and her husband will be starting a new business which is selling fish. The proceeds of this business will be used to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
58 year-old Lolita T. feels sad that her previous business, her “sari-sari” (variety) store, failed. Although, it was just small, its income was the only source of income to support her daily needs, as well as of some of her children's and grand-children's needs. She is already a widow and all of her three children have their own families now. Because her children are poor, in economic terms, Lolita as a mother couldn’t do anything but support them in her own little way. Unforntanely, while busying herself supporting them she lost control of her business. Despite that failure, she still feels happy that her business has helped her children and their families. Moreover, she was able to pay back the whole loan she received from ASHI for that business and now she is able to request another loan to begin a new business, which is hog/pig fattening.

For Lolita, hog fattening is sort of like saving money in a pig. Indeed after four months of fattening, the pig will be sold (either slaughtered or alive) and by then her capital will have produced a small profit. Once she raises more pigs and sells more, her profits will be doubled along with her capital. With that, Lolita is hopeful that someday she can afford to support the higher education of her grand-children.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Porcesa

texts.en:
For 62 year-old Porcesa E. dreaming of a better life is not over despite the years she's spent travelling and searching for a way to bring her family out of poverty. Porcesa is a wife and a mother of four children. Her family doesn't have their own house and all of her children haven't graduated from college. However, despite her frustrations, she still feels happy because she has been able to support the education of her three children in college with the help of her business profits, though only one has graduated. 

Now, Porcesa is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to support the necessary expenses of her rice farming business, which is managed by her husband. The rice they will harvest will be sold to retailers in town, while the proceeds of the business will help her achieve her dream of helping her youngest, 25 year old, son graduate from college and building their own house.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria A. is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to purchase another fishing boat to be managed by her eldest 23-year-old son. Candelaria is frustrated by her son’s decision not to continue his education because he thinks his parents cannot support him financially with the small profit from their business. On the other hand, she still feels happy that her son has taken the responsibility of helping them run their fishing business instead of rebelling against their poor life status. With that, her business eventually grew a bit, and she was able to support her second child’s education in college. Soon her youngest child will enter college; thus, Candelaria has to grow her business further to increase her profit to support her children and achieve her dream of improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing motor boat

loans.name: Elzevir

texts.en: Since Elzevir R. became a membership of ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, her performance in terms of repayment, attendance at the weekly meetings in the ASHI center and her business have been excellent. She is one of the most admired members of the institution for she has been able to sustain her business despite being poor. The love and support of her husband makes her feel inspired and complete as a woman, despite not having her own children. She has not felt bad and disappointed because of this, as she wants to be financially prepared before having her own child. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to grow her “sari-sari” (variety store) and to increase her profit. Once this has been done, she will have a child, and by then she will be able to support his needs and give him a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her "sari-sari" store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jorgen

texts.en: Jorgen T. is a newly-recognized member of ASHI. Her desire to start up her own business in fish sales led her to such a decision with the support of her husband. The vision of her two children enjoying a life that is not under the umbrella of poverty inspired her to request a loan that will be invested into a business. Profits gained from the business will allow her to augment her husband’s income; hence the needs of her children will be supported. Jorgen now is 29 years of age while her two children are five and nine years old. Considering the amount time before their children will go to high school and college, Jorgen and her husband still have time to grow their business in order to finance their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Donna Joy

texts.en: Thirty-two-year-old Donna Joy has been in the tailoring and dress-making business for a long time now. However, she never achieved the desired growth of her business because she lacks financial capital. Being poor and earning a small and sporadic income, supporting the growing needs of her business as well as supporting the demands of her costumers from the neighborhood is very hard. Therefore, Donna Joy recently joined ASHI and made a request for a loan. Her husband supported her decision because he knew that his wife’s intention was to augment his small income and to give their three children (who range from age five to eight) a better kind of life and that someday, once her business has grown, the profits will support the children's financial needs to graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other materials for her tailoring/dress-making business.

loans.name: Ewo

texts.en:
Ewo E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and simsim at the market and is requesting a loan to stock beans and pealed dried cassava to sell. Ewo is 20 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for beans and maize flour.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy beans and pealed dried cassava to sell.

loans.name: Williams

texts.en: Williams is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 38 years old, married without children. He hopes to have children very soon. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He sells medicines and also treats people in his community. He has been in this business for a long time. Williams is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more medicines sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Namadi

texts.en:
Namadi J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell at home.  Namadi is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacer. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer to sell at home.

loans.name: Folrenia

texts.en:
Florenia is a very productive mother and grandmother for her children and grandchildren. Previously, she sold pigs that she fattened and has able to help her children support the education of her grandchildren. Out of her profit she bought another pig to replace the one she sold. Furthermore, Florenia has able to sustain her variety store whose profits have provided her with her daily needs until now.

For a hard working "Lola" (grand mother) and "Nanay" (mother), her dreams would mean nothing if not because of the support of people around the world through Kiva and if not because of their loan entrusted to her through ASHI. With that, Florenia is so thankful for the opportunity extended to her and her family. Since she repaid the whole amount she received from Kiva through a previous loan, now she is requesting a much larger amount, which she will use to purchase another pig/hog for fattening in addition to the one she has. Once it is sold, her profits will doubled, as will the capital. The pigs can either be sold alive or slaughtered to meat vendors or people around their village.

loans.use: To purcahse additional pigs for fattening and their feed until they are ready for sale.

loans.name: Omoladun

texts.en: Omoladun O. is a hard-working and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. Currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family's needs. She wants to take out a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to increase her business income. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with 5 children and she is 50 years old. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Florenda H. is a mother to seven children. She is married and lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She has been involved in rice farming for almost nine years now. According to her, failure was not absent in her years of farming. But, together with her husband, she continues to work hard to be able to provide for her family's needs.

Florenda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which she said she would use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs and also to pay the laborers who help at her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
27-year-old Adelfa has two children ages 3 and 4. She has been married to her husband Johnniel for four years now. She farms for a living. Like other farmers, she also experiences failure, especially when pests attack her farm. But, she still does her best to make her rice farm productive because it is the only source of income her family has.

Adelfa is a member of CEVI and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use this loan to acquire farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Patriselda

texts.en:
Patriselda T. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Patriselda is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onoins to sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is a hard working and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to grow her business. Currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family's needs. She wants to take a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to increase her business income. She has been in this business for a long time. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She is married with 4 children and she is 50 years old. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza D. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bed sheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sandals and shoes to sell. Tereza is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy three sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sandles and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Egbe

texts.en:
I. is 54 years old, and he is married with 8 children. I. is very reliable when it comes to repayment and repays his loans on time. He has been in LAPO microfinance for some years with a good record. With the profits from the pig farm, he takes care of his family and also manages his business. He has the support of his wife and children for his farming business.

I. hopes to expand his farm by purchasing more pigs. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more pigs for farming and to maximize his profit. He appreciates all Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for farming.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza A. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread cooked by frying it in oil and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour for making more bread to sell. Zaza is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour to make more bread to sell.

loans.name: Kafayatu

texts.en: Kafayatu J. is a hardworking and honest woman. She loves her business so much because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband. She sells engine oil at retail prices in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She has drums that she uses to store the engine oil to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She is married, with 3 children and she is 40 years old. Her husband also works to support their home. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is a 27-year-old mother of one child.  She says that she is a hardworking lady who has a new grocery business that she started four months ago. She sold beauty products before she started this business. She wants to take out her first loan of KES 80,000 with Faulu Kenya. Her plan is to open a restaurant with the loan. She hopes to register her business as a company so that she can operate the business smoothly.

loans.use: To open a restaurant.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth sells bags of maize in Oyo state, Nigeria where she lives with her family. She is a hard-working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more bags of maize to sell. Maize is used in Nigeria to prepare mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods. She is married, with 4 children, and she is 36 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
Yolen A. is one of the very good members of ASHI and is a very good leader of the ASHI center. Happiness can always be seen through her face and in the way she perceives every trial she encountered on her way towards achieving her dreams for her family and even when listening to the problems of her co-members at ASHI. From her previous loan she has able to have a backyard poultry and rice farming business. Yolen now is requesting a Kiva loan through ASHI to use to support her desired business growth. Since her children have their own families now, the profits her business will make will go toward supporting her grandchildren until they graduate from college.

Being a wife, mother, and a friend to her co-members in ASHI, Yolen feels happy every time she can extend a helping hand. Through the success of her business, she hopes to help more people, especially her own family members.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and to purchase necessary farm inputs for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is a business woman. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for 6 years. She hopes to grow her business. Dried fish in Nigeria is used to prepare mouth watering Nigerian soup like “egusi” (melon soup). She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She is married with 2 children and she is 39 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Dorcas says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Muthui

texts.en: Muthui is a 45 year old married man who is blessed with seven children.   His wife is a farmer, while he works in a quarrying business.  He has been in the quarrying business for over ten years and he has employed four people.  He learned the skills for operating this business from previous employment in the mines.  He has requested Kes.20,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase quarrying equipment.  He hopes to buy a piece of land and a motorbike in the future.  He sees himself expanding his business and increasing the number of his employees in a few years' time.  He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy equipment for quarrying

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a businessman and he is an honest and hardworking man. He is married with a child and he is 32 years old.

Michael sells rechargeable cellphone accessories and he also has a pig farm. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. 

Michael is requesting for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more rechargeable cellphone accessories to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone accessories to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
60-year-old Esther hails from Benin in Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children.

Esther is into pig farming - she rears and sells pigs to make a living. She has been in this business for some years and with the proceeds from the pig’s farm she is able to take care of her family’s needs and reinvest in her farming business.

Esther hopes to expand her pig farm; she wants to purchase more pigs and other farm inputs. She is requesting the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more pigs to raise. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for her farm

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 33-year-old married man with three children in school. He was previously selling secondhand shoes but has now been running a pharmacy for nine years. He also earns extra income from his pool table. Ezekiel was not available at his business for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Since Ezekiel joined Faulu Kenya, his business and living standards have improved. He wants to buy more medicine and therefore he has requested a loan of Kes 40,000.

Ezekiel hopes to open up a wholesale business for selling medicine. He sees himself having a vehicle for transporting his products in a few years time. He describes himself as a hardworking and a self-motivated man.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en:
Bunmi F. is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband works to support their home.

Bunmi is a hardworking woman. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for five years. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bunmi hopes to own a supermarket and expand her business in the future. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 47-year-old married man and is the breadwinner in the family. He is employed as a teacher and also operates a hardware and motorcycle spare-parts shop. He has been running the business for four years.

Daniel is a member of Faulu Kenya and he wants to take a loan of Kes 20,000. He plans to buy shelves and more spare parts. He is positive about his business and he is aiming to succeed. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase shelves and more spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is married with five children and she is 40 years old. Her husband works to support their home.

Funke is a friendly and hardworking woman and sells for long hours to support her home. She sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers and is well known in her community. She has a drum that she uses to store her kerosene to sell.

Funke hopes to be a major kerosene distributor in the future. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says “THANK YOU” to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 26-year-old focussed man who operates a taxi business which has been running for four years. He is married and is blessed with one child.

Jackson also does farming together with his wife. He plans to buy maize seedlings so as to expand his farm’s produce since the area is fertile. Hence he has requested Kes 60,000.

Jackson hopes to buy more dairy cows in the future. He also dreams of buying another car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings

loans.name: Dorathy

texts.en:
Dorathy is a hardworking and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children and she is 42 years old.

Dorathy sells foodstuffs and clothes at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business since, currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family's needs. She wants to take a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and clothes to increase her business income.

Dorathy has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ishia

texts.en:
Ishia sells palm oil and groundnut (peanut) oil, a business she really loves doing as it gives her the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in the business for over six years.

Ishia wants to stock her shop with more palm oil and groundnut oil, as this will improve her profit-making. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more palm oil and groundnut oil to sell.

33-year-old Ishia is married with eight children. She and her family live in Benin City, Nigeria. She supports her husband in providing the family needs like feeding, clothing and buying school books for the children. She says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en:
Foluke is a hardworking and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with a child and she is 47 years old.

Foluke sells fruit like bananas at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business as, currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family needs. She wants to take a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more fruit to increase her business income.

Foluke has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Nairobi-based business lady who owns a driving school. She has been in this business for six years and serves walk-in clients. She is requesting a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy office equipment.

Jane says that Faulu has taught her how to keep records for her business since she never used to do it. A mother of two, Jane hopes to expand her business to new locations, add to her fleet of vehicles and improve her living standards. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To buy office equipment

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with a child and she is 30 years old. She is a friendly and hardworking woman who sells for long hours to support her home. Her husband also works to support their home.

Deborah sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers and is well-known in her community. She has a stall where she sells her foodstuffs and hopes to be a major foodstuffs distributor in the future. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

Deborah says “THANK YOU” to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 45 years old and married with six children ranging in age from 10 to 27. Her two youngest children are currently enrolled in school, along with one grandson that just began his education.

Priscah has been farming for three years now near Kitale, Kenya, and her focus is on tomatoes and other vegetable production which she then sells to local retail outlets. She spoke of a few challenges in her business, citing unstable markets as her main concern. She also spoke of diseases being common in the area with a number of livestock affected at times.

Priscah requested this loan of Kes 25,000, her second with Juhudi Kilimo, to start a poultry farm. She wants to expand out of just vegetable production and she says that the extra income will assist her family in alleviating poverty and in providing for better education in the coming years.

With an outlook to the future, Priscah wants to own at least two quality dairy cows in the next five years in order to further diversify her business.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn and sodabi liqueur

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 51-year-old married man with two children in school. He is a self-employed estate management and commission agent. He got into this business after gaining experience and skills because he was formerly employed in this sector. He has been operating his business for eight years.

Besides his business, Gilbert has rental houses where he earns extra income. He plans to install water for sale in his rental houses and hence he requested Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. This will be his fifth loan from the organization.

Since Gilbert is the breadwinner in his family, he feels he has to work hard to make ends meet. Therefore, he hopes to acquire more properties in the future and succeed in his business.

loans.use: To install water for sale in his rental houses

loans.name: Serifatu

texts.en:
Serifatu is a hardworking woman. She sells colorful sarongs and ladies’ bags to make a living in Nigeria. She is a very busy woman and she is happy because she makes sales daily from her sarongs and bags businesses.

Serifatu hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more sarongs and ladies’ bags to sell.

Serifatu lives in Oyo Sate, Nigeria. She is 46 years old and married with five children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and ladies' bags to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a married man with two school-age children, owns a shop where he sells phones, gadgets and watches. He has twelve years of experience in the sales business. He opened his shop in 2009. He used to sell only watches but he developed his business from selling only watches to selling other items.

This is Ali’s second loan from Kiva and he's asking for $1,500 to buy additional watches, phones and gadgets for his shop. He's thankful for the growth of his business and the profit he is starting to make.

loans.use: To buy additional watches, phones and gadgets

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna is a 32-year-old married woman. A mother of three young children, she opened a clothes and women’s accessories shop five years ago to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for their children's schooling.

Today, Roudayna is asking for her second loan of $1,800 to buy additionA. merchandise to fill her shop with because it's situated in a busy area. She has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by her shop and she needs to be always on top of their requirements.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 39-year-old married man and the father of four young children. He has been working as a builder for the past ten years. He works hard to satisfy the needs of his family and all the related expenses.

Ahmad works on a freelance basis upon the request of his clients and in collaboration with some entrepreneurs. Over the years, his business has grown and he has a good number of projects.

Today, Ahmad is asking to borrow $1,500 for the second time after successfully repaying his first loan. He will use the loan to buy wood and more construction tools he needs.

loans.use: To buy wood and more construction tools

loans.name: Neddy

texts.en:
Neddy is 51 years old and married with seven children. They range in age from 17 to 33 and her three youngest children are currently enrolled in school.
