Neddy owns and runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over twenty years. She operates a kiosk at the market where she sells fruit, vegetables and maize as her primary source of income.

There are a number of challenges that Neddy must overcome and she cited issues such as price fluctuation and the seasonal aspect of farming making income inconsistent.

Neddy recently completed her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for Kes 51,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow, and to expand her stock of poultry. She says that the extra income from this loan will help support her children through the rest of their education.

Neddy also wants to help her daughter open a business as a hair stylist, as she recently completed the necessary training. In the future, Neddy would like to keep expanding her business as she now has access to more capital.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to expand her poultry stock

loans.name: Tabet

texts.en:
Tabet, a married man with one child, has worked as a construction entrepreneur for the past twenty years. He takes on home projects in his town and its surroundings. He is well known in the whole region and he is the one supporting his family with this business. 

Today, Tabet plans to take on a new big project and that's why he is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy wood to be ready for the new project and to be in demand by his customers.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 43-year-old single mother of two children. She started a scrap metal business four years ago after employment as a milk vendor. Her business is aimed at keeping the environment clean because she recycles materials. She has employed three people who assist her in running the business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has become financially stable. She plans to take out a loan of Kes 50,000 to invest in the business by buying scrap metal. She hopes to expand her business and buy a plot which she can develop and build rental houses. She sees herself employing more people if her business expands and she owns more property. From a personal perspective, Esther is hard working and she has big dreams that she is geared towards achieving.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is into fashion designing. She makes clothes in different styles for her customers and also sells sarongs to earn a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. The creative nature of the fashion business makes it more interesting to her and she has been in the business for over six years.                               

She hopes to improve and expand her business; she is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

Esther is 35 years old, happily married with four children who are doing well. From the proceeds, she could assist her husband in keeping the home financially. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Olajide Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 41 years old, married with three children. He hopes to give his children quality education. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He has a poultry farm where he rears poultry birds to sell at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. Micheal is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more poultry birds and feed. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and feed

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 39-year-old mother of two children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer while she runs a retail shop where she sells cereals and other consumer goods. She has been in this business for 18 years.

She is an active member of Faulu Kenya and has previously taken out five loans worth Kes. 140,000. She plans to take out a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy cereals and retail goods for sale. She hopes to improve her living standards and open up other business outlets for selling consumer goods. She describes herself as a confident and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy cereals and retail goods for sale

loans.name: Marky

texts.en:
Marky is 55 years old and married with 10 children, ranging in age from four to 20 years old. Only three of her children are currently attending school, as she lacks the necessary school fees to send all of them.  

Marky runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over 20 years. She used to specialize in vegetable sales, but lately has moved more into milk production, which she sells at the local market. Marky has to deal with a few issues in her business, including difficult access to markets that may be very far from her home.

Marky successfully completed her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo and has now requested this loan for Kes. 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her first loan took her a step forward in life, and now this loan will help her acquire a new, more productive dairy cow that will increase her income. She hopes this will assist her in meeting her family's needs and help pay the school fees for her children who are currently unable to attend school.

Marky has an optimistic outlook for the future, and already has a number of plans in mind for her business. She wants to own at least six high breed dairy cows and run a poultry farm. She also wants to purchase a motorbike so she is able to transport her produce to market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is a 24-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop for six years. A special feature of his work is that he knows how to treat his customers. When Sari first started his business, he experienced some financial issues. He decided to set up his business because he wanted to have independent work, he had learned the skills in an academy and he had good practices. He was confident that thanks to his experience and networking, he would be well known and it would allow him to increase his clients who are his friends and neighbors.

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to further improve his work.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 51 years old, married with four children. He hopes to give his children quality education. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He sells chemicals and groceries at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more groceries and chemicals to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and chemicals to sell

loans.name: Nabiel

texts.en:
Nabiel is a 48-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He has been working as a car repairer for over 15 years. He also sells car spare parts. His clients can be anyone from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties, whereas today he is facing competition, and he needs to be aware of new sophisticated tools, and purchasing these is a bit difficult since they cost a lot.

Therefore, he is requesting a second loan from A. Majmoua (knowing that he paid his previous loan on time) in order to purchase tools for his garage. These will allow him to improve his work quality, efficiency and financiA. situation. When Nabiel opened his garage, he decided to set up his business because he likes his work and he also wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to further improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono sells and supplies female and male clothing. She goes from office to office to sell clothes to her customers. She is very happy with the nature of her business because it gives her the opportunity to meet different people from different backgrounds. She started the business two years ago and has been successful. 

Rono wants her business to grow continuously, so she is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. With it she can sell more clothes, make more profit and save more for the future. Rono is 29 years old, married and her husband is a civil servant in Lagos State. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Farid Ahmad

texts.en:
Farid Ahmad is 30 years old, married and the father of two children. He is educated and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the one who is responsible for his whole family. He has a catering shop and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but he hasn't been able to enlarge his business. Now he needs a loan to expand his catering shop and make a good monthly income for his family.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis. With this loan he wants to buy necessary items for his shop. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary items for his catering shop

loans.name: Zahy

texts.en: Zahy, a 50-year-old man living in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their four children, has owned a shoe shop for eight years. He decided on opening his shop because of his extensive experience in sales, which led to a great deal of networking.  When he first started his work, he had some difficulties making himself known to the public because he didn’t have a budget for advertising, having to content himself with word of mouth; as well, early on he  didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed merchandise for his shop. To improve his work, Zahy turned to microfinance and is now requesting his fifth loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the coming season. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 28 years old and lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife. He has been working as a gypsum designer/plasterer for nine years. His customers are people from his region. When he first started his business, the only difficulty he faced was making himself known to potential customers. He decided to set up his business because of his experience. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools and gypsum for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and gypsum for his work

loans.name: Labiba

texts.en:
Labiba is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with her husband and two children. She has been working as a sewer and embroiderer for over ten years. She works from home, repairing all type of clothes and also making clothes, scarves, cushions covers and more. Labiba is successful in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her customers, who are mostly friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues because she did not have a lot of customers. Labiba decided to set up her business because of her experience – she has been sewing from a young age. She enjoys her work. 
Labiba has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to repair her sewing machine and purchase thread for her work. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and purchase thread

loans.name: Shir Khwaja

texts.en:
Shir K., son of K. S., is 25 years old and married. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, with his five children and large family.
Shir K. has been running a general store for more than five years. He wants to expand his business and buy general merchandise for his shop in order to have more customers and a higher income. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN. He is happy to be involved in a process that supports entrepreneurs to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food for his general store

loans.name: Elhadji

texts.fr: Elhadji est une homme de 45 ans, marié avec 2 enfants. Il habite a Ziguinchor, la plus grande ville dans la region de Casamance, au Senegal. Elhadji est une vendeuse de bois, une métier il a fait pour les dix dernieres années. Le bois qu’il vend est tres bon pour les meubles, les portes et les fenetres. Avec ce prêt de Kiva il voudrait stocker plus de bois et grandir son affaire
texts.en:
Elhadji, aged 45, is married and the father of two children. He lives in Ziguinchor, the largest city in the region of Casamance in Senegal. Elhadji is a retailer of lumber, a job he has done for the past ten years. The lumber he sells is perfect for furniture, doors and windows. Elhadji will use his Kiva loan to stock up with lumber and expand his business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is 46 years old and lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and five children. Halim has been selling perfumes, deodorant, make-up, shampoo and hair coloring for more than ten years. His customers are people from his region. He decided to set up this business in order to have independent work. Before opening his shop, he worked as a home painter, but from an early age he always wanted to have a shop of his own. Therefore, ten years ago, he took the decision to stop working as a home painter and open his shop. While he still sometimes works as a home painter in his free time, he only does so as a favor to his friends and family. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues as he faced competition.
Halim has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to continue to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 42 years old, married, and has two children. He is a friendly and hardworking man. Taiwo is a laboratory scientist, but he loves his poultry business and it is highly profitable. He has a poultry farm where he rears poultry birds and sells eggs. He hopes to expand his business in future by adding a fish pond to his poultry business. Taiwo is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds and feed. He thanks all Kiva lenders in anticipation for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and feed

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Bassirou D. est une homme de 33 ans, qui est mariée avec deux enfants. Bassirou est la propriétaire d’une atelier mechanique dans la ville de Ziguinchor. Avec 7 autre ouvriers qui sont employé par lui, ils reparent des motos. A cause de (ou grace a) les horrible rues, il a beaucoup de clients. Avec le prêt de Kiva il voudrait acheter les provisions pour les prochaines mois.
texts.en:
Bassirou D., aged 33, is married and the father of two children. He is the owner of a mechanical workshop in the city of Ziguinchor. With the help of seven workers he has hired, he repairs motorcycles. Because of (or thanks to) the roads in dreadful condition, he has many customers. Bassirou will use his Kiva loan to build up his inventory for the months to come.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up his mechanical workshop

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat. a 45-year-old hardworking woman who lives in Oyo State, Nigeria, is married with five children.  She sells groceries at retail prices for long hours to support her husband and hopes to own a supermarket and expand her business in the future. Adijat has been in this field for many years and uses her business experience to attract and retain more customers. She hopes for a loan amount NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Bibi Shimen Gull Group

texts.en: A. Habib, the 19-year-old unmarried son of A. S., is the leader of Bibi Shimen Gull group. Part of a large family, he lives in Kabul, Afghanistan where he has been selling a variety of fruit from a cart for more than seven years. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more fruits, especially those that are most in demand. As well, he wants to attract more clients and make a good income for his whole family. A. is happy about the microloan process that can help solve entrepreneurs’ problems.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for his business.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Tina has sold wine and dry gin in her shop located in the front of her house. Operating this business every day of the week except Sunday, she uses the profits to take care of herself and her children.

Tina is a single parent charged with the responsibility of meeting the needs of her two children in the areas of clothing, shelter, feeding and paying of school fees. She wants to expand her business and hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more dry gin and wine to sell. Tina therefore thanks LAPO microfinance and Kiva for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more dry gin and wine to sell.

loans.name: Adedotun

texts.en: Adedotun, an honest and hardworking man, produces and sells paint in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He has been in this business, which he loves, for four years, and he hopes to own a big paint company in the future. Adedotun, 31 years old and married with a child, is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more materials to produce more paint to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce paint

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana, a 26-year single woman living with her two parents, owns a jewelry shop where she produces both bags and hand-made jewelry products requested by her clients. She has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years and is very talented in making beautiful designs.

Today, Rana is requesting to borrow $1,200 for the second time to buy supplies such as beads, accessories, bags etc. to offer more products to her clients and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as beads, accessories, bags

loans.name: Hina Group

texts.en:
Fraidoon, son of G., the leader of Hina Group, is an educated 22-year-old who has operated a retail shop for more than four years. Fraidoon's business is small but with a good number of customers. When Fraidoon got his first loan he completed his store stock and then continued his business with greater success. 

Now he is requesting a second loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his brothers in the business, working hard to make a better future for all his family. Confident that he can further expand his business, Fraidoon thanks lenders Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Type Of Business Group

texts.en:
Nancy V. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Type of Business.  She is married and has six children who range in age from 6 to 25 years old.  Nancy was never able to attend school due to poverty.
For 25 years, Nancy has been selling dried fish and vegetables at the Smell No Taste Market in Harbel. She says that she provides her customers with high quality food, which keeps them coming to her for business.
Nancy plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish and vegetables.  Her dream is for all of her children to be responsible.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is the one holding the sign.
About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Dayo

texts.en: Dayo, 39 years old and well-known in her community of Ibadan, Oyo  State, Nigeria, is trained in the treatment of bones and also sells medicines.  She has three children, and her husband also works to support their home. Dayo has been in this business for two years and is now requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines

loans.name: Abdel-Kader

texts.en:
Abdel-Kader, a married man, 56 years old, has owned an auto repair shop in his town since 2000 and has a previous twenty-six years of experience in this occupation. He is the only provider for his wife and his six school-age children. With this big family, he has to work hard and on an extra time basis to satisfy their needs.

Abdel-Kader has great demand in his shop. Thus, he wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy additional spare parts to offer good service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts

loans.name: Florence Business Group

texts.en:
Florence K. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Florence Business Group. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children who range in age from 20 to 30 years old. Florence also cares for nine relatives. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty. In the photo, Florence is the one holding the sign. Lemon B. is inset at lower right.

For more than twenty-five years, Florence has been selling dried fish at the Harbel market. She sells the dried fish in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

Florence plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish. Her goal is to grow her business to a shop and to continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en:
Adebayo is a hardworking and honest man who lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 45 years old and is married with two children. He wants to improve the quality of life of his family and hopes to give his children a quality education.

Adebayo sells medicines and groceries at retail prices to his customers and has been in this business for a long time. He has a good relationship with LAPO and is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 36-year-old married man and the father of three young children. He has been working as a shoemaker for the past fourteen years and in 2000, he opened his own shoe shop in his town as his own business. He is the only one to take care of his family and its expenses. He produces shoes and he works on special designs upon request of his clients.

Today, Samir is requesting to borrow $800 to purchase leather and some supplies such as glue to make shoes before the summer collection.

loans.use: To purchase leather and some supplies such as glue

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. Her shop is sited at the front of her house and she has been in this business for over twenty years. She does this business to make a living in Lagos. She supports her husband with the profit from the business to meet her family needs – feeding, clothing, etc.

Taiwo is 42 years old and is married with four children: three female and one male. She lives in Lagos with her family. She hopes that her business grows and expands into a bigger shop in future.

Taiwo hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries like assorted biscuits, tea, sachet milk and bread as well as foodstuffs like garri, palm oil, and groundnut (peanut) oil. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their wonderful assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Success #6 Group

texts.en: Finda J. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Success #6 Group. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. Tawah N. is inset at the lower right. Finda is 39 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from 11 to 22 years old. She was only able to attend school herself through 4th grade due to poverty. For fifteen years, Finda has been selling dry goods such as biscuits, batteries, and chicken soup at the Firestone Plantation Division #6 Market in Harbel, Liberia. She sells the general goods in a friendly manner and is fully stocked which keeps customers returning. Finda plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods, such as biscuits and batteries. Her goal is to grow her business to the highest level and to continue to support her children in school so that they can have a better future. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods such as biscuits and batteries

loans.name: Minne

texts.en:
Minne C. is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Cosmus with whom she has three children: Lewis, Isabella and Diana.

Minne is a businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes and this is her sixth year in the business. She earns a monthly profit of Ksh 12,000. Her business is in an area called New Market, Malindi and her target customers live in Malindi town. Her other sources of income include her spouse’s salary and they are also in the transport business.

Minne, who is on her third loan with KADET, has borrowed before from another institution and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. With this loan she plans to use Ksh 10,000 on women’s clothes, Ksh 10,000 on children's clothes, and Ksh 7,500 on underwear.

With the extra profit from this loan, Minne plans to complete rental houses she had already started building in Kisumu Ndogo-Malindi. Her future dream is to own a big boutique for new and used clothes in Malindi. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To add to her stock of women's clothes, children's clothes and underware

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 51-year-old married man. A father of three children, he opened his business in 1990 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. He opened a butcher shop and, over the years, he became well known in the whole region for his good business reputation.

Antoine repaid his first loan successfully and, after developing his business, he is asking for a new loan of $1,000 to purchase a new refrigerator to display his goods.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and married. She has six children, ranging in age from 8 to 23, with five of them currently attending school.

Jane runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over ten years. Milk sales to the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries supply Jane with most of her income, while she also sells other grocery supplies as well. Her current main business challenge is increasing competition in her area.

Jane requested this Kes 20,000 loan through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming operations. She says that this loan will help maximize her profits, as increased capital will allow for expansion. In the future, she wants to maintain her poultry project and have a continued lucrative business.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Sumail

texts.pt:
Sumail J. nasceu na localidade de Nacussa, Província de Cabo delgado, norte de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade casado e pai de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade ainda não começou a frequentar escola. Frequenta 7ą classe, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para o Distrito de Boane na Província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado mas conta com ajuda da sua esposa. Vende camas de madeira e mesinhas cabeceiras, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum mensalmente na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que já são clientes desta Instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (camas de madeira, mesinhas de cabeceira e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 11.500.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente empréstimo para poder aceder outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para introduzir a venda de colchões no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Sumail J. was born in Nacussa, in the province of Cabo Delgado in the north of Mozambique. He is 40 years old, married, and is the father of a five-year-old son who does not yet attend school. Sumail only studied through 7th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. Sumail left Cabo Delgado for the district of Boane in search of better living conditions. He has had his own business for more than 4 years and has no other employees, though he is helped by his wife. He sells wooden beds and nightstands, and his monthly earnings come to around 7000.00 Meticales. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some money each month in his bank account (with Millenium Bim). Sumail has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors who were already working with the institution. This is his 3rd loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (wooden beds, nightstands and other items) in order to increase his merchandise. His earlier loans were for 6000.00 Meticales and 11,500.00 Meticales, and both were used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to begin selling mattresses in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beds, nightstands, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.pt:
Carlos José M. nasceu no Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 43 anos de idade casado e pai de 5 filhos de 24, 22, 19, 16 e 14 anos de idade 4 destes vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta duas sobrinhas que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Zavala para Maputo em 1979 a procura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha a conta própria como mecânico auto há mais de 5 anos e possui um ajudante. A sua esposa trabalha numa empresa de produção de extensões de cabelo (Darling) e tem ajudado o marido nas despesas de casa. O sr. Carlos consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por, que com ajuda da esposa consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária depois das despesas de casa.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros no futuro e concluir a sua casa como forma de oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Carlos Jose M. was born in the district of Zavala, in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children who are 24, 22, 19, 16 and 14 years old. Four of them are in school. Carlos only finished 6th grade. He didn't continue with his studies because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house house with his family, and also takes care of two nieces who live with him. Carlos left Zavala for Maputo in 1979 in search of better living conditions. He has worked independently as an auto mechanic for more than 5 years and has one assistant. His wife works for a company that produces hair extensions (Darling) and helps her husband with the household expenses. Carlos earns around 4000.00 Meticales a month, and with his wife's help he is able to save some money each month in his bank account, after covering the household expenses. Carlos has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends of his. This is his 1st loan, in the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, zinc plates, iron and other items) in order to continue construction on his house. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans in the future. He would like to finish his house as a way to offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates, iron)

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and two brothers. He has owned a car-body repair shop in his village since 2007 having learned this occupation from a friend. With his business income, he provides, along with his father and brothers, for the living expenses of the family.

Since its start, Halim’s business operation has grown. Thus he wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy additionA. new tools to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy an additional new tools

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a single man, 38 years old, living with his mother. He is the only one taking care of his mother.

Mahmoud has been working as a carpenter since 1993 and produces all type of products including doors, tables, furniture, etc. He works upon request of his customers and he's happy with his business.

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additional wood to offer a variety of products to his clients and to develop his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy additional wood

loans.name: Fatima Issufo

texts.pt:
Fátima Issufo Ibrahimo B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos de 12 e 8 anos de idade, os dois vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe parou devido a insuficiência de fundos, mas pretende concorre para o ensino superior. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 5 anos e conta com um empregado que lhe auxilia no seu trabalho, para alem deste, trabalha também numa empresa de produção de fotografias e filmagem (FUJI), há mais de 1 ano. Neste emprego tem um salário mensal de 3.000.00mt, e um rendimento do seu negócio de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 500.00mt por mês na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de pessoas mais próximas que são clientes desta instituição a longo tempo. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (vassouras, ancinhos, topos de limpeza e outros) para aumentar e fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio. O empréstimo anterior foi de 150.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos com a finalidade construir um estabelecimento condigno para o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Fatima Issufo Ibrahimo B. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 29 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are 12 and 8 years old. Both children attend school. Fatima studied through 12th grade and then stopped because of a lack of funds, but she plans to pursue more advanced studies. She lives in her own home with her family and she also cares for her mother, who lives with her. She left Maputo for Boane in search of work and better living conditions. She has had her own business for more than 5 years and has one employee who helps her with her work. On top of this, for the past year she has also been working in a company that produces photographic film (Fuji). In this job she earns a monthly salary of 3000.00 Meticales and her business earnings come to around 4000.00 Meticales a month. She uses this income to cover household expenses and she also saves around 500.00 Meticales a month in her bank account. Fatima has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through people close to her who have worked with the institution for a long time. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (brooms, rakes, cleaning products and other items) in order to expand and strengthen her business. Her earlier loan was for 150,000.00 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to construct a satisfactory building for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brooms, mops and rakes

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 44-year-old married woman living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. She has four children, ranging in age from 19 to 29 years old, with two of them currently attending school.

Linet has been running her mixed farm for over five years now, and sells a wide variety of products at the local market. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, sunflowers and tomatoes, while she also sells milk on occasion. She says that lately the main challenge to her business is the droughts that have been difficult for her farming activities.

Linet has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of Kes 25,000 and Kes 40,000. She has now requested this loan of Kes 60,000 to expand her poultry farming operations. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay college fees for her two youngest children, therefore providing them with a better future.

Linet has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and her main goal is to acquire a small machine that processes sunflowers. She says that this will enable her to create employment opportunities for other people in her area and add to her diversified operations.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
To earn a living in Nigeria, Esther sells tissue paper at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business of eight years and her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to own a tissue paper company in the future.

Esther loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more tissue paper to sell.

Esther is married with three children and she is 39 years old. Her children are young and they attend school. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tissue paper to sell

loans.name: César

texts.pt:
César N. nasceu no Distrito de Guija, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 51 anos de idade casado e pai de 06 filhos de 29, 24, 22, 18, 16 e 13 anos de idade, os 5 vão a escola apenas o mais velho já não estuda. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a insuficiência de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta ainda a sua mãe enviando valores monetários para as despesas de casa.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com a sua família devido a guerra de destabilização. Fixou sua residência e mais tarde iniciou sua actividade comercial, é dono do seu negócio há mais de 12 anos e não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda dos seus filhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.500.00mt a 2.000.00mt por dia, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no final do mês na sua conta poupança.
Já teve um empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito SOCREMO não continuou devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu amigo que já é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 22.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha, óleo e outros) para aumentar e diversificar os produtos do seu negócio. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de12.400.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.  
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a postar na ampliação do seu negócio e explorar ainda mais outras áreas comerciais.
texts.en:
Cesar N. was born in the district of Guija, in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children who are 29, 24, 22, 18, 16 and 13 years old. Five of his children attend school, only the oldest one does not. Cesar only studied through 4th grade, and didn't continue because a lack of financial resources. He lives in her own home with his family and helps to support his mother financially by sending her money to cover her household expenses. Cesar left Gaza for the city of Maputo with his family due to the instability caused by the Mozambican Civil War. He set up residency there and later began his work in sales. He has owned his business for more than 12 years and has no other employees, though his children help him. He makes around 1500-2000 Meticales a day, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account at the end of the month. Cesar had taken out loans before with the SOCREMO credit cooperative, but he decided not to continue for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who was already working with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 22,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items) in order to expand and diversify the products he sells. His earlier loans were for 12,400.00, 13,000.00 and 18,000.00 Meticales and were all used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to put towards expanding his business and exploring other areas of sales.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 42-year-old lady who is married and blessed with three children who attend school.

Christine has been running a grocery for one year and has one employee who assists her in the business. She is also employed by the Nairobi City Council.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Christine has learnt to keep proper records of her business. She dreams of being a major distributor of maize in future. She has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 to add to her stock of maize.

loans.use: To add to her stock of maize

loans.name: Wallece

texts.en:
Wallece is a 27-year-old married man. He has been selling shoes in Kawangware open-air market for four years. He is a very hardworking man who hopes to have a well-established business. Therefore, he has requested for a loan Kes 20,000 to add to his stock of shoes.

This is going to be Wallece’s first loan from Faulu Kenya. He really appreciates the organization for teaching him how to save his money. He dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Labibeh

texts.en:
Labibeh is a 44-year-old single woman living with her family. She has been working as a private accountant for the past fifteen years, working from her home. She participates with her family in the household expenses, rent, etc.

Labibeh has repaid her first loan and, today, she is asking for her second loan of $1,600 to purchase two computers. These are needed to facilitate her work after having a heavy demand from customers asking for her accounting services.

loans.use: To purchase two computers

loans.name: Ana Abel

texts.pt:
Ana Abel C. nasceu na cidade de Xai-xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 34 anos de idade solteira mãe de 1 filho de 14 anos de idade, frequenta escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Xai-xai para Maputo muito jovem com os seus pais, actualmente vive na Matola no bairro de Malhampshene. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, apenas conta com ajuda da sua filha por vezes. Vende mais roupa nova diversa, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt a 10.000.00mt por mês, que aplica na sua maioria na ampliação da sua residência e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no NOVO BANCO e PROCREDIT mas decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga e tomou a iniciativa de aproximar e solicitar um crédito. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fatos, roupa de cama e outra roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aquisição de um meio de transporte como forma de minimizar os gastos na compra de sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Ana Abel C. was born in the city of Xai-xai, Gaza Province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 34 years old, and the single mother of a 14-year old, who attends school. Ana attended school until the 7th grade and dropped out due to a lack of financial resources. She lives with her child in a home she owns, and does not support anyone else. She left Xai-xai for Maputo with her parents when she was very young. She now lives in Matola in the neighborhood of Malhampshene. She has had her own business for more than 5 years. She does not have any employees; she only has help from her daughter occasionally. She sells a variety of new clothing, and earns around 8.000,00 MT to 10.000.00 Mt per month, which she uses primarily to add-on to her home and she also has some savings in her bank account. She has had loans in the past through NOVO BANCO and PROCREDIT, but she decided not to continue with them for various reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend, and took the initiation to approach them for a loan. This is her first loan, in the amount of 20.000.00 MT, which she plans to use to purchase products (clothing, linens, other clothing items) to increase her inventory. Ana is committed to paying back this loan on time in order to have access to future loans. In the future she would like to request additional loans to purchase a means of transportation as a way to minimize costs of purchasing merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assorted clothing

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 42 years old and married with six children. They range in age from 5 to 22 years old, with the youngest five all attending school.

Richard runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over five years. His main business is milk production, which he sells in the local market, while he also earns income as a casual day laborer working at the local college.

Richard is taking out his first loan with Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 30,000 to improve his poultry farming operations. He will be increasing his stock as well as purchasing additional farm inputs to improve productivity. The extra income from this loan will help provide for his family's needs, now and in the future.

Richard would also like to expand his farm over time, purchasing more land and eventually owning at least five high yield dairy cows.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Assuate Trinta

texts.pt:
Assuate Trinta Namuetho nasceu na Província de Nampula, norte de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade viúvo e pai de 2 filhos de 15 e 8 anos de idade e todos vão a escola. Fez nível médio, parou quando entrou no serviço militar Obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Nampula para Boane em 1985 cumprindo o serviço militar, mais tarde preferiu integrar se no ministério do interior como agente da policia. Conta cerca de 18 anos a trabalhar neste ministério como adjunto superintendente, onde tem um salário de 14.755.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve um empréstimo no Banco Millenium Bim, mas decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu primo que já é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes e outros) para reabilitar a sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para aumentar na aquisição de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Assuate Trinta Namuetho was born in the province of Nampula, north of Mozambique. He is 42 years old, a widower, and has 2 children, 15 and 8 years old, who attend school. He finished some school, but stopped when he had to complete his obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his children, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. He left Nampula for Boane in 1985 to complete his military service, and later joined the Ministry of the Interior as a police officer. He's been working for the ministry about 18 years as an adjunct superintendent, and earns 14,755 meticals a month. He uses his salary to cover household expenses and is able to save some in a savings account. He received a loan from the Banco Millenium Bim, but decided not to continue there. He learned about Hluvuku from his cousin, who is already a client. This is his first loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, joists, etc.) to refurbish his home. He is committed to paying his loan on time in order to be eligible for others in the future. He would like to request additional loans so he can purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Floriano Sinalo

texts.pt:
Floriano Sinalo Cudacala nasceu no distrito de Changara, Província de Tete, norte de Moçambique tem 52 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 23, 20, 16 e 10 anos de idade, os 2 mais novos vão a escola. Fez somente 3ą classe, parou quando foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela.
Saiu de Changara para Boane em 1977 por uma transferência do serviço militar e veio sozinho. Foi desmobilizado após a guerra de estabilizada em 1992, actualmente é pensionista do Ministério da Defensa e conta com uma pensão mensal de 1.431.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e por vezes consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que salientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, tinta e outros) para concluir a sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente credito para poder ter acesso a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder adquirir o material que faltar e mobilar a sua residência.
texts.en:
Floriano Sinalo Cudacala was born in the district of Changara, in the province of Tete in the north of Mozambique. He is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 23, 20, 16 and 10 years old. The two youngest attend school. Floriano only finished 3rd grade. He stopped his studies because he had to fulfill the obligatory military service. He lives his own house with his family, and also takes care of a niece who lives with him. He left Changara for Boane in 1977 when he was transferred there by the military, and at first arrived alone. After the Mozambican Civil War ended he was released from the army, in 1992. He currently receives a pension from the Ministry of Defense, for the amount of 1431.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account each month Floriano has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues of his who also work with the institution. This is his 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, sand, paint and other items) in order to finish his construction project. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to buy the rest of the materials he needs and to furnish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, paint and other items)

loans.name: Cecília

texts.pt:
Cecília J. T. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 23 e 17 anos de idade, os dois vão a escola. Fez somente 7 ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor monetário e produtos alimentares.
Saiu de Boane para a cidade da Matola após o seu casamento. Tem um negócio próprio e dona do mesmo há mais de 18 anos. Trabalha sozinha, as vezes tem tido auxílio das filhas, vende mais camas de madeira, mesas e estantes onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas caseiras e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus clientes que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (malas de madeira, camas, mesas, estantes e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este credito também para poder aceder a outros. No futuro deseja solicitar outros empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir um estabelecimento onde irá desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Cecília J. T. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 42 years old, and a widow and mother of two children, 23 and 17 years of age. Both children attend school. She only went through the 7th grade, and wasn't able to continue because of her family's difficult financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her sons, and also supports her mother by sending her money and food. She left Boane for the city of Matola after she got married. She's owned her own business for more than 18 years. She works on her own, sometimes with her daughters' help, and sells wooden beds, tables, and bookshelves. She earns 12,000 meticals per month, which she uses to cover household expenses, and is even able to save some in her bank account. She's never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hvuluku through her customers who are alsoHvuluku clients. This is her second loan, in the value of 16,000 meticals, which she intends to use to purchase materials (wooden trunks, beds, tables, bookshelves, etc.) to increase her stock. She also used the previous loan of 10,000 meticals for this purpose. She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that in the future she'll be eligible for others. She'd like to request other loans to finish off her residence and build a structure from which to run her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 62-year-old married man in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has eight children, ranging in age from 7 to 29, with the four youngest all attending school.

Simon has been involved in farming for over thirty years now, and earns most of his income from selling maize and beans. The main challenge he has faced lately is droughts that have made farming difficult.

Simon has a successful relationship with Juhudi Kilimo, having proved his creditworthiness by satisfying past loans. He has now requested this loan for Kes 30,000 to expand his poultry farming operations. He says that the extra income from this loan will help ensure a stable income, now and in the near future.

Simon has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and he hopes that with his solid credit history he will be able to access more capital when necessary. He is hopeful that standards of living for himself and his family will continually improve over time.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte T. is 30 years old, is married and is the mother of three children. She lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois", NGASCOP, for six years. Her main activity consists of raising cattle which she sells at the grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey.

With this loan, Brigitte T. will purchase more cattle to raise. The revenues generated by her activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Pedro M. Donça nasceu no Distrito de Mutarara, Província de Tete, norte de Moçambique tem 54 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 22 e 20 anos de idade, todos já não frequentam a escola. Fez 12ą classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo devido a transferência do serviço militar em 1974, onde acabou fixando sua residência. Ė Pensionista do Ministério da Defesa há mais de 10 anos e tem como pensão mensal o valor de 7.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente desta instituição na sucursal de Bela Vista. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a construir uma pastelaria e salão de chá, como forma de melhorar a vida da sua família.
texts.en:
Pedro M. Donça was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has of two children, 22 and 20 years of age. The children are no longer in school. He finished 12th grade but didn't continue his studies because he was summoned to complete obligatory military service. He lives in his own house and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. He left Tete for Maputo because he was transfered during his military service in 1974. He ended up settling down in Maputo. He retired from the Defense Ministry more than 10 years ago and receives a pension of 7000 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses and some savings. He's never received loans from other banks. He learned about Hvuluku through a friend who is also a Hvuluku client at the Bela Vista branch. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he intends to use once to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, cement, sand, joists, etc.) and continue building his work. The earlier loans were in the amounts of 12,000, 15,000, and 15,000 meticals, all for the same purpose. In the future, he'd like to request more loans to build a bakery and tea room, as a way to better his family's life.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chapas, cimento, barrotes e areia

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad has owned a women's accessories shop since 2008. He’s 29 years old, married with 2 young children. He decided to open this type of business after seeing a need for such services in the region. He offers his products on shelves to present to his clients. 

Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. merchandise and items as inventory to propose a larger choice of products to his clients before the holidays in order to increase his sales during this period of time.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and items for sale.

loans.name: Tomas Paipe

texts.pt:
Tomas Paipe S. nasceu no Distrito de Mabote, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 48 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 6 e 4 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo quando vinha cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, acabando fixando sua residência neste local. Ė pensionista do Ministério da Defesa há mais de 18 anos, tem uma pensão mensal de 3.397.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algo dez enquanto.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.500.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 5.000.00mt e 5.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro deseja solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua casa e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Tomas Paipe S. was born in the district of Mabote, in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. The 6 year old attends school. Tomas only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. Tomas left Inhambane for Maputo when he went to fulfill the obligatory military service, and ended up staying there. He has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for the past 18 years. His monthly pension is 3397.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is sometimes able to save some money in his bank account. Tomas has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who work with the institution. This is his 5th loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to expand his house. His earlier loans were for 2500.00, 5000.00, 5000.00, and 5000.00 Meticales, and all were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and to start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand and other items)

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie N. is a 48-year-old woman living in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of four children. Madame N. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame N. raises sheep, which she sells on the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. She has a lot of experience in this domain and will use this loan to buy 10 young sheep. The revenues from selling them at the market allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To puchase young sheep for sale.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 22-year-old married woman and mother of 2 young children. After having her two children, she decided to open a small business to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She opened a perfume and chocolates accessories shop in her town. And she’s thankful for her new business income because it allows her to help her husband to raise her two children. 

Today, Sara is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more perfumes and accessories before the summer season because the business grows during this season and she has to be ready.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 57-year-old married man living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has ten children, ranging in age from 11 to 27 years old, with seven of them currently attending school.

Sammy has been running his mixed farm for over 15 years now, and sells milk and vegetables to retailers in his town. He also owns a vegetable kiosk where he sells his own produce. He says that lately the main challenge to his business is the droughts that have been difficult for his farming activities, along with financial constraints limiting the amount of farm inputs he can purchase.

Sammy has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, recently completing one loan cycle. He has now requested this loan for KES 25,000 to expand his poultry farming operations. He says that the extra income from this loan will go a long way in sustaining his family in terms of food and education for the children.

Sammy has plans for expansion in the next 5-10 years, and his main goal is to open an Agrovet (a store that sells medicine and supplies for care of livestock). He would also like to expand his land holdings to help increase his overall income.

loans.use: To establish a poultry farm.

loans.name: Lucia Amelia

texts.pt:
Lucia Amelia Nhantumbo nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 48 anos de idade viúva e mãe de 3 filhos de 20, 18 e 13 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Maputo para a cidade da Matola quando perdeu seu marido há mais de 4 anos. Tem um negócio próprio que iniciou depois de perder o seu marido, não possui nenhum empregado e vende mais frangos, ovos, pipocas e carne. Para alem deste tem uma pensão mensal que recebe da companhia Industrial da Matola, onde trabalhava seu marido no valor de 1.600.00mt e 4.500.00mt do rendimento mensal do seu negocio, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas em conversa. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ovos, carne, pipocas, frangos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para construir uma mercearia, um aviário para a criação de frangos de corte, como forma de desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Lucia Amelia Nhantumbo was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is 48 years old, and a widow and mother of three children, 20, 18, and 13 years of age. All of her children attend school. She only went through the 4th grade, and wasn't able to continue because of her family's difficult financial circumstances. She lives in her own house with her children, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. She left Maputo for the city of Matola when her husband died more than four years ago. She has her own business, which she started after losing her husband. She doesn't have any employees, and she sells chickens, eggs, corn and meat. In addition, she also receives a monthly pension from the Industrial da Matola company, where her husband works. The pension is 1600 meticals, and she makes 4500 meticals a month from her business. She uses her income to cover household expenses, and is able to set a little aside in a savings account. She's never received loans from other banks, and learned about Hvuluku through friends. This is her first loan, in the amount of 16,000 meticals, which she intends to use to purchase materials (eggs, meat, corn, chickens, etc.) to increase her stock. She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that she'll be eligible for others in the future. She'd like to request additional loans to build a grocery store and a chicken coop where she can raise broiler hens as a way to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, chickens, etc. for sale

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a hardworking man and he lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. He is married with two children. His eldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. He is 43 years old. He sells for long hours to support his wife. He sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a super market and expand his business in the future. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. He says "thanks" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hortênsia Dos Anjos Salomão

texts.pt:
Hortênsia Dos Anjos Salomão M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 41 anos de idade casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 20 e 10 anos de idade, ambos vão a escola. Fez apenas 8  classes, não continuou devido as doenças e falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, tem ajudado no sustento da sua mãe em despesas alimentares.

Nunca sai da cidade, apenas saiu do Bairro do Chamanculo na cidade de Maputo para Matola quando se casou com o seu marido, hoje ainda continua vivendo nesta cidade. Trabalha numa empresa de fabrico e tratamento de cabelo artificial DARLING há mais de 4 anos, faz cerca de 9n horas de trabalho diário e não possui nenhum empregado. As vezes têm tido ajuda do seu marido que trabalha como pedreiro a conta propria. O seu salario mensal é de 2.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para casuais despesas que possam surgir e de vez em quanto no Banco Millenium Bim.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tubos de canalização, cimento, areia e outros) para poder concluir com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Hortênsia Dos Anjos Salomão M. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children, 20 and 10 years of age. Both children attend school. She only completed eight years of school, and wasn't able to continue because of her family's difficult financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family. She helps support her mother by helping with food expenses. She's never been out of the city or her Chamanculo neighborhood, except to leave Maputo for Matola in order to marry her husband. She still lives in Maputo today. She has worked for the Darling company, which manufactures artificial hair, for more than 4 years, and works almost 9 hours a day. She doesn't have any employees. Sometimes she's had help from her husband, who works as a self-employed bricklayer. She earns 2500 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses, and she's also able to set some aside at home to cover unexpected expenses that might arise. Sometimes she also deposits some savings in the Millenium Bim Bank. She's never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hvuluku from friends who are also Hvuluku clients. This is her second loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she intends to use to purchase construction materials (sewage pipes, cement, sand, etc.) to finish work on her house. She also used the previous loan of 7,000 meticals for this purpose. In the future, she'd like to request additional loans to finish constructing and furnishing the house, so she can offer her family a more comfortable home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Eliap

texts.en: Eliap is a 59-year-old man, married and blessed with eleven children. He has been renting houses and supplying water for nine years. He has one employee to assist him in his businesses. He was a mason before he ventured into this business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt and participated in saving his money with the MFI. He hopes to own several plots and permanent houses in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to expand the rental houses. He describes himself as an honest and a hardworking man.

loans.use: To expand his rental house business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adio

texts.en: Adio is a known business man in his community. He is a key maker. He has been in this business for a long time and he hopes to expand his business. He is married with two children and he is 41 years old. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Adio is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more materials to increase his business. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to increase his business.

loans.name: Luísa Calisto

texts.pt:
Luisa Calisto H. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade casada e maê de 2 filhos de 10 e 4 anos de idade, o mais velho é que vai a escola. Fez apenas 5  classes, naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende dar continuidade na Alfabetização de adultos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, tem ajudado no sustento de seus irmãos em material escolar e assistência médica.

Nunca sai da cidade, apenas viaja e volta um ou dois dias depois quando vai a compras. Iniciou a actividade comercial em 1987 ainda muito jovem devido as dificuldades que a sua família enfrentava na vida. Actualmente é dona do seu próprio negoceia, faz cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia e não possui nenhum empregado, as vezes têm tido ajuda do seu marido que trabalha como jardineiro numa empresa de produção e venda de banana. O seu rendimento em media é de 4.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para casuais despesas que possam surgir.

Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito PROCREDIT, e dividiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, óleo, amendoim, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a sua actividade comercial, mas tem como sonho construir uma residência condigna para a sua família.
texts.en:
Luisa Calisto H. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 10 and 4 years old. The 10 year old attends school. Luisa only studied through 5th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources, but she would like to continue studying in adult literacy classes. She lives in her own home with her family and has helped to support her siblings with school materials and medical care. Luisa never left Boane, she only leaves for one or two day shopping trips. She began working in 1987, when she was still very young, because of the difficult life that her family was facing. She now owns her own business, works around 12 hours a day, and doesn't have any other employees. Her husband, who works as a gardener for a company that grows and sells bananas, sometimes helps her with the business. Luisa earns 4500.00 Meticales per month on average. She uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money at home each month for any additional expenditures that might arise. Luisa had taken out loans before with the PROCREDIT credit cooperative, but she decided not to continue for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 10,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (rice, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs and other items) in order to increase her merchandise. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards her business activities. Her dream is to build a decent home for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking oil, rice and other items

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi is very happy with the growth of her business; with her last Kiva loan she bought more bags of flour and other baking items in large quantities. She makes snacks like egg rolls, fish rolls, meat pie and more. She has been able to produce snacks in large quantity, thereby satisfying the demands of her customers.
