She hopes for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more bags of flour and yeast to make more snacks to sell.

47 years old Kemi is married with 2 children. She assists her husband in paying for her children’s education and hopes to see them graduate in the future. She thanks Kiva and LAPO microfinance for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to make more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Ayangoke

texts.en: Ayangoke is an electrician and he is doing well in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has been in this business for a long time. He is the only electrician in his community and the demands for his services are high. He is married with 4 children and he is 51 years old. His wife also works to support their home. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more materials to increase his business. He has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to increase his business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is an honest and hard working man. He has a cool room where he sells ice fish (frozen fish) to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. Thomas has the only cool room in his community and so he is able to sell ice fish in his community.

He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more fish to ice and sell. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Thomas’s wife also supports their home. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to ice and sell

loans.name: Joana Francisco

texts.pt:
Joana Francisco S. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 29, 20, 15 e 8 anos de idade, apenas 2 vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.

Saiu de Magude para o bairro de Mafuiane Distrito de Namaacha com os seus pais, onde vive ate hoje. Trabalha com empregada domestica há mais de 4 anos, faz um horário único das 6:00h as 15:30h todos os dias. Teve que recorrer a este emprego devido as dificuldades que encarava na sua vida financeira. Tem um salário mensal de 4.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para eventuais despesas de casa.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmaõ que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.500.00mt, 4.000.00mt, 4.400.00mt e 7.400.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e investir no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Joana Francisco S. was born in the Magude district, in the Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 48 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 29, 20, 15, and 8 years old, two of whom attend school. Joana only completed 4th grade and did not continue due to financial restrictions. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides her children.

She left Magude for the Mafuiane neighborhood in the Namaacha district with her parents, where she still lives today. She has worked as a housekeeper for the past 4 years, and she keeps a daily schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. She had to resort to this job because of economic hardship. She earns a monthly salary of 4,500 MT, which she uses to pay for her household expenses while still saving some for future expenses as well.

She has never had a loan with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her brother who is also a client. This is her 5th loan for the amount of 15,000 MT, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and others) to continue the construction of her home. The previous loans were for 3,500MT, 4,000MT, 4,400MT, and 7,400MT and all were used for the same purpose.

In the future, she would like to seek additional loans to finish her home and invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and others)

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 37 years old and married with three children. His wife also works to support their home. He hopes to give his children a quality education. Abass lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

Abass rears and sells cows. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He is an honest and a hardworking man. He hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase calves to rear and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to rear and sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses A. has a pig farm, where he rears pigs to sell at retail prices. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to own a poultry farm in the future. He is married with four children and he is 43 years old. 

A. is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more pigs to rear and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to rear and sell

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène GUEYE est une veuve de 40 ans, avec en charge 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés et de céréales telles que mil et arachide. Ce commerce lui permet de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène G. is a 40-year-old widow and cares for her four children. She sells smoked and dried fish as well as cereals, such as millet and peanuts. This business enables her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried and smoked fish as well as cereals

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is very concerned about the growth of her business and that of her family. She sells charcoal to make a living in Lagos state. Charcoal is made from burnt wood and it is used for roasting and cooking food. She has been in the business for some years. 

She wants to expand the size of her business, so she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more charcoal to sell. She said this will attract a discount, reduce her cost of transportation and maximize her profit.  

Dorcas is 35 years old and married with two children, who are 5 and 7 years old. She hopes to assist her husband in educating the children and improving their living standards. She is grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda DIAW est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KHANDIAR depuis 9ans et demi et a été 19 fois des suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce d'arachides et avec le bénéfices réalisés elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda DIAW is a 47-year-old woman who is married and is the mother of 8 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of KHANDIAR for the past 9 and a half years and has taken out 19 loans during that time. She is developing her business selling peanuts with the funds from her loan in order to help to improve her family's circumstances.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce de diverses marchandises

loans.name: Kiné

texts.fr: Kiné D. est marié, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de divers produits. Avec ce prêt, elle compte participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille afin d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kiné D., aged 40, is married and the mother of two children. She retails various products. Thanks to this loan she hopes to help to provide for the daily needs of her family and improve their living condition.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Lidie

texts.fr: Lidie D. est une femme de 31 ans, Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis le 11 juillet 2006, et a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité, elle fait de l'embouche bovine et vend divers produits tels que des téléphones portables, des tissus et des effets cosmétiques. Les bénéfices générés par ses activités commerciales lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Lidie D. is a 31-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She has been a member of the village bank of Darou-Khoudoss since July 11, 2006 and was granted 7 consecutive loans. She is very experienced in her business, which is rearing cattle. She also sells various products, such as cell phones, fabrics and cosmetics. The profit from these activities enables her to pay for her needs.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an ox and various products

loans.name: Busayo

texts.en:
Busayo sells bags of maize in Oyo State, Nigeria, where she lives with her family. She is a hardworking woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life.

Busayo hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of maize to sell. Maize is used in Nigeria to prepare mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods.

Busayo is 30 years old and is married with a child. She hopes to give her child a quality education. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba G. est une veuve de 54 ans, avec 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle fait de l’embauche ovine et aimerait, avec les revenus générés, renforcer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Coumba G. is a 54-year old widow with seven children to support. She undertakes beef fattening and would like to strengthen her business with the revenues she generates, as well as providing for every day needs, health and her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beef fattening activity

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa F. est une femme mariée de 48 ans mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’huile d’arachide et en même temps fait de l’embauche bovine. Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettront de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa F. is a married woman who is 48 years old and has seven children. She is active in the peanut oil business and at the same time beef fattening. The revenues generated by her activities will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out beef fattening and peanut oil business

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en:
Funmilayo owns a beauty salon. She styles hair and sells hair extensions and other accessories to her customers. She started this business fifteen years ago and is happy with the growth her business is experiencing now.

Funmilayo used her last Kiva loan she obtained through LAPO micro-finance to purchase more hair extensions, hair cream and accessories. This she said has improved her business.

Funmilayo is hardworking and hopes for more business expansion. She is asking for a loan of NGN 150,000 to again purchase more hair extensions, creams and accessories to sell. She says a very big thank you to Kiva lenders.

37-year-old Funmilayo is married with three children, her eldest being 10 years old and doing well in school. Her husband is an automobile engineer and they lives in Lagos State.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, creams and accessories to sell

loans.name: Abibat

texts.en:
Abibat is a hardworking and friendly woman. She is married to a civil servant and she is 30 years old with three children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy.

Abibat sells sachet water (water in plastic bags) and drinks at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for three years. She is a LAPO client and is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou G. est une dame de 70 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un commerce en détail de divers articles tels que : sucre, oignon, mil, beurre, riz et café. Elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Satou G. is a 70-year old lady who is married and has two children. She has a retail business selling various items such as: sugar, onions, millet, butter, rice and coffee. She would like to strengthen her business and contribute to her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of various food products

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrian vive con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Villa nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, su actividad es la joyería; él realiza trabajos en oro y plata como ser anillos, aretes, collares, etc.

El crédito que solicita es para poner en orden los documentos de su casa.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2001 y tiene un historial de pagos  muy bueno, lo cual le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Adrian lives with his wife and children in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. He is a jeweler. He works with gold and silver and makes things like rings, earrings, and necklaces, etc. The loan he is requesting is to put the house documents in order. He has been a client of Impro since 2001. His payment history is very good, which allows him to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of legalizing the documents for his house so that everything will be in order

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of two telephone booths

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson F. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona  de Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Wilson  tiene una pequeña librería en su misma zona, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de su vivienda, que por la antigüedad de la misma se encuentra deteriorada.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr Wilson F. lives in his parents' house in the neighborhood of Sopocachi in La Paz. He owns a small bookstore in the same neighborhood and spends his income from it to provide for his family. He will use the requested loan to renovate his house, which is damaged due to age. This is the third time Mr Wilson applies for a loan and our socioeconomic evaluation qualifies him to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Rey  David

texts.es: El señor Rey Pérez tiene 38 años de edad, padre de familia de tres hijos, su esposa ama de casa, don Rey trabaja como auxiliar de costura en la empresas zona Franca, el cual con la ayuda de un amigo comenzó, ya que se le había hecho difícil, anterior se dedicaba  en servicios de seguridad pero nunca aumentaron su salario lo cual no alcanzaba para comprar la canasta básica, lo que se le hacia preocupante. Ahora se encuentra un poco mejor ya que gana un poco mas por las horas extras que hace lo que se ha venido equilibrando. Sus préstamo lo ha invertido en las mejora de su pequeña casa, con su crédito anterior logro avanzar un cuarto pero no termino por falta de dinero ya que no ajusto es por eso con este préstamo espera terminarlo para poder estar en mejores condiciones, y cambiar el techo el cual comprara los materiales necesario y seguir la mejora.
texts.en:
Rey Pérez is 38, and he has three children. His wife is a housewife. He works as an assistant tailor in a business in the free-trade zone. He started it with the help of a friend because things had been difficult for him. He used to work in security. They never raised his salary, and it did not cover the basic expenses. This worried him. Now he is a little better because he earns a bit more with extra hours. It has been stabilizing. He used the loan to invest in improvements to his small house. With his previous loan he made progress on a room, but he did not finish due to lack of money. That is why he is asking for this loan in the hope of finishing it so that it will be in better condition. He will buy the needed materials to change the roof and continue with the improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc metal sheeting, nails, and edging to replace the roof and make improvements in the room

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tacagua, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Dionisio trabaja como chofer de transporte de carga y su esposa es empleada de limpieza, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la cocina y la instalación de gas a domicilio, con lo que disminuirá sus gastos familiares.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Dionisio Q. lives in his own house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He works as a driver transporting cargo. His wife is a cleaning lady. Their incomes support their family. The requested loan is to repair the kitchen and install gas in his home, which will decrease the family expenses. This is the seventh time he has requested a loan. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the kitchen and install gas in his home

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking and honest woman who wants to improve the quality of life for her family. She is 35 years old and is married with two children. She hopes to give her children a quality education.

Deborah sells groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday has a poultry farm where her rears poultry and sells eggs. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He hopes to expand his business in future by adding a fish pond to his poultry business.

Sunday is 47 years old and is married with two children. He is a friendly and hardworking man. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more poultry and poultry feed. He duly thanks all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Rubén C. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Rubén trabaja como empleado en un restaurante de esta ciudad y su esposa es empleada, ingresos con los que mantienen  su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el amurallado de su terreno comprado con sus ahorros y que por no contar con el cerco, esta siendo amenazado de ser expropiado por la junta de vecinos.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Rubén C. lives with his wife and son in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area, which is on the hillsides to the east of La Paz. Rubén works in a restaurant in this city, and is wife is employed. Their incomes support the family. The requested loan is to build a wall around the land he bought with his savings. It does not have a fence, and there is a threat that it will be expropriated by the neighborhood council. This is the third time he has requested a loan. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of fencing off his land to avoid expropriation of the land

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou D. est âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans l’embauche ovine et aimerait renforcer son capital. Son objectif est de mieux prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Satou D. is 54 years old, a widow and the mother of three children still under her care. Her business activity is fattening sheep and she would like to bolster her working capital. Her objective is to take better care of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten sheep

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios nos Ama lo integran tres personas emprendedoras, luchadoras y trabajadoras. Los cuales han ido mejorando poco a poco sus negocios gracias a la combinación de crédito y capacitación-formación en desarrollo empresarial y autonomía personal que adim ofrece según expresaron.

“Tuvieron mucha influencia cambiaron mi forma de trabajar en cuanto al orden, el ahorro y la mejor forma de invertir” dijo Idalia María Alejo Áreas la cual comercializa verduras y frutas desde hace 7 años. Sin embargo el sueno de ella es lograr tener más negocios es por ello que este préstamo lo invertirá en la creación de una  fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos.

Don Florencio Roman P. López es otro de los integrantes del grupo el cual desde 1995 se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas. 

Mientras Meling Guadalupe Áreas Rodríguez es una joven trabajadora y esforzada que desde su niñez ha laborado en el comercio de verduras junto con su madre hasta hace un año que se independizo y creó su propio negocio en el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos.  Por otra parte está muy feliz ya que podrá realizar su sueño que es estudiar la licenciatura en Ingles lo cual no había podido por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
The group “Dios nos Ama” (God Loves Us) consists of three enterprising, determined, and hardworking individuals. They have been slowly improving their businesses through a combination of loans and training courses in business development and personal self-management that ADIM offers. “They have had a great influence in changing the way I work. The savings are the best way to invest,” says Idalia María Alejo Áreas, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years. However, her dream is to start more businesses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to start a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried foods. Don Florencio Roman P. López is another member who has been part of the group since 1995. He buys and sells produce. Meling Guadalupe Áreas Rodríguez is a hardworking and determined young woman. Since she was a child, she had been working in her mother’s vegetable business until a year ago. She wanted to become independent and decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. On the other hand, she is happy to be pursuing her dream of studying English literature, which was put on hold due to a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to set up a restaurant selling fried food

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity works hard to make sure her home is not lacking. With her last Kiva loan, she stocked her shop with more foodstuffs, like groundnut oil, palm oil, smoked fish, Maggi cubes (bouillon), etc. This has improved her business and her profit. Getting more goods attracted more customers to her shop and she has been able to satisfy the growing demand of her numerous customers. 

She hopes to further improve and expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

Charity lives in Lagos, is married to a commercial driver and has three children. She thanks all lenders for their financial empowerment.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos D. 15 y 9 años D. edad en casa D. sus suegros, ubicada en la zona comercial D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace ocho años tiene instalado un negocio D. cabinas D. internet en el domicilio en donD. vive. Ella nos comenta que pudo instalar el negocio con los ahorros que su esposo percibía D. su trabajo como vendedor D. computadoras. Jessica atienD. el negocio durante todo el dia desD. las 8:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm. El negocio goza D. buena acogida debido a su céntrica ubicación y a que muy cerca hay varios colegios, por lo que es D. utilidad para los escolares D. la zona.

Además del servicio D. internet, otro D. los motivos por el que el negocio D. Jessica es frecuentado es porque brinda servicio D. búsqueda D. información y D. impresiónes a los escolares, precisamente, para optimizar este servicio ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. una impresora multifuncional con sistema D. inyección D. tinta, la cual haría que el servicio D. impresiones se agilice y que sus clientes estén mas satisfechos con el servicio.

Jessica es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir implementando el negocio con una fotocopiadora. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children ages 15 and 19. They live with her in-laws in the commercial section of the city of Chiclayo. She has had an Internet store she operates out of her home for eight years. She tells us that she was able to start her business with savings her husband got from his work selling computers. Jessica takes care of the business all day long from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. The business does well because of its central location and also because there are several high schools nearby and it’s useful for students. In addition to Internet service, another reason for Jessica’s business being so busy is because she helps people do searches as well as printing for the schools. To proviD. the best service, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of a multi-functional color printer which would help improve her printing service and satisfy her customers. Jessica is a very hard working and enterprising woman. Her greatest desire is to make her business better with a photocopier. She has worked with our institution before and proven herself to by punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a multi-functional color printer.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Good Luck group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. In this way, their businesses will expand both in size and quality. Consequently, they will be able to make more sales, better profit, and improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu S. pictured on the left. Fifty-year-old Salamatu was born in Makeni; she is married to a businessman and they have 5 children. Salamatu sells posts and boards. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She is seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 to further expand her business. She will use the loan to buy more wood from the provinces to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy wood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago F. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Santiago trabaja como chofer de transporte público, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
Al ser recién casados, su padre le cedió una parte del terreno que tiene y necesitan construir su vivienda.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación, inicio de la construcción de su vivienda propia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Santiago, his wife and son, live in his parents’ home in the west section of the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. He supports his family with the income earns driving a public bus. When they first got married, his father gave him a plot of land and he needs to build his home. He will use the money from this loan to build his home. This is his first loan. We have analyzed his socioeconomic situation and believe that he qualifies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costo de construir una habitación en el terreno que padre le cedió, como inicio de la construcción de vivienda propia.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco H. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su dos hijos. 
El señor Francisco es constructor, hace trabajos de albañilería en casas particulares y su esposa es empleada domestica, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención que estabilice el suelo en su vivienda y no corra riesgo de rajaduras y deslizamiento.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco H. lives with his wife and two children in his own house in the Pasankeri area on the hillside to the west of La Paz. Francisco is a builder, and he does bricklaying work in private houses. His wife is a domestic employee. Their income supports the family. The requested loan is to build a retaining wall to stabilize the floor of their house and not run the risk of cracks and sliding. This is the eighth time he has asked for a loan. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a retaining wall to stabilize the floor of their house

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie D. is a 62-year-old, married woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame D. sells and resells peanut oil. This loan allows her to buy 300 liters of peanut oil. The revenues from reselling it in the market help her improve the health conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase peanut oil

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène N. est une dame mariée de 62 ans avec 7 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche ovine et cette activité lui permet d’assurer à sa famille de bonnes conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité.
texts.en:
Mbène N. is 62 years old, married with seven children. She fattens sheep for a living and this activity provides her family with good living conditions, healthcare and schooling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten sheep

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah sells bags of maize in Oyo state, Nigeria, where he lives with his family. He is a hardworking man and he is so determined to excel in his business and family life. 

He hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more bags of maize to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He is married with three children and is 50 years old. He hopes to give his children a quality education. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana Sardón vive en casa propia en la zona  de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y su hijo.
La señora Juana trabaja junto con su esposo en la construcción en viviendas particulares de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de gradas de concreto en dos pisos de su vivienda, ya que con la que cuenta es de madera de construcción y propensa a generar accidentes.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana S. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz with her husband and son. Juana works together with her husband in construction particular to apartments in the city, the income of which supports her family. The loan she is asking for is for the construction of concrete steps on two floors of her apartment as the current steps are made of wood and have a propensity for generating accidents.

This is the third time that she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates that she qualifies favorably and should be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of concrete steps in two floors of her apartment to replace wooden steps in poor condition

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 16 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento Cusco.  Urubamba es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. dulces D. forma ambulatoria, venta D. llantas, venta D. productos secos, venta D. huevos, venta D. bebidas alcohólicas como la chicha (Bebida regional del Sur del Perú), venta D. animales menores y otros brindan servicio D. transportes y soldadura. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Alejandrina es socia del banco comunal Virgen Asunta, tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Alejandrina tiene tres actividades laborales como por ejemplo la crianza D. animales menores, la venta D. chicha, venta D. comida y venta D. verduras. La socia nos cuenta que hace 27 años que se dedica a la venta D. chicha, comida y crianza D. animales, ella compra animales pequeños del distrito D. San Jerónimo y después los hace engordar, ella lleva sus productos a vender por ejemplo, los días Martes, Jueves y sábados a la comunidad D. Chincheros y los días miércoles y viernes al mercado D. productores D. Pintacha.  Alejandrina nos cuenta que alquila un terreno para cultivar productos como por ejemplo maíz. La socia con mucha pena nos cuenta que los terrenos donD. cultiva sus productos fueron inundadas por las aguas del rió vilcanota dejando perdidas, ella antes toda la cosecha D. los productos vendia a 2,800 soles pero ahora está vendiendo sus productos a bajo precio y pésima calidad. La socia requiere el préstamo D. los 800 soles para comprar gallinas, ella aproximadamente comprara 100 gallinas crías y tambien comprara alimento para los animales.       
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “VIRGEN ASUNTA” communal bank is in its 5th loan cycle and is composed of 16 hard-working and enterprising people who are constantly looking for ways to get ahead in life and proviD., though their efforts, a better future for their children. The members resiD. in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Urubamba is a city that is renowned for its archaeological sites, its scenery and its history; it is a charming city in the southern part of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sale of food, sweets sales, and tire sales, dry products sales, egg sales, alcoholic beverage sales (like Chicha, a regional beverage from the south of Perú), the sale of small farm animals. Others proviD. transportation and welding services. The communal bank has had several loan cycles. The members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training; they also appreciate the increase in capitalization they get from leaving their funds in a common account for a period of time. Alejandrina, 48, is a member of the Virgen Asunta communal bank. She is married and has 5 children. She is engaged in three different commercial activities: she raises small farm animals, sell chicha and sells food and vegetables. She relates that for the last 27 years she has sold chicha and food and has raised animals. She buys small animals in San Jerónimo, raises them and, when they reach proper weight, sells them. On Monday, Thursday and Saturday she sells in Chincheros and on Wednesday and Friday at the Pintacha farmers market. Alejandrina tells us that she leases land to farm her products, for example, corn. She regrets to inform us that the lands she uses to plant her crops were flooded by water from the Vilcanota River which caused major losses. She used to sell her products for 2800 soles but she now has to sell extremely poor quality product for a very low price. She needs 800 soles to buy chickens; she will buy approximately 100 chicks as well as feed for them. The members, as a group, are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 chicks as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou G. est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’huile d’arachide et de légumes. Avec ce prêt elle souhaite mieux aider sa famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Codou G. is a 41-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children. She is active in selling peanut oil and vegetables. With this loan she would like to be able to help her family more with the daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of peanut oil and vegetables

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina C. vive en casa propia en la zona  de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hija.
La señora Paulina trabaja como obrera en la unidad de mantenimiento de la alcaldía de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones en su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Paulina C. lives with her daughter in her own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Paulina works in the maintenance unit in the office of the mayor of this city. This income supports her family. The requested loan is to finish construction on two rooms in her house. It is the second time she has asked for a loan. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of finishing two rooms in her house (stucco and paint)

loans.name: Seliatu

texts.en:
Seliatu sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers who are usually friends and residents. She has been in this business for a long time and loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Seliatu hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Seliatu is married with six children and lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est veuve et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 2006 (3ans et demi) et a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à O7 fois de suite. Fatou D. est restauratrice, ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en s'approvisionnant en denrées telles que du riz, de l'huile végétale, du mil, des légumes, et constituer un fonds de roulement. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de nourrir ses enfants, de prendre en charge leur santé, leur scolarité et leurs autres besoins.
texts.en:
Fatou Diange is a 55 year-old widow and a mother of four. She has been a member of the Darou-Khoudoss credit association since 2006 (three and a half years) and has had a positive experience with loans, having received seven consecutive ones. Fatou D. is a restaurant owner, and this loan would enable her to develop her business and stock up on goods such as rice, vegetable oil, millet, vegetables, and also to create some working capital for the business. The profits generated by the business would enable her to feed her children and look after their health, schooling and other needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promoting her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Janeth vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa de los suegros en la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz; ella y su esposo se dedican a la costura, trabajan con los comerciantes mañaneros (se denominan así por que abren sus puestos de venta muy temprano en las mañanas, de 6 a 9).

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (tela, botones, cierres e hilo) y confeccionar uniformes para los colegios.

Es cliente de impro y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Janeth lives with her husband and children in her in-laws' house in the Cotahuma neighborhood of La Paz. She and her husband are tailors. They work with the "comerciantes mañaneros" (morning merchants, so-called because they open for business very early in the morning, from 6-9). She will use the funds to buy supplies (fabric, buttons, zippers and thread) to manufacture school uniforms. She is an Impro client and repays well so she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Hondonados 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Hondonados, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Santa’s group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and their child.

Santa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling beauty supplies to her neighbors. She will use the loan to purchase hair products, accessories, women's beauty products, combs and notebooks to stock her operation.

Santa will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing medicine for her grandchildren who are sick. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase hair products, accessories, women's beauty products, combs and notebooks

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra T. est une femme mariée de 53 ans, mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de céréales locales et aimerait renforcer son activité avec ce prêt pour aider à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diarra T. is a 53 year-old married mother of four. She makes a living selling local cereals and would use the loan to help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of local cereals

loans.name: Tamemsu Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tamemsu Traders' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. The 55-year-old Aminata was born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to an Imam and they have 4 children. Aminata sells cooked rice and has been in this business for five years now. Aminata is seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, onions, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil, rice, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene un taller de carpintería donde elabora muebles de madera y también recibe renta de jubilado. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de la Paz; vive en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de madera, cola, clavos, venesta y otros).
Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Orlando has a carpentry shop where he manufactures wood furniture; he also receives a retirement stipend. His home is in the Villa San Antonio Bajo neighborhood of La Paz; he owns his house. The loan will be used to buy supplies like: wood, adhesive, nails, plywood, etc. This is his 9th loan with Impro. His credit history confirms that he is a good client with respect to repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, adhesive, plywood, nails and other carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells drinks, snacks and more. She has been in the business for over eight years and she is very happy with the growth her business is experiencing since she joined LAPO micro-finance.

Florence wants her business to grow and expand continuously as it will also positively affect her profit making. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks, juice and snacks to sell.

Florence is 40 years old, married with two children, and lives together with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and snacks to sell

loans.name: Blanca Estrella Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Blanca Estrella” y está conformado por 15 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. Ellos se dedican principalmente al comercio de lencería, frutas, verduras, hot dogs, arreglos florales, cuadros de madera y venta de  ropa.
Paola es delegada de este banco comunal, en la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, agachada, con un ramo de maravillas (flores) en su mano y viste polera negra. Ella es florista hace 17 años, compra flores en Talca y en Santiago y hace arreglos para vender en una calle del centro de la ciudad, ya que no tiene un local establecido y está gestionando sus permisos. Invertirá este préstamo en rosas rojas y azules, papel celofán, papel de arroz, cinta y autoadhesivos.
Su sueño es tener un kiosco de flores en una esquina del centro de Talca. Su gran motivación son sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años los cuales dependen solo de ella. 
Para Paola Fondo Esperanza ha significado una gran oportunidad para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera mantener a su familia
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. La mayor parte de la población habita en el sector rural, la cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del C.. Se caracteriza  por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial.  Sus principales atracciones son la flora, la fauna, y sus viñedos. A pesar que la fuerza de trabajo se ha incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Blanca Estrella” (White Star) and is composed of 15 members, who reside in Talca. They are primarily engaged in the sale of lingerie, fruits, vegetables, hotdogs, floral arrangements, wood picture frames and clothing sales. Paola is a delegate of this communal bank. In the photo, she is in the front row, bent over with a bouquet of maravillas (flowers) in her hand; she is wearing a black shirt. She has been a florist for 17 years. She buys flowers in Talca and Santiago and makes floral arrangements to sell in a downtown street because she doesn’t have a fixed locale; she is negotiating permits. She will use the funds to buy red and blue roses, cellophane and rice paper, ribbon and self-adhesives. Her dream is to have a flower stand on a Talca corner. She is motivated by her two children, 13 and 8 years of age, who depend solely on her. For Paola, Fondo Esperanza has meant a great opportunity to continue with her work and support her family. Talca is in the Maule region located in the central part of the country. Most of the area’s population lives in rural surroundings and are engaged in commercial activities related to farming. It is characterized by its beautiful crafts and colonial architecture. Its main attractions are its flora, its fauna and its vineyards. Although employment has increased, this region continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the country’s poorest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red and blue roses, cellophane and rice paper, ribbon and self-sticking adhesives.

loans.name: One Day Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'One Day Group' from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

On the right in the photo is Hawa S. who is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 33-year-old is married to a civil servant and they have 2 children. A native of Bo city in southern Sierra Leone, Hawa is now a resident of Waterloo where she has been selling firewood and charcoal for over 6 years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying piles of firewood and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gran Fortaleza De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “GRAN FORTALEZA DE SAN JERONIMO”, actualmente se encuentra en el X ciclo y esta conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta de cebiche, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de auto partes de carros, venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y venta de artesanía y otros brindan servicio de albañilería y servicios de hospedaje. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Constantina es socia del banco comunal Gran fortaleza de San Jerónimo, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Constantina alterna sus actividades del hogar con preparación y venta de comida. Su esposo de la socia Constatina se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. La socia nos cuenta que su esposo sale trabajar a las 4 a.m.  y regresa a las 7 p.m. Constantina lleva desayuno y almuerzo para su esposo todos los días y para sus empleados, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta y confección de mantas y ponchos. Ella requiere el crédito para su aumentar el capital de su negocio, con una parte del préstamo comprara lana y con la otra parte pagara a su empleado la mano de obra.    

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Gran Fortaleza de San Jeronimo” (Great Fortress of San Jeronimo) is currently in its tenth loan cycle and consists of eleven hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to succeed. Through their daily efforts, they have been able to provide a better future for their children. The members of this Communal Bank live in the District of San Jerónimo in the Province of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its historical center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most charming cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members include selling ceviche, food, clothing, automobile spare parts, snacks via traveling sales, and handicrafts. Others provide services such as masonry and lodging. The members indicate that the Communal Bank has participated in numerous loan cycles and that they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training classes. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Constantina is a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Fortaleza de San Jeronimo”. She is 55 years old, married, and has five children. Constantina divides her time between her household activities and her business of preparing and selling food. Her husband manufactures bricks and tiles in the District of San Jerónimo in Cusco Province. Constantina says her husband leaves for work at 4am and returns at 7pm. She takes breakfast and lunch every day to her husband and his employees. In her spare time, she makes and sells blankets and ponchos. She is requesting a loan to increase her business capital. Part of the loan will be used to buy wool and the remainder will be used to pay an employee for performing work by hand.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and pay employee wages

loans.name: Wake Up Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Wake Up Group' from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Heading this group is 43-year-old Yeanor Sesay, pictured on the right. A native of Binkolo village in northern Sierra Leone, Yeanor is married to a businessman and they have 3 children. Yeanor is a businesswoman who has been selling cooked rice, meat, and vegetables for more than 10 years now. With her share of the loan (SLL 500,000), Yeanor will expand her business by buying cooking materials like rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, vegetables, etc., in larger quantity.

loans.use: Buy cooking materials like rice, palm oil, fish, vegetables, etc., in larger quantity

loans.name: Rokhy

texts.en:
Rokhy S. is 55 years old, married, and the mother of eleven children. She lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois", NGASCOP, for three and a half years. Her activities consist of selling peanut oil as well as raising sheep. She sells both products at the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey.

This loan allows Rokhy S. to buy 125 liters of peanut oil and four lambs. The earnings from selling these products in the market allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase peanut oil and four lambs

loans.name: Help Wesef Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Help Wesef Group' from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,900,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Fatmata J. who is pictured on the left is the leader of this group. Fatmata is approximately 47 years old, married to a teacher, and they have 6 children. Two of her children are attending secondary school, two are in primary school and two are already adults. Since childhood, Fatmata has been selling market food – ogiri (used to give sauce a sweet flavor), onions, tola (also used in sauces) and Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste). With her share of the loan (SLL 800,000), Fatmata will buy a bag of 'benny' (sesame seeds, used to produce ogiri), 1 carton of Maggi cubes, and 1 bag of onions.

loans.use: Buy a bag of 'benny' (used to produce ogiri), 1 carton of Maggi cubes, and 1 bag of onions

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are small-scale entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They named their group 'Sorry For We'. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,400,000 from Kiva Lenders in order to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Thirty-six-year-old Adamsay K. is the leader of this group. Adamsay (pictured on the left) was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has 2 children – one in class 2 and the other in class 5. For more than 6 years now, Adamsay has been selling cottons, lace, slippers, etc. With her share of this loan, Adamsay will buy lace, cottons, poplin, slippers and so on.

loans.use: Buy lace, cottons, poplin, slippers and so on to expand her business

loans.name: Martha Idelira

texts.es:
Martha R. de 62 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Es madre soltera con dos hijas ellos ya están casados.  

Martha empezó vendiendo comida a las personas que viven por su sector, cuando obtuvo ingresos suficientes compro mesas y sillas y las ubico en la esquina de su casa para vender la comida. 

Ahora ella tiene clientes establecidos en todo el sector donde vive. Trabaja desde las 07:30 hasta las 15:30 todos los días en ocasiones su hija le ayuda en la venta de las comidas. La inflación que ha tenido los alimentos en Ecuador le ha sido de dificultad para poder implementar otros platos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y carnes para su comedor. En el futuro quiere vender en las noches comidas y tener ya un local propio.
texts.en:
Martha R. is 62 years old and lives in a periurban district along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement. She is a single mother with two daughters who are already married.

Martha began selling food to people who live in the area. When she obtained enough money to buy tables and chairs, she moved her food vending business to the corner of her house. Now she has established customers from all over her neighborhood. She works from 7:30am until 3:30pm every day. Her daughter will help her on occasion with selling the food. Inflation of food prices in Ecuador has made it difficult for her to implement new dishes.

With this loan, Martha wants to buy rice, sugar, and meat for her diner. In the future she wants to sell food at night since she already has her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and meat

loans.name: Odofo Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are small-scale entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They named their group 'Odofo Traders' (Yoruba, meaning 'God is the Provider') group. The are seeking a loan of SLL 3,200,000 from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Pictured on the right is Umu S. M. who is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 35-year-old was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have 3 children who are attending school – one in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II), one in class I, and the other is in class IV. 

Umu has been a businesswoman for more than 10 years now. Umu is the owner of a “cigarette box” (similar to, but smaller than a kiosk) where she sells cigarettes, soft drinks, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, cold water, etc. With her share of the loan, Umu will develop her business further. In addition to buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to the current stock, Umu will also use the loan to buy cooking materials in order to start selling cooked rice.

loans.use: Buy cigarettes, soft drinks, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, cold water, etc., and also  cooking materials

loans.name: Thérése Bousso

texts.en:
Thérése Bousso G. is a 68-year-old widow who lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for thirteen years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Thérése raises sheep which she sells in the market, an activity very common in her village since there is a grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey. This loan allows her to buy eleven lambs.

loans.use: To purchase eleven lambs

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 57ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a eu à bénéficier de 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle développe un petit commerce de céréales, elle vend du mil, du maïs et du riz. Par ailleurs, elle commercialise également du sucre. Son activité lui a permis de s'équiper par l'achat d'un réfrigérateur et son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a 57 year-old married mother of three. She has been a member of the Darou-Koudoss credit association for three and a half years and has received seven loans that have all been successfully managed and repaid. She is developing her small cereal business, and currently sells millet, corn and rice as well as sugar. She has been able to use the proceeds from her business to purchase a refrigerator and her ultimate aim is to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling cereals

loans.name: By God In Power Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are small-scale entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,700,000 from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their well-being. 

Mariatu B. (pictured on the right) is the head of this group. Born in Kamakwe, northern Sierra Leone, the 30-year-old is married to a welder and they have two children. One is in nursery school and the other is in class II. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She owns a little stall where she sells rubber bowls, dishes, cups, baskets, and many different types of containers made out of plastic. With her share of this loan, Mariatu will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock of goods.

loans.use: Buy plastic bowls, dishes, cups, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Salapateh Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu B., who is pictured on the right in the back row, is the leader of this group who call themselves 'Salapateh' and come from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These women have applied for a loan of SLL 3,400,000 from Kiva lenders in order to further boost their businesses. As such, they will be able to attract many customers, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone, the 48-year-old Rugiatu is married to an Imam and they have nine children – five in secondary school, one in primary school. The rest are now grown-ups and on their own. Since childhood, Rugiatu has been a businesswoman. Currently, she sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, foofoo (food made out of cassava roots), bananas, 'gari' (junk food also made out of cassava roots) and as many more locally produced items as she can lay hands on. With her share of this loan (SLL 800,0000), Rugiatu will buy locally produced goods like the ones mentioned above and any other lucrative locally produced goods available in the market.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, foofoo, bananas, 'gari' and many more locally produced items

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Iii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”, actualmente se encuentra en el XIII ciclo y esta conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito D. Cusco la provincia D. Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur D. país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta productos secos, venta de alimentos, venta de comestibles y venta de comida  y otros brindan servicio de transportes.  El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

La socia Rosa forma parte D. banco comunal la “Nueva Generación” y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa.
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos (L., Sheyla y Santos Ollantay), ella se levanta muy temprano para atender a su familia como por ejemplo prepara desayuno para sus hijos y los envía al colegio, después hacer sus actividades D. hogar su actividad comercial es la confección de ropa de lana de forma manual como por ejemplo, ella confecciona chompas para bebes recién nacidos. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella heredó el trabajo de sus padres. Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar ovillos de lana, hilos, elásticos, botones y muchas cosas más.                   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Generacion III” (New Generation III) is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle and consists of twelve hardworking and enterprising individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members include selling dry goods, snacks, groceries, food, or providing transportation services. The members indicate that the Communal Bank has participated in numerous loan cycles and that they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training classes. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Rosa is a member of the New Generation Communal Bank. She and the other members meet every 30 days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa. Rosa is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (L., Sheyla, and Santos Ollantay). She wakes up very early to attend to her family, such as preparing breakfast for her children and getting them ready for school. After taking care of her household activities, she engages in her business of making woolen clothing by hand. For example, she weaves sweaters for newborn infants. Rosa has been in this business for 15 years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She inherited this business from her parents. Rosa needs a loan to buy balls of wool, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items

loans.name: Emprendedoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurs), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Rosa lives with her husband and five children in a simple home in Los Alcarrizos, a crowded suburb of S. Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Rosa runs a successful business running a small pharmacy in her community. With this loan, she will fill basic prescriptions and purchase standard medicines to sell to her community.

This is Rosa’s second loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, Rosa hopes to continue the growth of her business. This will help her to support her family, allowing her children to study and become professionals in anything they choose. Rosa is very grateful for her loans, saying that by investing into her business, her profits have grown and her business has become well known throughout her community. With her client base growing, Rosa looks forward to taking out more loans in the future.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Rosa and the Emprendedoras group!

loans.use: To buy medicines and prescriptions to fill customer orders

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
La joven Dora María su negocio es destace de  cerdo el cual lo vende por libra la carne así como chicharrones, fritos y rebanos ella tiene 5 años en esta actividad es madre soltera con un hija de 4 años la cual atreves de su negocio a salido adelante también con el apoyo de sus padres.
Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cerdos con lo cual ella se ayudara ya que quiere iniciar a construir su casa ya que en la actualidad vive con sus padres
texts.en:
Dora María butchers pigs to sell the meat by the pound; she also sells chicharrones (fried pork skin), fries and radishes. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She's a single mother of a 4-year-old daughter. With her work and help from her parents, she has managed to get ahead. The loan will be used to buy pigs which will produce earnings that will help her build her house because she presently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Yhiret Group

texts.es:
Yesenia se inicio en la venta D. zapatillas por medio D. una amiga  que le enseño sobre ese tipo D. negocio, compraba  zapatillas por cantidad a menor precio y luego las ofrecía casa por casa a sus amigos y familiares ella coloca el producto con una inicial y el resto lo cobra en partes, D. esa manera obtiene mas ganancias, D. esa misma forma le empiezan a pedir ropa y otros productos. Es  así que deciD. abrir una tienda en su propia casa, luego  empieza a viajar a Trujillo por que le pedían zapatos D. buena calidad. poco a poco obtiene muchos clientes y su negocio prospera mucho lamentablemente al enfermar su hija tuvo que dejar el negocio y dedicarse a su familia después D. un tiempo ha retomado el negocio pero solo venta a domicilio y le va bien por que sus clientes están conformes, con sus ingresos ha logrado estabilidad económica a la vez que ayuda a su esposo en la construcción D. su propia casa.
Mas adelante Yesenia quiere tener un restaurante D. comidas típicas, ella estudio un curso para ser chef y le gustaría ejercer, es  para eso que ahorra por que desea  comprar un terreno  adecuado donD. poner su restaurante,  ella junto a 8 socias integra el grupo  “YHIRET” ya tiene en EDAPROSPO cerca D. 4 años y se siente feliz por el apoyo que recibe D. la entidad,  ahora usara su préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene pedidos por entregar  la época escolar es una buena oportunidad para su negocio y lo aprovechara al máximo.

* Yesenia aparece en la foto con polo rojo y pantalón azul es la sexta D. las que están sentadas.
texts.en:
Yesenia began selling sneakers thanks to a friend who taught her about that kind of business; she would buy a quantity of sneakers at a lower price and then she would offer them to friends and family by going door to door. She reserves the product with a down payment and the balance is given in payments, and in this manner she makes more profit, and in this same way they have begun to request clothing and other products. This is how she decided to open a store in her own home, and then began to travel to Trujillo because they would request good quality shoes. Little by little she gained more clients and her business prospered a lot. Unfortunately, when her daughter became ill she had to leave the business and dedicate herself to her family. After some time she has returned to the business but only in-home sales and it is going well because her clients are OK with that. With her income she has achieved economic stabilty as well as being able to help her husband with the construction of their own home. In the future Yesenia would like to have a restaurant that serves traditional food; she has taken a course to be a chef and would like to serve as one. It is for this reason that she is saving money because she wishes to buy an adequate piece of land where she can build her restaurant. She and 8 partners are members of the group “YHIRET”. She has been with EDAPROSPO for close to 4 years and is happy with the support that she has received from this entity. Now she will use her loan in order to buy clothes and sneakers since she already has orders to fulfill. The school year is a good time for her business and she will take full advantage of this time. * Yesenia appears in the photo with a red shirt and blue pants; she is the 6th person seated.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and sneakers

loans.name: Africa Romano 1,3 Group

texts.en:
Elida is the coordinator of her group, Africa Romano, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Elida’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and grandchildren.

Elida is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cosmetics by purchasing rouge, deodorants and soaps to sell to her clientele.

Elida will use the profits to invest in her grandchildren by purchasing them school supplies as well as purchasing a pig to raise. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy soaps, deodorants, rouge, etc.

loans.name: Barbara Graciela

texts.es:
Bárbara León de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Es soltera pero ya todos sus hijos se han independizado.   

Bárbara aprendió a coser desde muy pequeña ya que su madre le enseño a hacer bordados, tejer, etc. Debido a la necesidad que tenia cuando cumplió 15 años comenzó a realizar su propio trabajo con cliente de su madre. 

Ahora ella tiene su propia maquina de coser en su casa y con clientes fijos. Trabaja desde las muy temprano hasta terminar todas las piezas de tela. La diabetes que tiene es una de las complicaciones más fuertes que tiene para su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tela, hilos, una cortadora para su negocio. En el futuro  quiere tener un taller bien construido y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Bárbara León, 51, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is cement. She is single and all her children are now independent. Bárbara learned to sew as a little girl because her mother taught her to embroider, to knit, etc. Because of need, at the age of 15, she began her own work with some of her mother's customers. Now, she has her own sewing machine at home and regular customers. She starts her work very early in order to finish all the fabric pieces. One of her greatest challenges in her work is her diabetes.
