She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and a pattern cutter for her business. In the future, she would like to have a well-supplied shop and to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Fabric, Thread and a Pattern Cutter.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for twelve years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame D.'s main activity consists of raising sheep which she sells at the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. With this loan, she will buy ten lambs. The revenues from this activity allow her to cover the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase ten lambs

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 6 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia, 22, is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Jesús es Prosperidad (Jesus is Prosperity), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Yessenia lives with her husband and three children in a simple home in Santiago, the second-largest city in the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Yessenia runs a beauty salon which serves customers in her community. With this loan, Yessenia will purchase hair-care and nail-care products to be used in her salon.

This is Yessenia’s very first loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. She will use her profits to purchase necessities for her children, including diapers and formuL. for her brand-new baby girl. Yessenia dreams of growing her business so that she will have the extra money to send all of her children to college. This will give them a significant step up in their community and is an opportunity that Yessenia did not have.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Yessenia and the Jesús es Prosperidad group!

loans.use: To buy shampoos, makeup and other hair-care and nail-care supplies

loans.name: Esperando En Dios 2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group Eseperando en Dios (Hoping with God), and her story is representative of other in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients overall, many of whom have recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their child.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loans which she successfully used to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more gasoline, charcoal, and boots to sell. This is a good business as there is no gas station in her area, thus she provides a much-needed service. She will use the additional profits to purchase school supplies for her children and to make home improvements. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, gasoline, and boots to sell.

loans.name: Felicita Ramona

texts.es:
Esta cliente es una profesora la cual esta ubicada en el Rpto Felix Pedro Carrillo y ella es originaria de la comunidad de la quimera.
Pero con sacrificio compro un lote de terreno y de acuerdo a sus posibilidades y a un prestamo que leemos otorgado a logrado venir mejorando su casa de habitacion y por ende tener un mejor nivel de vida.
Cabe mencionar que esta cliente fue alfabetisada y con tanta dedicacion a logrado coronarce como profesora de primaria pero ella sigue estudiando y lleva segundo año de licenciatura en Sicologia.
texts.en:
This client is a teacher located in Rpto Felix Pedro Carrillo, she is originally from the community of La Quimera. With much sacrifice she bought a lot suitable for her plans, and with a loan, she successfully made improvements to her home with the goal of a better standard of life. She will use this loan to purchase wood for a door, cement blocks, cement, and labor. We should mention that this client is educated, and with a lot of dedication she successfully achieved the position of primary school teacher. She is continuing her education, currently in the second year of a Sociology degree.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of home improvement supplies and labor

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 4,8 Group

texts.en:
B. is the coordinator of her group Fuente D. Paz (Source of Peace), and her story is not unlike others in her group, and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients overall, many of whom have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner.

B. is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans which were used to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothes selling business by purchasing skirts, blouses, and pants in the main market at Santo Domingo and then reselling them in her community. She will use the profits to relocate her business to an area where the is more traffic, and also to get her legal documents in order so that she can go to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Adèle F. est une femme de 66 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, et de poissons. Son activité lui a procuré des ressources financières qui lui ont permis d'équiper sa maison en se payant des meubles de salon. Son mari est admis à la retrait depuis plus de 5ans et elle le soutien dans le payement des factures d'électricité et autres charges familiales.
texts.en:
Adèle F. is a 66-year old woman who is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KOUDOSS for three and a half years and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She is building up a small vegetable and fish business. Her business has procured for her financial resources which have allowed her to fit out her house with the purchase of lounge furniture. Her husband has been retired for more than five years and she supports him in the payment of electricity bills and other family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Lidy

texts.fr: Lidy est une femme de 36 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHODOSS depuis 3ans et a eu 7 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'effets vestimentaires. Et parallèlement elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Les ressources financières générées par son activité lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de pouvoir faire face à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Lidy is a 36-year old woman who is single without children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KHODOSS for three years and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She is building up a small business selling cosmetics and clothes. At the same time she does beef fattening. The financial resources generated by her business allow her to take care of and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Lilliana

texts.es: La señora Lilliana B. tiene la edad de 47 años, casada, con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, el mayor de estos esta en su último año de la universidad y los otros dos están cursando la secundaria. Ella es Odontóloga General y labora para el centro de Salud Posoltega desde hace 20 años, nuestra institución le ha otorgado 4 créditos desde hace 4 años los cuales ha utilizado los 3 primeros para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último para pagar el título universitario de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lilliana B. is 47 years old, married and has 3 children under her care. Her oldest is in his last year of university studies; the others are in secondary school. She is a dentist and has worked at the Posoltega Health Center for 20 years. Our insitution has granted her 4 loans in 4 years; she used the first three for home improvements and the last one to pay for her son's professional degree fees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the difference in an INFONAVIT down payment.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Agripina L. de Gómez tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Brigido Gómez y viven desde hace tiempo en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Miguel Cambyreta.

La señora Agripina y el señor Brigido poseen en su domicilio una linda despensa, bien surtida en donde venden varios tipos de mercaderias (articulo de 1ra necesidad, bebidas, lacteos, juguetes, articulos escolares, etc.). La misma es atendida por ellos mismos o por el hijo que también vive en el mismo lugar. Gracias a esta actividad la señora Agripina y su esposo han podido salir adelante, ir mejorando su local y aumentar cada vez mas su capital de trabajo, así también llevar una vida tranquila sin pasar necesidades y dar a sus hijos una buena educación.

La cliente ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías (artículos de libreria) ya que se ha iniciado las clases y tienen mucha clientela que acude a su local.
texts.en:
Señora Agripina L. de Gómez, 52, is married to Señor Brigido Gómez. They have lived for a while in their own home located in the San Miguel Cambyreta neighborhood. Señora Agripina and Señor Brigido have a pretty shop in their home, well stocked, where they sell various types of merchandise (first aid, beverages, milk products, toys, school supplies, etc.). The shop is staffed by themselves or by their son who lives with them. Thanks to this activity, Señora Agripina and her husband have been able to get ahead, improving their shop and increasing their working capital, as well as having a peaceful life without lacking the necessities, and giving their children a good education. She has requested this loan to purchase additional merchandise (notebooks, pencils, erasers, colored pencils,paintbrushes, etc.) since school has started and many clients come to their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stock for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna M. est âgée de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous majeurs mais à la charge de 2 qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis juillet 2006 et a eu 7 fois de suite à bénéficier de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes, elle est également détentrice d'un mercerie. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la famille et de participer à l'amélioration de des conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Anna M. is 64 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are adults; she is, however, responsible for two children who have been entrusted to her. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KOUDOSS since July 2006 and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She has a small business selling vegetables and she also owns a haberdashery. Her aim is to support her husband in the management of their family and to contribute to the improvement of the family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La señora Luz Elena E. y  su esposo el señor José Amando Vazquez tiene ya mas de veinte años con su taller de soldadura. 
Están solicitando un préstamo por poder poner un techo de estructura metálica en el taller ya que en la temporada de verano el sol esta muy fuerte y no los deja trabajar y tiene varios pedidos por realizar y entregar.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor José Amando Vazquez  esposo de la señora Luz Elena E. ya que ella se encontraba buscando material para el negocio, el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Luz Elena E. and her husband, José Amando Vazquez have had a welding shop for over 20 years. They are requesting funds to install a metal roof on the shop because the sun is very strong in Summer and keeps them for working; they have several orders pending. They plan to repay the loan with profits from the business. The person in the photo is José Amando Vazquez, Luz Elena E.'s husband because she was out shopping for supplies for the shop the day the home visit took place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a metal roof.

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria De La Luz M. tiene ya más de tres años en el negocio de venta de paletas  frías, nieve y jugos. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más mercancía, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía que le está haciendo falta para las ventas del verano.
Es negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz M. has sold frozen treats, ice-cream and juices for over 3 years. She needs stock for her business but lacks funds with which to purchase it. For this reason, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise that she needs to have available for summer sales. The business is her family's source of income and profits from it will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her ice-cream shop.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio V. Ramirez posee un comercio de venta de bebidas en el barrio Arroyo Pora de la ciudad de Encarnación esta casado con la señora Paulina Aguilar Silva y tienen tres hijos viven en casa propia en el barrio Pacu Cua de esta cuidad, el destino del crédito fue para aumentar su stock de mercaderías.
El negocio es atendido por el y por su señora, el comenta que el negocio ayuda muchísimo con los gasto de la casa para la alimentación y vestimenta.
Agradece el préstamos concedido por la Fundación y Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Ignacio V. Ramirez has a business selling beverages in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood in the city of Encarnación. He is married to Señora Paulina Aguilar Silva and they have three children living in their own home in the Pacu Cua neighborhood of the city. The purpose of this loan is to increase his stock of merchandise. He and his wife attend to the business; he says that this business helps a lot with the household food and clothing expenses. He is very grateful for the loans provided by the Foundation and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for resale

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Emilie NDIONE est une femme de 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle a également la charge d'une nièce et d'un neveu. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a bénéficié 7 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce d'effets vestimentaire et de l'embouche ovine. Elle est aussi détentrice de dépôt de boissons. Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et celle de son neveu et sa nièce.
texts.en:
Emilie NDIONE is a 68-year old woman who is married and has four children; she also has responsibility for a niece and a nephew. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DAROU-KHOUDOSS for three and a half years and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She has a small clothes business as well as a beef fattening activity. She also owns a drinks store. Her aim is to help her husband take care of their children as well as her niece and nephew.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her small commercial activity and livestock business

loans.name: Ma De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria De La Luz V. y sus esposo el señor Victoriano Estrada son padres de dos hijos de mediana edad, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.  
Con ahorros han construido un su casa pero le esta haciendo falta el techo de una cuarto que será para sus hijos. Tiene el proyecto de realizarlo de concreto ya que es más duradero y seguro. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene trabaja en una casa particular de limpieza, ya que sus esposo el Don Victoriano se encargara de los gastos familiares con las ganancias del taller de herrería. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa y que vivan en un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz V. and her husband, Victoriano Estrada are the parents of two children for whom they want to provide the best. They have used savings to build their house but it still lacks a roof over a bedroom that will be for the children. She wants to install a concrete roof because it is more long-lasting and more secure. They plan to repay the loan with income she earns working as a domestic employee in a private home since her husband, Victoriano, will see to family expenses with earnings from his ironworks shop. They want their children to have their own space in the house and that they live in a better place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For concrete roofing.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina V. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de productos y artículos para dama por catalogo.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. Tiene un hijo pequeño bajo su responsabilidad y a quién le quiere dar lo mejor. 
Le esta haciendo falta mercancía para tenerla en exhibición y desea también empezar la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo ya que muchas de sus clientas le están pidiendo que venda. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía e iniciar el negocio de la venta de ropa, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. 
Desea tener un mayor ingreso para darle lo mejor a su hijo, planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Martina V. has sold catalogue women's articles for over three years. This business is her family's source of income; she has a small son under her care for whom she wants to provide the best. She is lacking merchandise to have on display and she also wants to start selling clothing and new shoes because many of her customers are asking for these items. She is asking for funds to buy the merchandise to be able to start the clothing and shoe sales business because she currently lacks money for such an investment. She hopes to have higher earnings to provide the best for her son; she plans to repay the loan with profits fro the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Arlly Maria

texts.es:
esta cliente esta ubicado en la comunidad de el cambio las lomas y ella ya ha tenido 5 creditos con nuestra empresa .
ella ha obtenido para diferemtes sectores economico porque le financiamos para crianza de cerdo y hoy le dimos para ganado pero como esta barato tiene pensado incrementar mas el ganado.
tiene una espiritu de superacion y agrandar mas el hato ganadero.
texts.en:
This client is located in el Cambio, Las Lomas. She has had 5 loans with our firm. She has gotten loans for a variety of commercial activities. We have funded pig raising and today we provided funds for cattle because it's inexpensive now and she plans to increase her cattle herd. She has the spirit for self-improvement and to increase her herd size.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep her calves.

loans.name: Rito

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la fotografía es la esposa de Rito C. Míreles.

Rito C. Míreles es una persona trabajadora que quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere terminar un baño que empezó hace tiempo y por otras cosas que se le han presentado no ha podido terminarlo; por eso es que pide el apoyo para terminar su proyecto ya que necesita pintar el baño y comprar accesorios.
Rito es quien mantiene la casa es por ello que tiene dos trabajos, uno en el se desempeña como chofer de transporte de carga y el otro como vendedor de casas y con estos ingresos pagara el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Rito C. M.' wife. Rito C. M. is a hard-working person who wants to improve his quality of life. This is why he has been building his home gradually to offer his family comfort and equitiy for the future. He wants to finish a bathroom that he began some time ago and which, due to unforeseen circumstances, has been unable to complete. The funds will be used to finish the bathroom; it needs paint and several accessories. Rito supports his household with two jobs: he transports cargo and sells real estate. He will use income from these to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Com complete bathroom interior finishes.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa del señor José Gabriel.

José Gabriel es una persona muy ocupada el trabaja en una maquiladora la mayor parte del día; es por ello que su esposa decidió dedicarse a la casa para el cuidado de sus tres pequeñas hijas. La pareja esta preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijas es por ello que desean darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ellos quieren que se les apoye para poder realizar su proyecto de dividir sala comedor de su vivienda y para esto necesitan comprar el material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is José Gabriel's wife. José Gabriel is a very busy person that works in a maquiladora (bonded assembly plant) most of the day. His wife decided to be a full-time housewife to care for their three small daughters. The couple is concerned for the wellbeing of their daughters and would like to provide them a better quality of life. They need help in getting materials and supplies and to pay labor costs to divide their living room-dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To divide his living room-dining room.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Emilie S. est une femme de 63 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de draps de lits, de pagnes teintés et de tissus. Ses bénéfices lui servent à prendre en charge les différentes charges familiales et à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, tels que la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Emilie S. is a 63 year old woman, widowed and the mother of 5 children. She is a member of the Villagers Bank of Darou-Khoudoss for the past three and a half years and has received 7 loans that she has always handled well and repaid regularly. She has a small business of bed linens, dyed cloths and fabric. Her earnings would help her take control of the various family expenses and to meet the needs of her children, such as food and their health.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her buisness to generate profits

loans.name: Jenifer Jose

texts.es:
este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limon,se dedica a la actividad comercial como es la venta de fritanga, es casada y su marido trabaja en la empresa triton minera, actualmente tienen una casa en proceso terminal de construccion, lo que lo han efectuado con ahorro de salrio y prestamos pequeños.
con la empresa ha obtenido 6 creditos pequeños los cuales han sido de gran utilidad, ya que tiene construida su vivienda y sigue haciendo mejoramiento en divisiones.
texts.en:
This client is from Mina el Limon, her business is selling fried snacks. She is married, her husband works in the Triton Mining Company. They have a house in the final stages of construction, which they have accomplished through savings from his salary plus small loans. Through her business, she has obtained 6 small loans that have been very useful to her, enabling her to build her house. Now she is in the process of constructing the interior walls.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and labor

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús R. L. con este crédito ya será el tercero y agradece por el apoyo brindado ya que en los anteriores créditos fue para apoyar  el estudio de sus 4 hijos. Como Jesús siempre se ha preocupado por la preparación académica de su familia, no le ha dado importancia a su vivienda es por ello que este crédito lo quiere para terminar de construir la cochera para protección de sus autos y también hacer mas grande su sala comedor. Para poder terminar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
This will be Jesús R. L.'s third loan; he is grateful for the support he's gotten because he used the previous loans to pay for his four children's schooling. Because Jesús has always been mainly concerned for his family's education, he hasn't paid much attention to his home. He needs funding now to finish building his carport to protect his cars and to enlarge his livinhg room. To finish the project he needs to buy materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction.

loans.name: María Ángelica

texts.es: María Angélica J. L. es una mujer trabajadora que apoya a su esposo con los gastos; es por ello que opto por poner un negocio para atender a su familia y no estar fuera de casa. Angélica tiene su casa y es amplia solo que desde que puso el negocio se tuvo que reducir para ponerlo en un cuarto.  Es madre de 2 hijos pequeños que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida, confort y un patrimonio. Es el motivo que la lleva a pensar en construir e la planta alta de su casa para que cada de sus hijos tenga su cuarto para que tengan su propio espacio cuando ya sean unos adolescentes.
texts.en:
María Angélica J. L. is a hard-working woman who helps her husband meet household expenses. To do this, she chose to set up a home-based business in order not to neglect her children. Angélica has her home and it's spacious. However, once she installed the business in a bedroom, she gave up some living space. She has two small children and would like to provide them with a better quality of life, more comfort and equity for the future. For this reason she has thought of building a second storey on her house so that each child can have a bedroomroom and their own space when they become teenagers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mar está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Dina Guadalupe Pavón O. quien tiene desde hace seis  años tiene una pequeña venta  la cual cuando inicio comercializaba pocos productos que con los prestamos ha mejorado. Ella además de mejorar su negocio pudo componer algunos detalles de su casa que se encontraba deteriorada pero aun no ha terminado según comento.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Margelia del Socorro B. Narváez quien tiene un taller de costura y vende productos Avon y Martha Lizbeth Alvarado Solís quien comenzó una pequeña verdulería y con forme le dieron los créditos en Adim incluyo la venta de carne y hueso.
texts.en:
The group "Mar" is formed by 3 hardworking women. One of them is Dina Guadalupe Pavón O., who has had a small shop for 6 years. When she started out she had very few products, but with the loans this has improved. She comments that in addition to improving her store, she was able to complete some repairs to areas of her house that had deteriorated and that she had not finished. Her fellow group members are Margelia del Socorro B. Narváez, who has a dressmaking workshop and sells Avon products, and Martha Lizbeth Alvarado Solís, who started a small vegetable shop which, with the loans from ADIM, expanded to include the sale of meat and bones for cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina E. N. desde ya hace tiempo compro a un familiar la vivienda donde vive actualmente. Solo que por motivos no ha podido escriturarla, con este crédito lo quieren utilizar para arreglar este tramite ya que es el patrimonio que quieren dejar a su hijo el mas pequeño. 
El esposo de María  Cristina tiene dos trabajos para solventar los gastos y la señora se queda en casa para cuidar a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Cristina E. N. bought the house where she currently lives from a relative a while ago. For several reasons she has not been able to formalize it legally. She will use this loan to settle the transaction because this is the inheritance they want to leave their youngest son. María Cristina’s husband has two jobs to pay the expenses. She stays at home to take car of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legally formalize house ownership

loans.name: Fausta Teofila

texts.es: Fausta Teofila tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea Mary” con el ya tiene ocho años, solo que en año pasado bajaron las ventas y se fue escaseando de abarrotes en el que tiene poca mercancía, pero no por eso ella dejo de vender refrescos y botanas en las que sigue persistente ya que en lugar donde vive hay una escuela cerca y los niños son los que siguen consumiendo. Pero Fausta quiere comprar abarrotes para tener más ventas y así tener más ganancias. Su esposo es muy trabajador que se dedica al transporte de taxi y sale todas las mañanas a buscar clientes.
texts.en:
Fausta Teofila has been running a general store called “Miscelánea Mary” for 8 years now. Unfortunately, last year sales went down significantly, and she started running out of groceries, but this did not stop her from selling snacks and soft drinks. Even now, she is still selling these goods because there is a school nearby, and the students consume what she offers. However, Fausta would like to purchase groceries in order to boost sales and obtain greater profits. Her husband works very hard as a taxi cab driver, and he goes out every morning to look for customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María Ávalos es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace 3 años invirtió en una papelería y novedades llamada “Doña Ana” donde ofrece precios bajos y mejor mercancía. Ana María quiere estar preparada para el tiempo de calor ella cuenta con freezer en el quiere comprar helados para vender y ofrecerles a su clientes algo refrescante para el calor que se vive en esta ciudad esto es para aumentar sus ventas diarias y sí obtener mas ingresos a su familia. La papelería esta en el terreno de su casa pensando en el cuidado de sus hijos y estar al pendiente de ellos.
El esposo se dedica al transporte de carga como son los trailers de México a EUA y es por ello que hay momento que no se encuentra en casa.
texts.en:
Ana María Ávalos is an enterprising woman who invested her money 3 years ago in a stationery and novelty store called "Doña Ana," offering the best products at the lowest prices. Ana María wants to be prepared for the hot weather, so she has a freezer that she would like to fill with ice cream to sell to her customers to cool down. In so doing, she will boost her daily sales and bring in bigger profits for her family. The store is located on her house property because she was concerned with being able to look after her children.

Her husband transports cargo as a truck driver in both Mexico and the USA, which is why he is not home at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for stationery store

loans.name: Toribia Petrona

texts.es: este cliente es originario del poblado de larreynaga,se dedica a la actividad comercial, como venta en pulperia,su marido tiene una fabrica artesanal de fabricacion de ladrillo rojo,los cuales en conjunto administran directamente la pulperia,y la fabrica solo el señor,actualmente tiene 3 creditos con la empresa los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento en el inventarios de sus productos en la misma,
texts.en:
This client is originally from the town of Larreynaga. She dedicates her career to sales in a grocery store. Her husband has an craft factory to make red brick, and both together go to the administrative costs of the grocery store. The factory is only run by her husband. Currently they have have 3 credits with the firm, which have gone to improvements in the inventory of the products in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, and household goods

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita L. Fernandez es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya, ella es una mujer trabajadora, posee una despensa en donde invierte los créditos que le otorga la Fundación para mantener constantemente con todas las mercaderías que el cliente necesita.
Ella vive en el Barrio Arroyo Pora del distrito de Cambyreta de la ciudad de Encarnación. El destino del crédito fue para la compra de mercaderías para aumentar su stock de su despensa, ella administra muy bien su despensa ya según ella es prácticamente el sostén de la casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita L. Fernandez is a repeat client of the Fundación Paraguaya. She is a very hardworking woman who owns a general store in which she invests the loans that receives from the Fundación in order to keep a steady flow of goods that her customers need. She lives in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood of the Cambyreta district, in the city of Encarnación. This loan will be used to purchase goods to restock her general store. She manages her shop well because according to her, she is practically the household's only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, bread, cooking oil, sausages, and other goods

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Doncellas lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que buscan como sacar a sus familias adelante una de ellas es Blanca Ibón Solórzano OS. quien vende teléfonos desde hace dos años. En este negocio le va muy bien según comento Solórzano es por esa razón que desea ampliarlo e invertir mayor capital.

Mientras Noelia López S.  comenzó vendiendo sopa de res, mondongo, de queso, de pollo y de hueso los fines de semana con lo cual ahorro un pequeño capital e instalo una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. La otra integrante es Irma I. quien desde hace tres años  vende prendas y perfumes.
texts.en:
The Las Doncellas Group is comprised of hardworking and enterprising women who are looking for a way to help their families get ahead. One of the members is Blanca Ibón Solórzano OS., who has been selling telephones for two years. Solórzano states that her business has been very prosperous, which is why she wants to expand it and invest more capital in it.

Meanwhile, Noelia López S. started selling beef stew, and cheese, chicken or bone mondongo (a hearty Latin American soup made of slow-cooked tripe) on weekends. She managed to save enough capital to establish a fritanga--a popular restaurant that sells fried foods.

The other group member is Irma I., who has been selling clothing and fragrances for the last three years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephones, accessories, phone cards, etc.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 43 años, está felizmente casado con Rosinda de 33 años, tienen 5 hijos, 2 de ellos adolescentes y 3 menores. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la sierra central peruana.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a cultivar arveja y papa en sus terrenos propios, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y eventualmente de sus hijos. Esta familia está convencida de que la agricultura es la actividad que les permite vivir cómodamente y cubrir sus gastos en general. Por esa razón Hugo quiere continuar trabajando con préstamos porque así puede asumir tranquilamente los gastos agrícolas y obtiene más ingresos económicos porque amplia su producción. Para el futuro piensa adquirir más propiedades que cederá a sus hijos para que puedan generar sus propios beneficios cuando crezcan.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que vive agradecido con todas las personas que hacen lo posible para que acceda su solicitud y le permiten progresar. También se muestra contento de trabajar en su banco comunal, pues está integrado por personas responsables, puntuales y muy solidarias. Con los mil quinientos que solicita podrá comprar dos bolsas de semilla de arveja aprovechando la temporada de este producto.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 43-year-old man who is happily married to Rosinda, age 33. Together they have 5 children--2 teenagers and 3 younger ones. This family lives in their own house in the Central Peruvian Sierra.

For 4 years, Hugo has been cultivating peas and potatoes in his own crop fields. He has the help of his wife, and he will eventually have his children's help. This family is convinced that agriculture is the activity that allows them to both live comfortably and cover their general expenses. For this reason, Hugo would like to continue working with loans because this way, he can calmly take on his agricultural expenses and obtain a bigger income because the loans allow him to expand production. In the future, he plans to obtain more properties, which he will then hand over to his children so that they can generate their own income when they grow up.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is grateful to all the people who make these loans possible, allowing him to make progress. He is also happy to work in his communal bank, which is comprised of responsible, punctual, and united people. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will purchase two sacks of pea seed, thus taking advantage of the pea season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seed

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven de 19 años, vive con sus padres Mario de 69 y Gabriela de 59 años.
La responsabilidad de hacerse cargo de sus padres lo impulsaron a incursione en la agricultura, actividad que no le gustaba por lo sacrificado que es, pero desconocía lo gratificante.
Ahora ama los terrenos que le cedieron sus padres donde cultiva papa y arveja, productos que le generan mayores ingresos económicos al comercializarlos a los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado de su ciudad. 
Desde hace 4 años labra sus tierras sólo con operarios, a quienes contrata por campañas agrícolas, ya sea para sembrar, limpiar o cosechar sus frutos.
Como le va muy bien en la siembra y tiene ahorros está planeando construir su casa propia para más adelante formar su hogar, a la vez quiere recuperar todas las chacras de sus padres para hacerlas producir.
 
Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se siente muy contento de poder responder puntualmente al pago mensual de sus cuotas, por lo que es admirado por la gente de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arveja, dos bolsas de abono orgánico y dos botellas de insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
The responsibility of having to look after his parents pushed him to get into agriculture, which he did not like because of the strenuous work involved. However, he had not realize how gratifying it was. He now loves the crop fields that his parents handed over to him. He cultivates potatoes and peas, the crops that yield the biggest profits from wholesalers in the area.

He has been working his crop fields along with laborers whom he hires seasonally, be it for sowing, pruning, or harvesting. Because he has been prosperous in agriculture and has enough money saved up, he is planning to build his own house so that he can start a family in the future. At the same time, he also wants to revitalize his parents' farms to make them productive.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he feels very happy to be able to make his monthly payments on time, which is why the other communal bank members admire him. He will invest the money that he is requesting in purchasing two sacks of pea seed, two sacks of organic fertilizer, and two bottles of insecticide to spray his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 32 años, está casado con Elizabeth de 28 años, con quien tiene 3 pequeños hijos. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada en una comunidad de la sierra central.

A diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana porque tiene que caminar alrededor de una hora y media para poder trabajar en sus cultivos. Esto no le molesta, al contrario considera que es normal debido a la ubicación de sus terrenos y porque cada esfuerzo que realiza lo hace pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Hace 5 años que se dedica a esto y lo que más le gusta es cosechar porque luego comercializa sus productos para cubrir los gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos. Pero como no es una persona conformista y quiere compartir más actividades con los miembros de su familia, desea encontrar un trabajo estable y seguro, pero también rentable como la agricultura.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y confiesa que ya viene ahorrando para no fallar a los integrantes de su banco comunal con los pagos, pues todos se esfuerzan para sacar adelante su grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará cinco sacos de fertilizantes para cuidar adecuadamente sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 32-year-old man who is married to Elizabeth, age 28, with whom he has 3 young children. They live in a rented house in the town of La Sierra Central.

He wakes up at 5 in the morning daily because he has to walk for about an-hour-and-a-half to be able to get to his crops. However, this does not bother him. To the contrary, he considers this to be normal due to the location of his fields, and because he keeps his family's well-being in mind every time he puts in a lot of effort. He has been in agriculture for 5 years, and what he likes most is harvesting because he then sells his produce and pays for both the household expenses and his children's education. However, since he is a non-conformist, he would like to share more activities with his family, so he wants to find a steady job that is as lucrative as agriculture is.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he admits that he has been saving up money so that he will not default on his loans and let his communal bank members down because they all work hard to help the group get ahead. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is now requesting, he will purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer in order to adequately care for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María C. de 61 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de un edificio con el tiene 3 hijas. 

Debido a la falta de ingresos y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio María con la idea de su hija de vender ropa, inicio como vendedora informal en la esquina de su casa con camisas deportivas.

Ahora ella tiene su propio local aunque pequeño pero lo tiene surtido con camisas, pantalones, zapatos y en ocasiones con ropa interior. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa deportiva, zapatos para que su negocio este más surtido. En el futuro quiere ampliar el local del negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old María C. lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil in a house that is made of cement. Her husband works as a security guard in a building, and they have 3 daughters.

Due to her lack of funds and to the exasperating idea of having her own business, María decided to sell clothing. She started out selling athletic shirts informally in a corner of her home.

She now has her own small but well-stocked shop, where she sells shirts, pants, shoes, and sometimes even undergarments. She works from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day.

With this loan, she wants to buy sports apparel and footwear so that her business can be better stocked. In the future, she would like to expand her business space and reinforce her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sports apparel and footwear

loans.name: Marcia Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Marcia I. vive en la comunidad de Maluay en la parroquia El Valle, esta localidad  es  reconocida por  que es una gran productora de maíz y papas, su gente mayor se dedica a la agricultura y los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad o al extranjero en busca de un mejor porvenir.

Marcia tiene 28 años de edad, se encuentra casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su localidad, su esposo es carpintero y aún  no han logrado construir su casa por lo que viven en la casa de un familiar.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la limpieza de oficinas, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 8am. a 12 pm. tiene 2 años trabajando en este oficio, también se dedica a la cría de chanchos inculcada  por sus padres, además  va a incursionar en la ventas por catálogo de la línea  de cosméticos y bisutería Yanbal.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la fundación gracias a la invitación de su prima a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres organizadas que luchan para tener días mejores, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo   va a comprar cremas, tratamientos, labiales, sombras, perfumes y más  productos YANBAL  y pagar una deuda adquirida por la compra de  un electrodoméstico para su hogar.

Su gran sueño es salir adelante junto a su familia y entregar  lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcia I. lives in the town of Maluay, in El Valle parish. This area is known for producing corn and potatoes. The older generations in the area work in agriculture, while the younger ones have either migrated to the city or gone abroad in search of a better future.

Marcia is a 28-year-old married mother with 2 children, ages 10 and 8, who attend the local elementary school. Her husband is a carpenter, but they have not been able to build their own house, which is why they are currently living at a relative's house.

Our client cleans offices for a living. Her work schedule is Monday-Friday, 8am to 12pm. She has been in business for 2 years now. She also raises pigs for a living, an activity which she learned from her parents. Furthermore, she is going to start selling Yanbal cosmetics and fashion jewelry by catalog.

She is currently in her third loan cycle with our institute, thanks to the fact that her cousin invited her to join this group of organized women who struggle for better days. She states that the loans have greatly benefited her business. With this new loan, she will purchase lotions, skin products, lipsticks, eye shadow, fragrances and other Yanbal products. She will also pay off a debt that she incurred when purchasing a home appliance.

Her greatest wish is for her and her family to get ahead, and to be able to give her children the very best.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal beauty products and pay off a debt

loans.name: Miler

texts.es:
Miler tiene 36 años, comparte su vida con su amada esposa Miriam de 29 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Todos viven en su casa propia, construida a base de adobe y teja.    

“La agricultura y la ganadería son actividades que se hicieron para mí”, comenta; es por eso que desde hace 9 años se dedica al cultivo de papa, maíz y arveja. En compañía de su esposa, quien arrea hacia el campo a los toros y vacas que crían extraen la leche para elaborar unos deliciosos quesos que comercializan en las tiendas de comestibles de su localidad. 
Y así como le gusta atender a sus animales, también le agrada observar cómo germinan de a pocos los productos que entregó a la tierra para que los haga producir. Lo que no le gusta es tener que madrugar para regar sus siembras. Cada día, junto a su pareja caminan alrededor de dos horas hacia sus chacras, mientras conversan de los proyectos futuros que emprenderán para vivir cómodamente. Entre esos planes, está el de comprar una casa en la ciudad para instalar un negocio de venta de tubérculos, ya que esta actividad le deja buenas ganancias que les permite ahorrar para cumplir sus metas. 

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, agrade esta oportunidad de crédito y promete responder con puntualidad en sus pagos, pues su deseo es salir adelante junto a sus compañeros de banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cinco sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes, además de tres botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Miler is a 36-year-old man who shares his life with his beloved wife Miriam, age 29, and their 4 underage children. They live in their house, which is made of adobe and tile.

"Agriculture and cattle farming are activities that were made for me," he states. For this reason, he has been cultivating potatoes, corn and peas for the last 9 years alongside his wife, who herds their bulls and cows. They milk the cows in order to make delicious cheeses, which they then sell at local general stores.

Just like he loves to attend to his animals, he also loves to observe how the seeds that he put into the earth germinate and then produce. What he does not like, however, is getting up so early to irrigate his crops. Every day, he and his wife walk for about 2 hours towards their small farms, all the while conversing about the future plans that will help them lead a more comfortable life. Among those plans is buying a house in the city so that they can launch a tuber business since this venture will yield the profits they need to save enough money to reach their goals.

This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he is very grateful for the loan, promising to be punctual in making his payments. He wishes to be able to get ahead along with his other communal bank members. With the money that he is requesting, he will purchase 5 sacks of organic and chemical fertilizer, as well as 3 bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años, está casada con Víctor de 48 años, ellos viven junto a sus 4 hijos (mayores de edad) en su casa propia.

Desde hace 25 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, arveja y diferentes variedades de verduras. Asimismo, para tener otros ingresos económicos cría toros y vacas que también le ayudan a trabajar en la chacra y le proveen de leche para elaborar ricos quesos. Gracias a su trabajo y al apoyo de sus hijos, ya que suelen distribuirse las tareas agrícolas, a Nora le gusta más alimentar al ganado. Desde muy pequeña, al igual que a su pareja, le agradó vivir en el campo, alrededor de los pastos verdes, pero sus hijos decidieron arrendar la gran mayoría de sus terrenos para que no se sacrifiquen mucho, por lo que para más adelante piensa vender quesos y choclos en un mercado de la capital.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que por su trabajo puede acceder a futuros créditos; a su vez, viene motivando a los integrantes de su banco comunal para que desarrollen actividades mutuas en fin del progreso de todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 10 sacos de semilla de papa y 3 botellas de insecticida.
texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking woman of 41 years of age. She is married to Victor, 48, and they live with their four children (all grown) in their own house. For 25 years, together with her husband, Nora has worked growing potatoes, corn, peas, and a variety of vegetables. Also, for additional income, they raise bulls and cows, which help them in fields and also provide milk to make delicious cheeses. Nora counts on the help of her children, who usually sell her agricultural products while she prefers to take care of the animals. From an early age, both she and her husband have enjoyed living in the country next to green fields. Their children, on the other hand, have decided to rent out most of their land as they plan to spend most of their time selling cheeses and corn in a market in the capital. This is Nora’s third loan with MFP. She knows that by working hard she can obtain future loans. She encourages the members of her communal bank to develop projects that will benefit them all. With this loan, Nora will buy ten bags of seed potatoes and three bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seed and insecticide

loans.name: Super 7 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Super 7 está integrado por  tres mujeres que como muchas nicaragüenses son luchadoras incansables en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida de sus familias y por ello  se enfrentan a jornadas de trabajo arduos.

 Adim es una institución que se dedicada al desarrollo empresarial de las mujeres a quienes propicia su desarrollo integral con la oferta de créditos y capacitación-formación en desarrollo empresarial y autonomía.  Esto les ha beneficiado según comentaron las integrantes de este grupo porque han aprendido a  crecentar sus negocios con inversiones adecuadas y a economizar. 


La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Bertha García G. quien en el 2003 compro dos plantas Telefónicas con lo que empezó su pequeño negocio de alquiler de teléfonos. Este negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente ella además de alquilar teléfonos, vende recargas y accesorios para celulares y por otro lado comercializa ropa usada.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María del Carmen C. quien tiene una modesta pulpería y Francisca del Pilar O. Alemán vende comida especialmente derivados del chancho como frito, moronga, nacatamales…etc.
texts.en:
The Group “Super 7” is made up of three women who, like many Nicaraguans, are tireless fighters in search of a better quality of life for their families, so they face up to difficult trips to their jobs. Adim is an organization dedicated to the development of women entrepreneurs and assists them by providing loans, training, business development, and autonomy. The ladies tell us that this has helped them because they have learned how to economize and grow their businesses with adequate investments. Bertha is the group’s coordinator, who bought two phone banks in 2003 and started a small business renting phones. This business has been growing and now, besides renting phones, she also sells chargers, cellular accessories, and second-hand clothing. The other members of the group are; Maria, who runs a small grocery shop and; Francisca who sells food derived from pork such as fritters, sausage, nacatamales, etc…

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 24 años, está casado con Hermelinda de 23 años y tienen un hermoso e inquieto hijo de 4 años; ellos viven en su casa propia.  

Con perseverancia y esmero logró adquirir sus terrenos agrícolas que lo llenan de orgullo, los mismos donde ahora siembra papa, arveja y algunas verduras. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposa, ambos llevan 4 años dedicándose a la agricultura, siendo su pequeño hijo el motor que los impulsa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es proteger sus cultivos de las plagas, las inclemencias del clima y mantenerlos limpios para conseguir una cosecha productiva, sin embargo lo que le incomoda es trasladar hacia los mercados los pesados sacos de tubérculos que oscilan entre 60 y 70 kilos. Por ello viene ahorrando celosamente para que más adelante pueda comprarse una camioneta que le facilite el transporte de sus productos.                    

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y le entusiasma continuar trabajando con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes para cuidar el crecimiento y desarrollo de sus cultivos de arveja.
texts.en:
Raul is 24 years old. He is married to Hermelinda, 24, and they have a beautiful, rambunctious 4 year old son. They live in their own home. With perseverance and meticulousness, he was able to acquire his farmlands, which makes him very proud. He now cultivates potatoes, peas and some vegetables. He does this together with his wife and they have been farming for four years. Their little boy is the engine that drives them. What they like the most about their work is protecting their crops from plagues, the weather, and keeping everything clean in order to have a productive harvest. What he doesn't like is having to carry the heavy bags, that weigh between 60 and 70 kilograms (130 and 155 lbs) of tubers to the markets. He is saving jealously so that he will be able to buy a van in the future. This will facilitate the transportation of his products. This will be his fourth loan through MFP and he is enthusiastic about being able to work with his communal bank because it is made up of united responsible people. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer that he will use to maintain his pea crop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
Viviano es un hombre emprendedor de 37 años, vive con su pareja Juli de 26 años y sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia, ubicado en un poblado llamado “Huasahuasi” en la sierra central peruana.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a sembrar arveja y papa, productos que son muy solicitados en los mercados de la selva central, donde los vende a buen precio porque conocen la calidad y variedad de los tubérculos que lleva. Mientras Viviano, trabaja en la chacra para solventar los gastos familiares y brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos, su esposa realiza los quehaceres de la casa para que su familia esté bien atendida. De la actividad que realiza lo que más le gusta es fumigar sus cultivos para evitar que las plagas lo invadan, pero le resulta difícil soportar los olores que emanan los remedios, pero sabe que son bastante necesarios para asegurar su cosecha. Actualmente viene ahorrando porque anhela construir una casa grande en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar una tienda que le facilite vender su producción agrícola y otros comestibles.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está satisfecho por su trabajo, confiesa que le gusta pertenecer a la junta directiva de su banco comunal porque aprende de cada uno de los integrantes. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita tiene previsto comprar 15 costales de semilla de papa, 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, 2 kilos de remedio para curar las enfermedades de los tubérculos y algunos sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Viviano is a 37-year-old entrepreneurial man who lives with his 26-year-old partner Juli and his two young children in their own home, which is located in a town called “Huasahuasi” in the central mountain-range of Peru. For the past ten years, he has been planting peas and potatoes, which are products in high demand in the markets of the central jungle. They sell at good prices because his clients know he offers a wide variety of tubers and that his products are high quality. While Viviano works the farm to provide for his family and provide them an adequate quality of life, his partner manages the household chores to make sure her family is well taken-care-of. Of all of his tasks, Viviano most enjoys fumigating his crops to make sure the insects leave them alone, but he also finds it difficult to tolerate the smell of the treatments. He knows, however, that it's a necessary task for his farming. He is currently saving because he hopes to build a big house in the city where he can set up a store to sell his agricultural products and other foods. This is the fifth loan he has received from MFP and he is very proud of his work. He confesses that he likes to be part of the governing council of his communal bank because he has learned from every one of the bank's members. With this loan of 2,500 soles that he is about to receive, he is going to buy 15 bags of potato seeds, 2 bags of pea seeds, 2 kilos of treatments for tuber diseases, and a few sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and plant treatments

loans.name: Silvana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora  Silvana S. es otra de las socias del banco comunal Maluay, vive a  las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca a unos 30 minutos en la comunidad Maulay en la parroquia el Valle, caracterizándose  por ser la mayor productora de papas y maíz, además de ofrecer  hermosos paisajes  de la serranía ecuatoriana. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos AVON lleva 3 años trabajando en esta actividad y ya cuenta con su clientela fija que las visita de casa en casa,  también tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa donde ofrece productos para el hogar y adornos.

Este  es su tercer ciclo en el bankito  y fue su tía y una prima de su esposo  quienes la incentivaron a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras, nos comenta que los créditos le ayudan a cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar e ir incrementando poco a poco su negocio.

Silvana tiene 21 años de edad, siendo su estado civil casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad y actualmente se entero que se encuentra embarazada de 2 meses, su esposo trabaja en una ferretería, la casa en la que habitan es prestada por sus familiares quines no le cobran el arriendo.

Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra de vitrinas para su bazar, teniendo como meta algún día poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvana S. is a member of the communal bank Maluay. She lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca, around 30 minutes from the Maulay community in the Valle province, which is known for being the greatest producer of corn and potatoes as well as having beautiful mountainous Ecuadorian landscapes. Her business is the sale of AVON products (cosmetics), which she has been running for 3 years and now has a loyal and constant clientèle who she visits in their homes. She also has a small stand in her house where she offers home goods and decorations. This will be her third loan cycle from this great group of strong women who make up her communal bank, which she joined thanks to encouragement from her aunt and her husband's cousin. She tells us that her loans have helped her to cover her household expenses and to slowly but surely grow her business. Silvana is 21 years old, married with one child, and two months pregnant. Her husband works in a hardware store. The house they live in is owned by some family members who do not charge them rent. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, Silvana is going to buy class cases for the cosmetics stand in her house, with the goal of one day being able to afford to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of glass cases to display cosmetics in a store within her house

loans.name: Cristian Group

texts.es:
María José P. H., Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández y  Cenia Delfina P. P. son tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes laboran arduamente con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia. Estas conformaron un grupo llamado Cristian donde la coordinadora es María José P. de 33 años la cual se dedica a la comercialización de variedad de productos desde calcetines, bisutería, prensa pelos,  desodorantes, perfumes, cosméticos etc.

Las otras dos integrantes Cenia Delfina P. P. vende cosméticos, ropa usada y nueva; mientras Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández comercializa ropa para niños de todo estilo y marca.
texts.en:
María José P. H., Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández and Cenia Delfina P. P. are three industrious women who work hard with the goal of helping their families. They have created a group called Cristian. María José P., the coordinator, is 33 years old and sells a variety of products such as socks, imitation jewelry, hair accessories, deodorants, perfumes and cosmetics, etc. Cenia Delfina P. P., one of the other members, sells cosmetics and new and used clothing. Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández sells an assortment of styles and brands of children’s clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy socks, imitation jewelry, hair accessories, deodorants, perfumes and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: José René

texts.es: Este cliente se llama José René E. Navarrete, tiene 39 años de edad, es agricultor, vive en una zona rural que se llama Cosmapa, de donde es originario, soltero, su compañera de vida no trabaja originaria también de Cosmapa, se dedica  a los que haceres del hogar, tiene dos hijo, el mayor está cursando los estudios secundarios, el menor está en escuela primaria, en nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cinco créditos, todos han sido para trabajar la tierra, generalmente se le ha prestado para la siembre de Arroz, es buenos hacer notar que todos los créditos otorgados a este señor los ha pagado en la fecha que le corresponde.
texts.en:
Our client, José René, is 39 years old, a farmer, and lives in the rural zone called Cosmapa where he comes from. He is single and his life companion who also comes from Cosmapa, doesn't work but takes care of household matters. They have 2 children, the older is in secondary school, while the younger is in primary school. José has had a total of 5 loans from our institution, and all were used in working the land. Generally, the loans have been for planting rice. It is important to note that all the loans granted to this gentleman have been paid off on the corresponding dates.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PREPARING THE LAND AND BUYING NECESSARY SUPPLIES FOR SOWING AND HARVESTING SESAME

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bendición de Dios II está conformado por tres exenciónales féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana M. V. una señora humilde, esforzada y emprendedora  ella inicio con la venta de cosméticos por que su esposo quien era mayorista y le ayudo a trabajar en este comercio. Esto le ayudo mucho porque empezó a valerse por sí misma y ayudar económicamente en la casa.

Mientras Karla María comercializa accesorios para celular y  la señora Tamara García desde 1993 inicio con un taller de costura y vende cosméticos por catalogo ya sea de Avon, la Zermat y Voget. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercaderías para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The “Bendición de Dios II” group is made up of three wonderful hard working women. One of these women is Juana M. V., a humble, strong and enterprising lady. She began by selling cosmetics because her husband is a wholesaler and could help her work in this business. This helped her a lot because she began to value herself and could contribute to the household finances. Karla María sells cellular phone accessories and, in 1993, Mrs. Tamara García started up a sewing workshop and also sells cosmetics such as Avon, Zermat and Voget from a catalogue. They will use the loan to buy merchandize for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La señora  María Juana P. vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia El Valle comunidad Maluay, esta comunidad se caracteriza por su vegetación, sus hermosos paisajes andinos, la mayor parte de su gente adulta mayor  se dedica a la agricultura ya que los jóvenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades o al exterior.

María Juana es socia del banco comunal Maluay, tiene 51 años de edad se encuentra casada, concibió 4 hijos el primero de ellos tiene 28 años es casado y formo su propia familia, sus hijos de 22, 20, 18 años  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente compartiendo los gastos del hogar  con su padre que se dedica a vender jugos naturales. 

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también a la cría de pollos, cuyes, labor que realiza desde muy pequeña ya que es como una herencia que  aprendió de su madre, sus animales los vende  a sus vecinos de la comunidad y también para el consumo en su hogar.

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la  fundación y nos comenta que los créditos  le han beneficiado mucho en su casa para ir mejorando su economía, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar crías de  cuyes y alimento para su crecimiento e incrementar su negocio.

Su gran sueño es no tener más deuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Juana P. lives outside the city of Cuenca in the parish district El Valle which is part of the community of Maluay. This community is known for its vegetation and beautiful Andean scenery. The majority of the older adults work in agriculture while the young people have migrated towards the big cities or foreign countries. María Juana is a member of the Maluay communal bank. She is 51 years old, married with 4 children. Her oldest is 28 years old and married with his own family. The other children are 22, 20, and 18 years old and they work and help financially by sharing the household costs with their father who sells natural fruit juices. María Juana dedicates herself to the household chores as well as raising chicken and guineapigs. This is work that she has done from a very young age and was a legacy passed on by her mother. As well as consuming the animals in the house, she sells them to neighbors in the community. This is her fourth cycle working with the foundation and we have noticed that her loans have greatly benefited her by allowing her to improve her economic status. With this new loan, she will buy breeding guineapigs and food in order to grow and expand her business. Her greatest dream is to have no more debts.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guineapigs and food for their growth

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sime, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo cuya principal actividad económica es la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, Luis se dedica a la agricultura para captar ingresos con los cuales pueda mantener a su familia. Actualmente tiene instaladas dos hectáreas de arroz ya transplantadas. Luis está cuidando mucho de su cultivo para asegurarse una buena producción que le brinde los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia.

Siguiendo este objetivo el desea abonar su cultivo para que este se desarrolle correctamente. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes para lograr su objetivo.

Luis es un padre de familia responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución ya ha demostrado tranquilidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir su pago. En la imagen aparece mostrandonos el accesorio con el que piensa aplicar los fertilizantes a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in the Sime neighborhood, a rural zone of the Pítipo district where the main economic activity is agriculture, located about forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Like the majority of men from the area, Luis works in agriculture to earn an income and maintain his family. He currently has 2 hectares of rice planted. Luis is taking great care of his crop in order to insure a good production which will provide him sufficient income move ahead with his family. Following his goal he wants to fertilize his crop so that it develops correctly. For that reason he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a credit of 1100 Soles which he plans to use for the purchase of fertilizers to achieve his goal. Luis is a responsible family man, dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to see his children achieve good careers. He has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated calmness and responsibility since assuming his payments. In the photo, he appears showing us the tool with which he plans to apply the fertilizer to his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: este cliente es originario de telica, actualmente tiene 3 creditos, de los cuales los ha utlizados en pagos de  modulos universitarios en la preparacion academica personal y para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
This client comes from the town of Telica. He currently has 3 loans that he uses to pay for university classes for his personal academic training and for making home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials, labor, and paint

loans.name: La Super Poderosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Super poderosa lo conforman  tres mujeres emprendedoras, luchadora y trabajadoras una de ellas es Karla Patricia Hernández F. quien inicio con la venta de productos Avon y luego con la ayuda de un hermano el cual le proporciono un lugar en su tramo para que ella pudiera comercializar  materia prima para calzado que es el otro negocio en que invirtió.

 Las otras integrantes son Marlon Esteban Hernández F. quien desde 1998 tiene una zapatería la cual ha ido creciendo actualmente el invertirá en la compra de maquinaria especialmente una plana para costuras eléctricas según menciono. Mientras Karen Eliette G. V. trabaja a domicilio realizando pedicura, manicure, peinados, cortes, tintes etc.

Ellos han sido participes de los otros servicios que oferta Adim es decir del proceso de capacitación y formación sobre genero y desarrollo empresarial lo cual según mencionaron les proporciono las herramientas y conocimientos necesarios para administrar su dinero y poder enfrentar sus problemas.
texts.en:
The "La Super Poderosa" group is comprised of three hard-working entrepreneurs with fighting spirits. One of the women is Karla Patricia Hernández, who began selling Avon products and later, by using a section of her brother's lot as a place where she could market raw material for footwear, invested in this other venture. Another member is Marlon Esteban Hernández F., who has had a shoe store since 1998. Currently he plans to invest in an electric sewing machine to serve that end. Karen Eliette G. V. works from home doing manicures , pedicures, hairstyling, cuts, color, etc. They have all been participants in other services that ADIM offers. The formative training process regarding business type and business development of the types mentioned have given them the necessary tools and knowledge to manage their funds and to be able to face their difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: En la compra de materiales de calzado

loans.name: Olman

texts.es:
El señor Olman C. V.  tiene 5 años de trabajar con  esta Institución financiera , El se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, habita en la comarca corre viento El Sauce, 
EL está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ternero en desarrollo  lo que venderá a un mejor precio  así poder   obtener  mayores ingreso y  abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Olman C. V. has been working with this financial institution for 5 years. He is involved in agriculture, and lives in the district of Corre Viento El Sauce.

He is requesting this loan to buy a young calf, which he will later sell at a higher price. This way, he will earn a better income and meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Aleyda Del Pilar

texts.es:
este cliente es originario de la cuidad de telica,se desempeña en el cargo de docente y labora en el instituto señor de esquipulas telica, ha obtenido 10 creditos los cuales los ha utilizados en desarrollo personal,
pago de modulos universitarios de hijos y para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
This client is originally from the city of Telica. She serves as a teacher and works in the Señor de Esquipulas high school in Telica. She has obtained 10 loans, which she has used for personal development, paying for her children's university studies, and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toilet, cement, sand, and pay for work

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ZOILA, TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA. TIENE CUATRO HIJOS DOS PEQUEÑOS Y DOS MAYORES DE EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MUJERES LATINAS" HACE 8 MESES, Y HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS EN RECONOCIMIENTO A SUS CUALIDADES MORALES, COMO LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, EL CUAL ESTA FORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. ZOILA SE DEDICA AL ALQUILER DE AUTOS PARA SERVICIO DE TAXI. HACE CINCO AÑOS SU ESPOSO OBTUVO UN TERRENO POR HERENCIA, EL CUAL VENDIÓ PARA PODER ADQUIRIR SU PRIMER AUTOMOVIL, CON EL FRUTO DE LOS SERVICIOS DE TAXI Y AHORRANDO POCO A POCO PUDO ADQUIRIR SU SEGUNDO CARRO.
HOY EN DÍA EL PRODUCTO DEL ALQUILER DE LOS TAXIS SIRVEN PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, LOGRAR UNA TRANQUILIDAD ECONÓMICA Y SOBRE TODO EL PAGO DE COLEGIO DE SUS DOS MENORES HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES ADQUIRIR SU TERCER AUTO, PARA LO CUAL ESTAN TRABAJANDO Y AHORRANDO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARAN PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE LOS AUTOS, REQUISITO INDISPENSABLE PARA TRABAJAR BRINDANDO SERVICIO DE TAXI EN LIMA.
texts.en:
