Zoila is 45 years old, married, and has four children, two small and two grown. She joined the “Latin Women” group 8 months ago, and in recognition of her good character, she was elected president. The group consists of 9 members living in the La Flor zone, Carabayllo district. Zoila’s business is renting out automobiles for taxi service. Five years ago, her husband inherited some land, which was sold to purchase her first car. With earnings from her taxi services, and by saving money little by little, she was able to buy her second car. Today, her taxi-rental business is sufficient to support her family, feel comfortable economically, and especially to pay for schooling for her two younger children. Her next goal is to purchase a third automobile, and she is working and saving towards that goal. The loan requested will be used for car maintenance, which is a requisite for providing taxi service in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto maintenance

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
este cliente es originario de la comarca de boqueron jurisdiccion de quezalguaque, es una productora que se dedica a la crianza de ganado especificamente a l a produccion de leche,
durante los 5 creditos que ha obtenido ha sido con el objetivo de crecer y mejorar su hato ganadero, el cual lo esta haciendo, por que tiene ganado de mejor raza.
texts.en:
This client is originally from the Boqueron district, in the jurisdiction of Quezalguaque. She is a producer who works raising cattle, specifically for the production of milk.

During the 5 loans she has obtained, she has had the goal to grow and improve her herd, which she is doing, because now she has cows of a better breed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 milk cows

loans.name: Pablo Ramón

texts.es:
El cliente pablo ramón L. C.vive en la comarca el barro municipio Achuapa se dedica principal mente a la ganadería este es el segundo crédito con nuestra institución CEPRODEL-El sauce, dicho crédito fue destinado para la compra de 2 ternero de desarrollo con el objetivo de mejorar su hato ganadero.
Los ternero lo realiza primordialmente con el objetivo de elaborar una yunta de bueyes el cual le permitirá el desempeño de su trabajo.   
El cliente cuenta con 3 hijos a su cargo y su esposa, 2 hijo están en la universidad y 1 en la primaria y su esposa copera con las actividades que se desempeñan.
texts.en:
Our client Pablo Ramón L. C.lives in the region of El Barro, Achuapa Municipality. He works primarily raising cattle. This is his second loan with our institution, CEPRODEL-El Sauce. This loan will be used to buy 2 calves with the goal of improving his herd.

He buys calves with the objective of creating a team of oxen, which will allow him to work. He and his wife have three children in their care; two are in university and one in primary school. His wife supports and helps him with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 calves for a team of oxen

loans.name: Aba Luz

texts.es:
La clienta Alba luz L. C.es el primer crédito otorgado Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, dicho crédito fue destinado para la compra de repuesto para sus molino el cual es su negocio propio que está ubicado en el municipio Achuapa, este cliente es reconocido en la zona como una persona honrada con entusiasmo de superar y mantener en buena condiciones el bien estar de su negocio. 
La clienta tiene 1 nieto y un hijo a su cargo quien cuida de él, está ubicada costado oeste colegio delita sorto Achuapa.
texts.en:
This is the first loan granted to our client Alba Luz L. Calderon through CEPRODEL. She used the credit for the purchase of a spare part for her mill, which she uses in her own business located in the town of Achuapa. She is recognized in the region as an honorable person with enthusiasm to succeed and keep her business in good condition. Our client has one grandson and a son who takes care of him, and they live on the west side of Achuapa.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a spare part for her mill

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr: Aly F. est une femme de 73 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis mars 2002 et a 17 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide pour la consommation alimentaire. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses enfants de plus jeune âge.
texts.en:
Aly F. is a 73 year old woman. She is widowed and lives with her 7 children. She has been a member of the Villagers Bank of Diongo since March of 2002 and has received 17 consecutive loans. She processes and sells peanut oil for food consumption. This allows her to provide for her personal needs and support her younger children.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her business to generate income

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es: Doña Luisa es una mujer trabajadora, de 53 años, vive en el barrio Máximo Jerez, junto a su esposo se han esforzado para dar a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, estudios,  su esposo trabaja como administrador de empresa, gracias al apoyo de, el logro poner su venta de fritanga hace varios años, ah adquirido buena clientela es por eso tiene tres trabajadores para poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, su esposo cuando llega de laborar la apoya, y sus hijos también ya que solo uno es casado, sus créditos lo ha invertido en el negocio ya que aumentado sus ventas, es por eso que con este comprara: granos básicos, cereales, carne, pollo, lácteos verduras, frutas, servilletas,  para la preparación de alimentos, así como comprar utensilios para los servicios de su pequeño comedor que espera dar mejor mantenimiento para que sus hijos puedan administrar en un futuro.
texts.en:
Luisa, 53, is a hard-working woman. She lives in the Máximo Jerez neighborhood with her husband. They have struggled to give their children the best nourishment and education. Her husband works as an administrator for a firm. She managed to set up her fast-food sales several years ago. She has acquired a good base of regular customers that have made it necessary for her to hire three employees in order to give better customer service. When her husband comes home from work, he helps out, too as do her children since only one of them is married. She has used her loans to invest in her business in order to increase her sales. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her meals: basic grains, meat, chicken, dairy products, vegetables, fruits, napkins as well as other utensils she needs for her small dining room hoping to care for it so that her children can run it someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit.

loans.name: Ngoma

texts.fr: Ngoma D. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et a la charge de 2 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre fondatrice du Banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis mars 1995 et a eu 27 fois de suite été bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée pendant plus de 2O ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, son mari le soutien dans l'entretien et la vente du bétail. Elle participe dans la prise en charge de la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ngoma D. is 44 years old, married and mother of seven children. She also takes care of two other children that were entrusted to her. She is a founding member of the DIONGO credit loan group since March 1995, and has benefited from 27 successive loans. In over 20 years of activity, she has developed a great deal of experience in the fattening of sheep and cattle. Her husband assists her in taking care of and selling the livestock. She participates in the handling of food expenses, healthcare and the children’s schooling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, actualmente se encuentra en el I ciclo y esta conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito de Quiquijana de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. La ciudad de Quiquijana se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta comida, venta de panes, venta y crianza de animales menores y venta de comestibles. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

La socia Eva forma parte del banco comunal la “Wiñay Kury” y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la casa de la socia Mabel en la ciudad de Quiquijana.

Eva tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, el mayor es independiente y dos dependen de ella todavía, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus tres actividades comerciales que son preparar y vender pan, vender comida, crianza y venta de animales menores. Eva nos cuenta que desde muy niña aprendió el oficio de la preparación de pan y  actualmente lo vende ofreciendo de forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos, ella también nos cuenta que de lunes a sábados se levanta muy temprano para preparar la masa y hornear el pan. Ella los domingos prepara platos de comida como por ejemplo seco de cordero y pescado frito y los vende en el mercado central de la ciudad. Ella requiere el préstamo  para comprar azúcar y harina. Eva nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que las lluvias afecto a su cocina dejándola inhabitable y matando a sus cuyes. Eva es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que representa al banco comunal y su anhelo es tener una panificadora.              

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “WIÑAY KURY” communal bank is in its first loan cycle. It is made up of 10 hard-working, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead in life and, through their own efforts, to provide a better future for their children. This communal bank is in Quiquijana district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history. It is an enchanting city in the southern part of the country. Quiquijana is about 45 minutes from Cusco. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: food sales, bread sales, small farm animal raising, grocery sales. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy with the credit services, the savings and the training they receive. They are especially happy with the value accrued by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Eva is a member of the“Wiñay Kury” communal bank. The members meet every 30 days in Mabel’s house in Quiquijana. Eva is 49 years old, married and has three children. The oldest is independent and two still are dependent on her. She alternates her household chores with her three commercial activities: she bakes and sells bread, she sells food and she raises small farm animals for sale. Eva tells us that she learned to bake bread when she was a little girl. She sells it door-to-door to her neighbors. She also tells us that from Monday to Saturday she rises very early to prepare dough and bake bread. On Sundays, she prepares dishes like lamb and fried fish to sell in the city’s central market. She needs funds to buy sugar and flour. Eva tells us sadly that the recent rains adversely affected her kitchen leaving it uninhabitable and killing all her guinea pigs. Eva is a hard-working, enterprising woman who represents the communal bank; her dream is to have a bakery. The members as a group are grateful for the help given and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Reyna es casada, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Reyna junto a su esposo son artesanos, realizan trabajos en telar como pasadizos. Además Reyna se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado en la feria de la región.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos.
Los sueños de Reyna son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una casa para cada hijo.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Reyna is married, 37-years old and has 6 children; Reyna and her husband are artisans and they make weavings, like hallway runners. Additionally, Reyna buys and sells cattle in the local fair. Reyna needs a loan of 1000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of threads. Reyna’s dreams are that her children become professionals, and to build a house for each one of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy threads.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Adelaida es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Adelaida viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, frutas y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Adelaida además realiza bellos tejidos en telar.
Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y frutas.
Los sueños de Adelaida son construir su casa para la tranquilidad de sus hijos, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Adelaida is married, 41-years old and has 5 children; Adelaida travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells vegetables and fruits; and from the jungle she buys fruits that she sells in the wholesale food market of the city. Additionally, Adelaida makes beautiful weavings in the loom. Adelaida needs a loan of 1000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fruits. Adelaida’s dreams are to build a house for the comfort of her children, to expand her business and to have her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle membre fondatrice du Banc Villageois de DIONGO dont elle est la présidente depuis mars 1995. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, une activité qu'elle maîtrise bien pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant plus d'une vingtaine d'années. Ses bénéfice lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is 43 years old, married and mother of eight children. She is a founding member of the DIONGO credit loan group of which she has been the president since March 1995. She fattens cattle for a living, an activity she masters well with over 20 years’ experience. The earnings allow her to participate in the improvement of the family’s living conditions and well-being.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two pairs of oxen

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Marcelo es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Marcelo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, que compra en las ferias. Además Marcelo se dedica a la confección de tejidos en telares.
Marcelo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Marcelo son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Marcelo is married, 50-years old and has 7 children; Marcelo buys and sells cattle that he buys at the fairs. Additionally, Marcelo makes weavings using looms. Marcelo needs a loan of 15000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of cattle. Marcelo’s dreams are for his children to become professionals, and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Bernardo es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo junto a su esposa tienen un cafetín en donde vende golosinas, comidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Bernardo son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Bernardo is married, 34-years old and has 2 children; Bernardo and his wife have a small café where they sell snacks and food every day. Bernardo needs a loan of 1250 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of snacks. Bernardo’s dreams are for his children to become professionals, and to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy snacks.

loans.name: Semilina

texts.es:
Semilina es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Semilina es soltera, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Semilina tiene una tienda en L. ciudad D. Huaytara en donD. venD. ropa variada, además compra y venD. tara, cochinilL..
Semilina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa.
Los sueños D. Semilina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Semilina is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Semilina is single, 43-years old and has 1 son; Semilina has a store in the city of Huaytara where she sells assorted clothes; she also sells and buys products from the tara tree and cochineal. Semilina needs a loan of 3000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of clothes. Semilina’s dreams are for his son to become a professional and to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes feria de la región en donde compra animales que luego vende en la feria de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Juana se dedica a la venta de pollos para recría.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Urubamba Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. Juana travels to different fairs in the region to buys animals that she will sell later at the fair in Ayacucho. She also sells chickens to raise.

Juana needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy animals. Her dreams are to see her children become professionals and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Violeta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Violeta, ofrece los productos variados como calzados, ropa interior, cosméticos y venderlos en su pulpería, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas deseaba diversificar y no vender solamente un producto, con el objetivo de aprovechar la afluencia de los clientes a su negocio. La señora nos cuenta, que necesita este financiamiento para mantener la afluencia de sus clientes. Su sueño siempre es tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado que brinde estabilidad económica a ella, su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta offers a variety of products such as footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, and sells them from her shop. She hopes to increase her sales of these products and, most of all, diversify her inventory and not sell just one product. With this objective in mind, she wants to take advantage of the influx of customers to her business.

Violeta says she needs a loan to maintain the growth of her customer base. Her dream has always been to have a large store in the market that will provide financial stability for her, her mother, and her family in general.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène D. est une femme de 58 ans et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis décembre 2006 et a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide pour la consommation alimentaire. Elle participe activement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène D. is a 58 year-old woman, and mother of four children she supports. She has been a member of the Diongo credit association since December 2006. She has benefited from six loans that she has always well managed and repaid regularly. Her work consists of fattening sheep and processing and selling peanut oil for food consumption. She is an active participant in improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep to fatten and peanuts

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WAYNA CCAPAC”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. medicamentos, venta D. productos secos, venta D. animales menores como pollos y cuyes, venta comestible y venta D. bebidas alcohólicas como la chicha y otros brindan servicio D. azafata. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Yessica es socia nueva del banco comunal Wayna Ccapac, tiene 28 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta D. medicamentos. La socia Yessica nos cuenta que hoy en día en el Perú es difícil encontrar trabajo permanente pero como ella es una mujer joven y emprendedora decidió abrir su propio negocio y así D. esta manera ayudar al ingreso económico del hogar, ella requiere el crédito para comprar más medicamentos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios Reynaldo y Sonia no están en la fotografía porque pedieron permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presentes el día del desembolso).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Wayna Ccapac” is currently in its fifth loan cycle and consists of ten hardworking and enterprising individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members incluD. selling medicines, dry goods, small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, groceries, alcoholic beverages such as “chicha”, or providing hostess services. The Communal Bank has participated in various loan cycles and the members are content and satisfied with the loans, savings, and training sessions. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Yessica is a new member of the Communal Bank “Wayna Ccapac”. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Yessica earns a living by selling medicines. She says that it is difficult today in Peru to find permanent work, but she is an enterprising young woman who decided to open her own business so that she could help generate household income. She needs a loan to buy more medicines.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time. (Members Reynaldo and Sonia do not appear in the photograph because they received permission from the directors to be absent on the day the funds were disbursed.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou W. est une femme  de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis décembre 2006. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés et de poissons fumés. Son activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou W., aged 42, is married and the mother of five children in her care. She has been a member of the credit association of Diongo since 2006. She sells dried and smoked fish. Her activity gives her an income that enables her to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her income generating activity

loans.name: Ndèye Ngoné

texts.fr: Ndèye Ngoné S. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINDIANE depuis 3 ans et demi et a bénéficié 7 fois de suite de crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de maintenir son activité d'embouche bovine. Elle va acheter 2 paires de bœufs pour les engraisser et les revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe activement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Ngoné S., aged 29, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the credit association of Sindiane for three and a half years and was granted 7 consecutive loans. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her cattle rearing activity. She will buy two pairs of oxen, fatten them and sell them after 4 or 5 months. She actively participates in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two pairs of oxen

loans.name: Los Solidarios De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS DE SAN ISIDRO”, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo y esta conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Nuestros socios en su mayoría son agricultores y ganaderos y también se dedican al comercio y a brindar servicios como por ejemplo al servicio de carpintería, construcción de casas, venta de animales menores, servicio domésticos, venta de chicha y cerveza y venta de artesanía. 

La socia Inés forma parte del banco comunal los Solidarios de San Isidro de Chicon, tiene 47 años de edad y tiene un hijo. La socia nos cuenta que actualmente es cuidante del salón comunal del poblado y donde vive también, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere incursionar en el negocio de la venta y compra de animales menores, actualmente ella tiene varios chanchos y cuyes, pero ella requiere comprar corderos y por eso solicita el préstamo.  
          
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Solidarios de San Isidro” is currently in its third loan cycle and consists of eleven hardworking individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

Most of the members are farmers and ranchers who also engage in businesses or services such as carpentry, house construction, small animal sales, housekeeping services, sales of beer and “chicha”, and handicraft sales.

Ines is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios de San Isidro”. She is 47 years old and has one child. Ines says she is currently the caretaker of the community hall in her village and also lives there. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to venture into the business of buying and selling small animals. Ines currently has a several pigs and guinea pigs, but she wants to buy lambs. Therefore, she is requesting this loan.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lambs

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou SANE est une femme 53 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR depuis 8ans et demi et a bénéficié 17 fois de suite de prêts et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Son crédit lui permet de développer une petit commerce. Elle achète de l’huile de palme et du Citron qu’elle envoie à sa fille  qui est à la capital, à Dakar pour la commercialisation. Avec ses bénéfices elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Bintou Sané, aged 53, is married and the mother of six children in her care. She has been a member of the credit association of Alwar for eight and a half years and was granted 17 consecutive loans which she always repaid without difficulty. The loans have enabled her to expand her small business. She buys palm oil and lemons and sends them for sale to her daughter who lives in Dakar, the capital city of Senegal. Bintou uses her profit to participate in the daily household expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her income generating activity

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: To make a living, Macrina R. plants and harvests rice to sell. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Villaramos. Macrina has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) as a monthly average. In 2009, Macrina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Macrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. Macrina is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mrs. Muong Pil Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong P. is a 32-year-old farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is also a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Sauben Nuon, is a construction worker. She is the mother of three children, two of whO. are enrolled in the local public school while the other one is too small for school.

With the farm, they have some problems because their rice field has infertile soil and it is time to plow. Thus, in order to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Muong P. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizers. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire some farmers to plow the rice field. 

Mrs. Muong P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members consisting of 22 people located in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. These members will be using the loan for different purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeun Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has sixteen members who live in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chroeun S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saret Phor, is a motorbike taxi driver.

In the rice field, they have a problem because it is time to farm but they do not have enough money to grow their crop. Hence, Mrs. Chroeun S. decided to apply for a loan to grow rice during this growing season.

This couple has four children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To grow rice during this growing season

loans.name: Mr. Ban Meach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ban M. is a chief in wedding parties and his wife, Mrs. Pho Khiev, is a farmer with 2 hectares of land. She grows rice to sell to support her famiL.. He is the father of a child who helps to do the farming. No matter how hard they try to work, they cannot earn enough income because their field has infertile soil and it's time to plow. Thus, Mr. Ban M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan, he would like to hire some farmers to plow the rice field. 

Mr. Ban M. is village bank president who has been selected by all the members. Nineteen people are in this village bank, who all live in Phnum Lonteah village in TaK. province. They will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Floresa

texts.en: Floresa A.'s main source of income comes from selling cosmetics and other personal products in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. Floresa has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Floresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Floresa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Sileng Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sileng V. is a weaver I. her village and her husband, Mr. Samnieng Ouy, is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support the family. Aside from this, he is a government worker also. I. order to expand their business, Mrs. Sileng V. decided to seek a loan to buy more silk for weaving. This couple does not have a child who lives as a member of the household. 

Sixteen people, who are villagers I. Pea Ream village I. Takeo province, make up this village bank. Mrs. Sileng V. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Five people, who all live in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province, make up this group loan. Mrs. Orn T. is the group leader, as selected by all the members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Orn T. is a rice seller in the local village and, in her free time, is a Khmer cake maker also. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn Nget, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting his family’s living. However hard they tR. to work, they earn little income. Thus, in order to improve their business, Mrs. Orn T. decided to seek a loan to buy more rice to mill for re-selling. She is a mother of a child who is attending the local public school. Mrs. Oeurn Sous, a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to mill for re-selling.

loans.name: Mrs. Sambo So Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sambo S. is a village bank president, as selected by the ten members of this loan group. Kandaol village, in Takeo province, is where all members reside. They will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support themselves in different purposes. Mrs. Sambo S. is a farmer who owns 1.35-hectares of land to cultivate rice, which supports her family’s living. She is a widow with three children, one is a government worker, one is a laborer, while the third is attending a local public school. This family tries to work hard, however, they can earn little income because their field has infertile soil. In order to improve the land and support productive rice, Mrs. Sambo S. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. (pictured above), age 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyhoeun Tep, age 35, have been married for fifteen years and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers outside of the city.

Soeun has been a barber for 10 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 7 years. Soeun doesn’t have his own transportation, so he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. (pictured here), age 27, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Noun, age 33, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for ten years and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school and the other one is still young.  

Mrs. Phalla K. has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned form her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who, in turn, sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Besides weaving, she also supplements her income with a business raising pigs. Her husband has been a security guard for 2 years. 

Phalla is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mr. Moeurn Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people make up a village bank loan. Mr. Moeurn M. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. The group members are villagers in Kandaol village in Takeo province. They will use the loan to purchase something that supports each member for different purposes. Mr. Moeurn M. is a tailor in the local village and his wife, Mrs. SaV. Chear, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family’s living. This couple tries to work hard, but they earn little income. Thus, in order to improve the family’s living conditions, Mr. Moeurn M. decided to apply for a loan to buy more cloth for his tailor-made clothes to sell. He is a father of five children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the others are too young to go to school or work. In the day of the loan disbursement Mr. Moeurn M. was busy at his work. His wife, Mrs. SaV. Chear, came to take the loan instead of him. The photo above is of Mr. Moeurn M.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for tailor-made clothes to sell.

loans.name: Seanghour

texts.en:
Miss. Seanghour K., age 22, is single and lives with her sisters, brothers and parents in a small village off of National Road number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Seanghour is not shown in the photo, her parents were available instead. 

Seanghour has been a farmer for 7 years. She grows rice and vegetables on her farmland in the village. She doesn’t have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,100 to help her capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander M. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. He is 40 years old. Alexander is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alexander owns & operates a specialized retail store buying and selling sand and gravel in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Alexander has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Alexander from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Touch K. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. This group loan has five people who will use a loan to purchase something that support each person for different purposes. Mrs. Touch K. is weaver in the local village and her husband, Mr. Chan Sien, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting his family’s living. In order to expand her business, Mrs. Touch K. decided to apply for a loan to buy more silk for weaving to increase her income for this year. She is a mother of four children: three of whom are garment factory workers, while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad T. is from San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43, married and has 2 school-aged children. Solidad owns and operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving lunch foods to customers in the local community. Solidad has been involved in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Solidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solidad is requesting her second loan, for 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mrs. Nou C. (pictured above), 55, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chen, 60, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The daughter has full-time employment and the two sons are attending University in Phnom Penh City. 

Nou sells Cambodian cake in her village. Her husband has been a primary school teacher for 30 years. Nou is requesting her first loan of $400 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Mrs. Sreytouch S. is 33 years old and she lives in Phnum Lonteah village, in Takeo province. She owns a general store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Chhoun Koa, is farmer who owns 1.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting his family’s living. However hard they try to work, they can earn little income. Thus, Mrs. Sreytouch S. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With rest of the loan she would like to buy more groceries to re-sell. She is a mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang K. (pictured above), age 54, has been married since 1978 and has four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is a security guard, the second daughter weaves silk at home and the other two attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Heang has been a silk weaver for 30 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband used to be a primary school teacher. Because he is old, he is now retired. Heang is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Madiha Soraya Group

texts.en:
Torpeki is a member of the Madiha Soraya group. She lives in the 1st district in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 30 years old. She is single and lives with four family members: her mother, her father and two sisters, who are students. She is a responsible girl and works as a tailor to support her family members. 

She learned the skill of tailoring during the Taliban regime. At that time, she was a student and as the Taliban forced all girls to be confined at home, she had no choice but to learn tailoring. 

Now she has lots of clients who like her way of work. She needs the loan to purchase a new machine with the other things such as cloth, thread and so on. She hopes to grow her business and to send her two sisters to the best private schools to have bright futures.

loans.use: She wants to buy a new machine for her business

loans.name: Boula

texts.en: Mrs. Boula U. is 52 years old and lives in Bam village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is an animal breeder and her husband, Mr. Kon Kou, is a farmer who owns four hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. But their rice field has infertile soil and is a long way from the irrigation system. So to increase production, Mrs. Boula U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and have the field plowed. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local public school, and the other is a low-salaried driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the field

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun P., 47 years old, is a villager in Chuos village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also makes Khmer cakes for sale on the side. Her husband, Mr. Kun Heng, is a construction worker. Their rice field is ready to be plowed but they did not have enough oxen for the job. So Mrs. Oeun P. decided to apply for a loan to buy an ox. Though these activities, the couple supports three children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand, and the others attend the local public school. The picture shows Mrs. P. and her husband.

loans.use: To buy an ox for enough to plow the field

loans.name: Nelly Lisseth

texts.es: Nelly Lisseth R. C. de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive en compañía de su madre, sus dos hermanos y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Nelly posee un comedor, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa, lugar en el cual se encarga de elaborar deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con las personas que viven en los alrededores. Así mismo ella posee un car wash en el cual sus hermanos se encargar de atenderlo, cuyas ganancias son repartidas entre los tres. Nelly solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir en el Car wash,  comprando todo las herramientas necesarias para lavar carros, así mismo comprar verduras, bebidas, granos básicos, los cuales sean de mucho ayuda en el negocio de comida, en el cual recibe la ayuda de su madre. Debido a que ambos negocios son familiares, y de los cuales dependen por completo, Nelly desea mucho poder mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus negocios, de manera que pueda mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Lisseth R. C. is 27 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her mother, her two siblings, and her young son who is a year old. Nelly operates a diner in her home. It is a place where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches, and sells them to people who live in the surrounding areas. She also has a car wash that her siblings are in charge of managing. The revenues from this business are split among the three of them.

Nelly is requesting a loan to invest in her car wash. She will buy all the necessary equipment for cleaning cars. At the same time she will purchase vegetables, drinks, and grains that will be of great help to her food business. Her mother helps her with running the diner. Since both of her ventures are family businesses, they depend on each other completely. Nelly greatly desires to improve her income through both of her businesses so that she can achieve better financial stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her diner & equipment for her car wash

loans.name: Oscar Sigfredo

texts.es: Oscar Sigfredo P. de 36 años de edad reside en Conchagua en el departamento de La Unión  Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 12 años que Oscar se dedica a la pesca y venta de mariscos, negocio en el cual posee mucha experiencia, ya que ha sido un trabajo al cual se ha dedicado toda su familia por décadas. Es de esta manera como él obtiene el sustento diario para su familia, de manera que no falte lo básico y esencial para todos ellos. Oscar solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en su casa, la cual ha tenido que reconstruir, ya que por los años que posee ya esta bastante deteriorada, razón por la cual él desea cambiarle el techo, puertas y balcones, lo cual espera logar antes de la temporada de invierno, y de esta manera poder resguardar a su familia en un lugar seguro y digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Oscar Sigfredo P. is 36 years old. He lives in Conchagua in th edepartment of La Union. He lives in his own house with his wife, a housewife, and his four children who 14,11,8 and 4 years old. They go to school. Oscar has been fishing and selling seafood for 12 years. He has a lot of experience in this business, since his family has done this work for decades. That is how he supports his family, so that all of them don't lack the basic essentials. Oscar is asking for a loan from Integral. He wants to have enough money to invest in the house, which he has had to rebuild. Over the years that he has had it, it has already fairly deteriorated. He wants to change the roof, the doors and balconies. He hopes to do this before winter so his family will have a safe and worthy place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for home repair.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Mrs. Lai N. is 49 years old and lives in Kakaoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chhon Net, is a rickshaw driver. However hard this family tries to work, they have a hard time making ends meet. So, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Lai N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a trailer for the rickshaw taxi and grow the business. The couple has one child.

loans.use: To buy a taxi trailer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela R. D. P. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar en una ferretería, y a sus cinco hijo, todo menores D. 9 años D. edad, D. los cuales los cuatro mayores se dedican a estudiar. María posee una pupusería, en el cual se dedica a elaborar y vender pupusas desD. hace tres años atrás. Así mismo posee una pequeña heladería en la cual venD. sorbetes y paletas al dos por uno, lo cual atrae a muchos clientes todo gracias a las promociones que posee. María creó sus propios negocios, en vista D. la necesidad que su esposo tenia D. contar con una ayuda extra la cual le permitiera salir adelante. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del que pueda comprar maíz, frijoles, arroz, queso y chicharrón, los cuales son los ingredientes con los que se elaboran las pupusas. Así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. sorbetes, ya que esta es la única venta D. sorbetes que hay en el lugar, razón por la cual no posee competencia. María desea mucho poder mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia, es por esto que día a día se esfuerza mucho por brindarles lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Ángela R. D. P., age 30, lives in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who works in a hardware store, and their five children. The children are all younger than nine years old, and the four oldest go to school. María has a business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). She has been making and selling pupusas for three years. At the same time she has a small ice cream business. She sells sorbets and popsicles as two for one. This attracts a lot of customers, and this is all thanks to the promotions she has. María created her own businesses upon seeing that her husband needed extra help, which would allow them to get ahead. María is asking Integral for a loan to be able to buy corn, beans, rice, cheese, and “chicharrón” (pork rinds). These are the ingredients she uses to make the pupusas. She also wants to be able to buy a larger quantity of sorbets. She has the only sorbet sales in the area. Therefore, she does not have competition. María really wants to be able to improve her family’s living conditions. That is why she puts forth a lot of effort everyday to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food and buy sorbets

loans.name: Mrs. Sony Pum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of nine people in Kang Pou village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sony P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. 

She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. She now faces a small problem in that she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow her rice field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan.

Mrs. Sony P. is a widow with four children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C. is the group leader of four people who all live in Pea Ream village in Kandal province. The group members will all use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Ny C. lives with her three family members. She is a thread seller in the local village. As this business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more thread to resell. She is a widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy more thread for resale

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar M. T. de 39 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en  el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por tres niñas las cuales se encarga de estudiar. Beltazar es un hombre muy trabajador quien se esfuerza por salir adelante, y que se dedica a la reparación de electrodomesticos, tales como televisores, radios, ventiladores y otros más, contando con muchos clientes los cuales lo buscan por su excelente servicio. Así mismo su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la cual así mismo esta ubicada en  departamento de La Libertad, es de esta manera en como Baltazar logra solventar todos los gastos del hogar, razón por la cual aprecia mucho su trabajo y solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para comprar todo lo esencial para su negocio.
texts.en:
Baltazar M. T., age 39, lives in Arce City, which is located in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, which is comprised of three girls who are in school. Batlazar is a very hard-working man who puts forth great effort to get ahead. He repairs home appliances like televisions, radios, fans, and other things. He has a lot of customers who seek him out because of his excellent service. His wife sells tortillas in the La Libertad department. This way Baltazar can pay all of the household expenses. That is why he really appreciates the work. He is asking Integral for a loan to buy everything he needs for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for home appliances

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rona-E-Darakht Shing Group

texts.en:
Marzia is a member of Rona-e-Darakht Shing group. She is 30 and has 3 children who go to school. She lives in the 1st district of Kabul, Afghanistan. She works with her husband. He has a fruit shop. When he buys fruit, Marzia cleans it and packs it and her husband sells it in his shop at retail price. She is glad that she can support her husband in his business and that they can live together happily. She needs the loan to purchase more different kinds of fruit.


She hopes the business will grow soon so that her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to expand the business

loans.name: Raúl Adán

texts.es: Raúl Adán A. y A. de 39 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijas menores de edad. Raúl posee una venta de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. Este negocio le permite salir adelante y  poder contar con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. El mayor deseo de Raúl es el de poder seguir adelante dándole a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar, aumentando la cantidad de lo que ya posee y agregando otros con los cuales aún no cuenta, Raúl tiene  muy buena clientela, ya que no posee competencia en los alrededores, lo cual Raúl desea aprovechar al máximo para aumentar sus ventas..
texts.en:
Raúl Adán A. y A., age 39, lives in the city of San Martín, which is located in the San Salvador department. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three minor daughters. Raúl has a business selling perishable products and basic needs items. The business is located in his house. This business allows him to get ahead and be able to count on the money that is needed to pay all of the household expenses. Raúl’s greatest wish is to be able to keep getting ahead and giving his family everything they need to live. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy perishable products and basic needs items for the home. He will increase the quantity that he now has and add other things that he still does not have. Raúl has good customers because he does not have any nearby competition. He wants to take maximum advantage of this to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A., 33, is from the mountainous town of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. As a busy entrepreneur she has been selling frozen foods for almost four years.  Her husband, Rizalde, is a construction worker. 

In 2009, Regina joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.). It means "To rise up from poverty” and is an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received previous loans, she invested them in buying and selling frozen foods. She hopes to soon expand the business with more stock.

Now, on her second loan, she has requested PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for her business. Specifically, the money will be used to buy more stock such as hotdogs, ham, longganisa, embutido and chicken. Regina is optimistic that her business will grow because she already has regular customers requesting orders from her.

She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her frozen food products. Regina also dreams of running a successful business that can provide her family with a good life that is far from poverty. Regina's hopes are for her children to complete college.  She also hopes that her business will continue to provide a sustainable livelihood for her family.


About ASHI: Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her frozen food business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A., 46, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Prudencio A. Jr., a company supervisor, and they are blessed with five children. She helps her husband support the family so that they can have a better life.  She has been selling door-mats and rags for ten years. She also sells cosmetic products.

Anita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Due to her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 15 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed as additional working capital for her business. She earns a profit of PHP 15,000 per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan. This will be used as additional capital to buy more raw materials for her expanding rag making business.

She dreams that her business will continue to sustain her family, especially the education of her children. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rag making business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Z., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Albert Z., a mason/carpenter, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own food stall and electronic cellular phone loading station for three years now.

Marites has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her food and phone load business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her recipes. Some of the loan amount will also be invested in buying cellular phone loads.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams that she will finally have her own house, where she can live up her days with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and cellular phone loads.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S., 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Reyne S., an Overseas Filipino Worker, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while selling health supplements for quite some time now.

Letecia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more supplies that can be incorporated into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she will be able to provide a good future for her family. She also wants the whole family to join her husband and settle out of the country.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Saretap-E- Sabz Group

texts.en: Roya is the group leader of Saretap-e- Sabz. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives in a family of six members including her husband who has a retail cart. He works there to support his family members and make a living. Roya wants to take a loan for him to purchase more stock and to expand his business. He hopes by the loan he will develop his business and will have a shop instead of a cart.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida B., 49, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Freddie B., a vendor, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own hamburger stand for quite some time now.

Soraida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 12 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her hamburger stand.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her hamburgers and other products.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her hamburgers and other products.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48, married, and has 4 school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a food stall in the community. Carmelita has been involved in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting her fifth loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda T., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Amado T., an artist, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been doing direct selling of cosmetics and clothing of the popular brands for quite some time now.

Esmeralda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders on her cosmetics and clothing direct selling lines.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will have more patrons who will continue to be loyal to her and her business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Melyflor

texts.en:
Melyflor F., 58, is making sure that her family members have enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Sixto F., a retiree, and they are blessed in their marriage. Melyflor helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling cosmetics and popular brands of clothing for quite some time.

Melyflor has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends CCT's weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

With your help, Melyflor would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This will be used for added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy advance orders of cosmetics and clothing to sell directly.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her family can live comfortably well-off.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Brgy.Curifang, Solano, Neuva Vizcaya. She is 31, married, and has 4 school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marilyn has been involved in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Marilyn is requesting her second loan, for 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Suay.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Mary Ann buys and sells fish.  She has a small sugar cane plantation as well.  When she and her husband, Jose, first started their fishing business, she did not have enough money for a boat.  With the help of Project Dungganon, she was able to buy a boat, allowing the family to earn much more.  Mary Ann has been engaged in this business for more than 22 years.  From these activities, Mary Ann earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month.

In 2002, Mary Ann joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 19,000, to invest in expanding her business.  She needs to repair her fishing boat and to invest in her sugarcane plantation.  The loan will be the 12th loan she has taken out \from NWTF.  Mary Ann plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees and to repair her house.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than  $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat and plant sugarcane

loans.name: Baryali

texts.en:
This is Baryali son of A. J.. He is 38 years old and is married with three children: one son and two daughters, all students at school. He, with his family members, lives in the 8th District of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a taxi driver and works hard in order to support his family members in a better way.

Baryali needs the money to purchase a new part for his taxi and to change the old one to a new one in order to work better because he is the only one who is responsible for paying all the expenses of the household.
