They have been involved in this business for 1 year, ever since the husband left a government job. The loan will be used for the purchase of flour, sugar and butter for the next delivery to the schools. Tayirjan is the only man in the solidarity group. He is 41 years old. His wife is a member of an agricultural collective. Tayirjan is involved in animal husbandry and milk and dairy products sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of one calf, which will then be sent to a mountain pasture. Sadathan is married and is raising 2 children. The oldest son is 28 years old. He is a construction worker. And the daughter is 22 years old. She is a homemaker. They have a family agricultural and animal husbandry business. Currently, they have 4 sheep. Also, they are getting ready for the planting of potatoes. The loan will be used for the purchase of 5 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one calf

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 36 years old and married with 3 children, who are excelling in school and this gives him joy. He has a store where he sells VCDs (video compact discs). He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with his customers. He hopes to expand his business. He has requested a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Aygul's Group

texts.en:
Aygul A., the leader of this group, is a model of open-mindedness and creativity. Multilevel marketing is not very popular in Kyrgyzstan although there are still a lot of well-known companies such as Faberlic, Avon and Oriflame, which promise a better future for those who have a burning desire. With 3,000 KGS ($68) in her pocket, Aygul decided to join this business. She was very ambitious and she did succeed. Now she wants to get a loan to increase her sales by buying cosmetics because the spring holiday season is coming, which is the best time to sell. Aygul is 38 and married to a farmer. They have three children: two daughters and a son. Nuura, 15, is in 8th grade at a local school. The middle daughter is in 2nd grade at the same school and the youngest is at home. Aygul, in the near future, wants to increase her turnover and send her eldest daughter to get a higher level of education. 

Perisat J. is 30 and married to a farmer.  She has four children: two daughters and two sons. In 1996, she and her husband sold their car for 50,000 KGS ($113) and invested all their money in livestock. Now their revenue is 6,000 KGS ($136). They would like to get a loan to buy two small cattle for resale. 

Ayshirin O. is 39 and a determined woman. She is married to an engineer and has a daughter and twin sons. They all attend school. She works as an equipment operator in a shop.  Her future plan is to buy a house. She would like to get a loan for housing improvement. 

Rosa D. is 57 and married. She has six children, now adults, most of whom live independently. Her youngest child lives at home and  attends school. Her eldest son, 24, lives with her and buys cars for spare parts. In 2009, he started with 20,000 KGS ($454) and bought a car in order to sell its spare parts. Now their revenue is 3,000 KGS ($68). They would like to get a loan to buy spare parts. In the future, they are planning to increase turnover and open an auto service.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is 40 years old, married with a child. His child is 4 years old and in school and this gives him joy. He has a store where he sells CDs/DVDs. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to expand his business. He hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more CDs/DVDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher O. renders laundry services in his city. He loves this business because he is the only laundry man in his community and the demands for his services are high. He is an Igbo by tribe but he lives and works in Asaba, Delta state. He is single without children. He holds no regret going into this business. He hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase one washing machine to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more washing machine to boost his business

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike A. is 50 years old, married with six (6) children. He is an honest and hard working man. He sells for long hours to enable him to put food on his table to feed his immediate family. He sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a classic super market in the future. He hopes for a loan amount of N100,000, to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. He loves this business because it is profitable to him. He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is a 26 year old single man.  He has been operating a barber shop for two years.  He started this business immediately after clearing school.  He has been trained how to plan his business by Faulu Kenya.  He wants to take a loan of Kes.15,000 to purchase a shaving machine and chairs for his barber shop.  He hopes to have a stable business in the future and operate well established companies.  He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase a shaving machine and chairs

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma is a young hard working woman. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband is a building contractor in Asaba, Delta State. Her children are excelling in their school. She sells groceries, juice and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is doing well in her business but her greatest challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries, juice and drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Madame Ami Diakité est une femme mariée de 28 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants et son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ayant vite abandonné l’école pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat et la vente de savons de toilette,  de lessive, des cosmétiques, du lait en poudre, des poudres de toilette etc.
Avec une expérience de 8 ans, elle maîtrise son activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
Elle compte utiliser ce deuxième  prêt pour acheter, 10 cartons de savons.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni, au marché les jours de foires et à domicile, au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  agrandir ses activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Ami Diakité is a 28-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She lives with her children and husband in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having quickly dropped out of school due to societal reasons, she soon became interested in revenue-generating work, notably commerce in a variety of goods, such as bath soaps, laundry soaps, cosmetics, powdered milk, bath powders, etc. With eight years of experience, she has a command of her business, for which she is in high demand and much appreciated. Concerned about satisfying her growing customer base, Ami decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is now on her second individual loan after having properly repaid the first one. She intends to use this second loan for buying ten boxes of soap. She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers, and she makes her sales in the different districts of Bougouni City, at the market on market days, and at home. Cash or credit for retail sales is accepted from customers composed essentially of women. Ami envisions making a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for expanding her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soaps

loans.name: Modieré Dite Mamba

texts.fr:
Madame Modieré dite Mamba D. est une femme mariée de 35 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier  Hérémakono-Centre de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Nantie d’un diplôme de médecine de son état, Modieré a passé quelques années dans une clinique, mais finit par se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente de produits pharmaceutiques  au niveau d’une pharmacie sise au quartier Dilanikoro de Bougouni.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée et appréciée au niveau de Bougouni et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de produits appelés D.C.I. (c’est à dire des produits génériques), à Bougouni et effectuent sa vente dans sa pharmacie à une clientèle  composée de toute la  population locale.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui  lui permettra de d’améliorer sa pharmacie et payer les intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Ms. Modieré, who goes by the name of Mamba D., is a 35-year-old married women and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono-Centre district of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Bestowed with a medical degree, Mamba spent a few years in a clinic but ultimately became specialized in buying and selling pharmaceutical products at a pharmacy located in the Dilanikoro district of Bougouni. With five years of experience, she has a command of her business. She is in high demand and much appreciated in and around Bougouni. Concerned about satisfying her clearly-growing customer base, she decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan for buying a major quantity of products called D.C.I. (that is, generic products) in Bougouni. She makes her sales in her pharmacy to customers composed of the entire local population. Mamba envisions making a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will enable her to improve her pharmacy and to cover the Soro Yiriwaso loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: By God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Garmai J. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called By God’s Grace. She is 29 years old, single, and has two children aged one and six years old. Her six-year-old is in elementary school, and Garmai herself is a high school graduate.

For 6 years, Garmai has been selling dry goods (an assortment of foodstuffs and household products) at the Red Light Market.  Red Light is Liberia's largest market, and is located in Paynesville on the outskirts of the capital Monrovia. Garmai says she sells good products in a friendly manner, which keeps her customers returning.

Garmai plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods.  Her goal is to grow her business to a bigger one and improve her family's living conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Garmai is the one holding the sign. Garrison F. is inset at lower right. 

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more goods for a general store (dry goods shop).

loans.name: Florance

texts.en: Florance is a Yoruba by tribe. She is 39 years old, married to a carpenter and they have four children who are in the primary school. She is hair dresser and she also sells hair extensions at retail prices. She makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers. She is requesting for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Comfort J. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing.  She is 41 years old, married, and has five children whose educational levels range from elementary school to college student. Comfort herself is a junior high school graduate.

For seven years, Comfort has been selling dry goods from a table at the Red Light Market, which is Liberia's largest market and is on the outskirts of the capital Liberia. She says sells good products in a friendly manner which keeps her customers returning.

Comfort plans to use her 11,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 55,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods, such as rice, cooking oil, candles, and soap. Her goal is to grow her business to a freestanding shop, and to improve her family's living condition.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Comfort is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more general foodstuffs and household products for a dry goods store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 27 years old and single without children. She is a hard working girl and she is determined to excel in her business. She is a hair stylist and she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a hair dryer to boost her business. She hopes to expand in her business and make more profits. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer to boost her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 57 year old single mother of five. Two of her children attend school. She has been running a cafe for two years where she sells food and beverages. She has two employees to assist her in the business.  She also sells cereals to increase her earnings. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money. She hopes to open a restaurant and build a house for her family in the future.  She has requested a loan of kes 60,000 to renovate her business premises. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has been working in agriculture since 2001. He plants tomatoes, cucumber, and lettuce in his green house. He is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of vegetables and knows how to take care of his green house. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he took after his family’s business. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his work merchandise. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 
In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his work merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 50 year old lady who has been running a boutique for four years.  She used to farm together with her husband who is also a businessman before she started her own business.    She has been a member of Faulu Kenya and she has previously taken five loans from the MFI.   She used these loans to buy a plot and another to buy a farm.  She plans to buy clothes, necklaces, shoes and ladies tops hence she has requested for a loan of Kes.50,000.  She hopes to buy a taxi, buy a plot to build her own house and expand her business in the future.  She also dreams buying a lorry in ten years time.  Rose has three children who she has seen through school.

loans.use: To buy clothes, necklaces, shoes and ladies tops

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a tile ground cleaner since 2006. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tile and do maintenance work on his machine. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
His clients are his people from his region and from the surrounding villages. When Ali first started his work, he wasn’t really known from the people in his region which means he didn’t have a lot of networking and didn’t use to have a lot of clients. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tile and do maintenance work on his machine.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 34 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khalil has been working as agriculture for fifteen years. He owns citrus fruit trees. He is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best. He decided on doing his business because he took after his family’s business and gained experience when he was young since he used to work with his father. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and for the harvesting of his trees. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools and for the harvesting of his trees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 29 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mohammad has owned a grocery store for over ten years. He also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, chips, beverages and lots more. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. Mohammad is special in his work because he is very welcoming and offers a big variety of merchandise. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He decided doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In future, he plans to keep on improving his store by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a hardworking lady who runs a salon business.  She describes her business environment as busy. She previously supplied rice.  She has requested for Kes.60,000 loan to buy more salon equipment after successfully repaying a loan of Kes. 80,000.  She hopes to open up a cosmetic shop in the future.  Anne is a single mother of two.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: To make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. Idowu sells mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstufs to cook and sell. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Her child is 2 years old. Her husband is a business man and he also supports their home.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstufs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Milliana

texts.en: Millliana is a single mother of one.  She runs a salon named Jasmine Salon located in Eastleigh market.   Faulu Kenya has really changed her business since she has learned business management.   She has therefore, requested for Kes.20,000 to buy a hair blow drier and hair drier.  She hopes to open other business outlets such as a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair blow drier and hair drier

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 56 years old and she is a widow with 6 children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her and the children. She is also a grand mother. Her youngest child is 16 years old. She sells drinks and sachet water to make a living in Lagos state. She loves her business because she is able to make profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase drinks and sachet water to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. (Lift above poverty organisation) is committed to improving lives in Ningeria and else where in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a hardworking and visionary lady who sells grocery.    She was a farmer before she started her business one month ago and she has been trained by Faulu Kenya on how to run the business.  She plans to add stock of potatoes, kales, cabbage and tomatoes hence she has requested for a loan of Kes.20,000.  She is  45 years old, married to a carpenter and they are blessed with two children who are in school.  She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a family house in the future.  She also dreams of venturing into hardware business.

loans.use: To add stock of fruits and vegatables

loans.name: Kaosara

texts.en: Kaosara is married to a commercial driver and they have a child. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers, who are usually friends and local residents. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 42-year-old single mother of two children. She has been running an embroidery business for five years at the Jericho market. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has grown, as have her profits after taking a loan of KES 10,000. She dreams of further expanding her business and venturing into another form of business in the future.  She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy cloth materials / fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marie Hélène

texts.fr: Marie Hélène D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et a la charge de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis février 2004 et a eu 19 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de mieux développer son activité d'embouche bovine en achetant 2 paires de bœufs qu'elle engraisse pendant 4 à 5 mois et revend sur pied. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Hélène D. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five chidren. Plus she has three other children entrusted to her to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de NGOHE since February 2004. She has had 19 consecutive loans and never had any problems repaying. Her new loan enables her to develop further her business of fattening cattle. To do so, Marie Hélène plans to buy two pairs of cattle, which she will fatten for four to five months before reselling them as livestock. She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two pairs of cattle

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 35 years old and married to a civil servant. They have 3 children, who are excelling in school, and this gives Bola joy. She is a hard working and friendly woman. She has a stall where she sells medicines and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business and hopes to expand it. She would like to own a maternity home in the future. Bola hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 37-year-old married man who is blessed with three children. He has been operating a laundry business for four years. He has one employee to assist him. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He hopes to open more branches in the future and monopolize the laundry business in Nairobi. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to service his machines and buy more irons. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: to service his laundry machines and buy more irons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Fe 123 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is a single mother with four children. She is the coordinator of her group L. Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the agricultural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy focuses on the sugarcane harvest, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She and her children make their home here in a simple structure.

Margarita runs an ambulatory food stand which sells oranges, popcorn, sugarcane and chicken. She is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to invest in her family (by purchasing food and clothing) and in her business (by saving towards one day opening a small corner store). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy oranges, sugarcane, popcorn and chicken

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her cooking skills to yield money. She sells Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit to her customers. She does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes to grow her business. 

She hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 42 years old and married to a building contractor. They are blessed with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Hélèné

texts.fr: Hélène S. est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 3 ans et a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle s'est spécialisée dans l'embouche bovine et ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter deux paires de bœufs qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène S. is 33 years old, married and mother of three children, all under her care. She has been a member of the NGOHE ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for three years and has benefited from six successive loans. She specialized in the fattening of cattle, and this loan will allow her two buy two pairs of oxen she will fatten for sale after four to five months. She participates in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oxen for fattening

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 39-year-old married mother of four children who attend school. She has been running a café for 10 years. She has two employees who assist her in the business. She was previously running a green grocery and a milk-vending business before she ventured into this business. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, she has learned how to keep proper business records and has acquired customer-care skills. She hopes to grow her business into a restaurant and thus improve her living standards.  

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy furniture for her business and to add stock of foodstuffs. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and add stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and married to a pastor. They have five children. Her children are excelling in their jobs and in school. She is a hardworking mother and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty. 

She sells drinks and eggs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 160,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and eggs to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Rubea S., 35, is married with five children.  He has had a business selling fish since 2007.  He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, selling from a small place and from door-to-door. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about $414.

This will be Rubea’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more fish and he has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a new loan to continue to mprove on his stock.

Rubea will share this loan with his loan group, Wakorintho, comprised of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Rubea is wearing a red t-shirt and is leaning on the trunk.

loans.use: To increase his fish stock

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 40 years old and married with 4 young children, who all attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. Queen is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells foodstuffs such as tomato paste, cooking oil, rice, beans, plantains and drinks. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstufs to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 32-year-old married man with two children in school.  He has been running a laundry shop for ten years.  He gained experience in this business because he formerly worked in a laundry.  His wife operates a cereals shop.  He wants to take out a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a washing machine, irons and two ironing stands.  He hopes to succeed in his business and open up another one.  He also dreams of buying a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine, irons and ironing stands

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: Marcelle D. est une femme de 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants en charge, elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 11 ans et a 22 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle achète des bœufs pour les engraisser pendant 4 ou 5 mois et les revend sur pied. Les profits générés par son activité lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marcelle D. is a 52-year old woman who has seven chidren in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for 11 years and has had 22 consecutive loans, which she has always repaid without any problem. She has a beef fattening activity and buys oxen to fatten them up for four or five months before reselling them on foot. The profits generated by her activity allow her to participate in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four oxen

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou T. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 11 ans et a eu 22 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu des problèmes de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 4 bœufs qu'elle va emboucher et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettrons de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Fatou T. is a 53-year old woman who is a widow and has nine children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for 11 years and has had 22 loans, which she never had any problem in repaying. She has a beef fattening activity and her new loan will allow her to buy four oxen, which she will raise and resell after four to five months. Her profits will allow her to take care of her offspring and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her beef fattening activity with the purchase of four oxen

loans.name: Marie André

texts.fr: Marie André F. est une femme de 38 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE dont elle est la présidente depuis 11 ans et y  reçu 22 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et les profits générés par activité lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille tel que la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Marie André F. is a 38-year old woman who is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for 11 years, and for the past 11 years she has been president. She has had 22 loans, all of which she has managed well and repaid on time. She has a beef fattening activity and the profits generated by this activity allow her to contribute to the household expenses, such as food, health and her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two pairs of oxen to fatten up

loans.name: Aynagul's Group

texts.en:
Aynagul J. is an immense woman. She has an ability to overcome the difficulties and looks to the world with the hope for a better tomorrow. Aynagul is 46 and married. She has a smart husband who is a member of a farm. They have seven children whom they adore and their children are as determined as their mother is. The older children are unique themselves. They already achieved goals in their life and at present stay separately from her. The younger ones still attend the local school and in their free time, they eagerly help their mother in her business. Baktygul is the middle daughter and she is a schoolgirl. She is eighteen and studies in 10th grade. Next is Rahat who studies in eighth grade and the last one is Aynagul’s joy. He is a six-year-old boy who studies in first grade. When he grows up, he wants to be the President of Kyrgyzstan. So Aynagul and her friendly family deal with livestock. Since 2000, they have been selling cattle and for the money they got, they already have bought a new house, married off their daughter and increased the number of the cattle. Now their plan is to send Baktygul to get education like her sisters and brothers. Recently, they have decided to get a loan to buy a horse in order to fatten it and resell it later on.

Sayra J. is 25 and married. She has two children. Her husband is a member of a farm.  She works in a part-time job. They already have cattle. They are planning to build a house and increase their  number of cattle. By getting a loan, they are going to buy a horse.  

Kunduz T. is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a member of a farm and a private cattle breeder. They want to get a loan to buy four cattle. Their future plans are to expand the number of cattle and make their living conditions better. 

Saliyma S. is 38 and married. Her husband is a member of the farm. They have four children and they all attend school. She works as a teacher in school. They are planning to increase the number of cattle and send the elder daughter to get an education. They have built a house where they all together live. They want to get a loan to buy three cattle.

Tilek K. is 35 and married. His wife is a member of the farm. They have three daughters. They hope to harvest a good crop in the spring. The reason why he wants to get a loan is that he wants to buy 200 liters of solar oil for agriculture works.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a horse to fatten and resell

loans.name: Fatou Ngom

texts.fr: Fatou Ngom S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 6 ans et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle développe un petit commerce de mil et fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Ngom S. is a 60-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for six years and has benefited from 12 loans, which she has managed well and repaid on time. She is building up a small business selling millet and at the same time has a beef fattening activity. She supports her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: Las Catarritas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Catarritas está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Blanca Zenobia Hernández O. la cual en sus inicios comercializaba sandalias  pero luego decidió cambiar de negocio y con dos mil córdobas invirtió en la compra de prendas y cosméticos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Cecilia Z. F. la cual vende ropa, cosméticos y prenda mientras María de los Santos G. López vende caramelos y chiverías. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios con el propósito de ampliarlo.
texts.en:
The "Las Catarritas" group is composed of three, hard-working women. One of them is Blanca Zenobia Hernández O., who started off selling sandals, but then decided to change focus and, with a 2000 córdobas investment, bought articles of clothing and cosmetics. Her fellow group members are: María Cecilia Z. F., who sells clothing and cosmetics and María de los Santos G. López, who sells sweets and yoghurt snacks. They will invest the funds in their respective businesses, the goal being to enlarge them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver jewelry items, cosmetics, clothing.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 35-year-old man, married and blessed with two children. He distributes bread to retail shops in his residential area.  He has been operating this business for three years and he has one employee.  He has managed to build rental houses to rent in order to increase his income. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He hopes to expand his business and to sell poultry products. He dreams of starting a bakery and building a house for his family in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to start a bakery and buy bakery equipment.  He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To start a bakery

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
The childhood of Jyldyz I. was not so bad; that means not so good. From an early age, she has been taught to be strong and able to confront the difficulties which life sometimes brings. However, she is kind, cheerful and social, someone who one can talk through the long winters evening and never get fed up. Having graduated from the university, she worked as a supervisor in a company that later declared bankruptcy. Her determined mind did not collapse and later on, she opened up her own business, which she still has. At the beginning, she sold goods such as sugar, oil, flavoring, and salt at home but later on she bought a pavilion. Speaking about her private life, she is 39 and a tremendous lady. She is married and has three children; two of them are boys and the youngest is a daughter. Her older son and daughter attend a local school and after school, they help her in the business. Her husband is a taxi driver and also helps her in her job. She opened up the business about 10 years ago with 1,000 KGS (22$) and since then she did a complete overhaul of their house and bought a car. Now her profit is 10,000 KGS (227$). She is planning in the future to buy cattle and expand it. However, now she needs a loan to buy tableware and souvenir ware to sell during the spring holidays. 

Aynur M. is a decisive woman. She is 47 and has two children. Her daughter who is 24 graduated from the university and now works in a private company. Her son who is nineteen is a student. At first, 15 years ago, she started her business with 10,000 KGS (227$). She was selling clothes but shifted to reselling cattle. Now her profit is 8,000 KGS (181$) and they have already bought a car. Now, to buy three cattle to fatten and resell, they need a loan from Mol Bulak Finance. 

Farida K. is a married 32-year-old young lady.  She has three children: two sons and a princess daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver who is a good supporter of her. She sells daily foodstuffs. They began their business five years ago with 5,000 KGS (113$) and now the profit is 7,000 KGS (160$). They want to increase the turnover by getting a loan from Mol Bulak Finance.

Dinara J., 43, is married and has four children. Her husband is a metalworker. As to her, besides being a housewife, she manages to keep a cow and four sheep. She feeds and resells them. Even though they do not have much livestock, they have been able to increase their number and marry their children. Dinara wants to get a loan to purchase sheep.

Chynara S. is 32. She is married and her husband has a tractor, which they bought recently. He is tractor driver. They have four smart children. Three of them attend school and the youngest is at home. In 1994, they seeded a field with potatoes and built a house. Now she fattens 10 small cattle and she needs a loan to buy three small cattle to increase the number of livestock. They are planning to build a shed and a house for their children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy tableware and souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 44-year-old man, married and blessed with two children who attend school. He sells construction materials to builders and to other hardware shops. He has been running this business for 10 years and he has one employee to assist him in the business.  He was previously employed in a butcher shop before he ventured into this business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He hopes to grow his business and build a house for his family in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy cement. He describes himself as focused and a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles F. Duartes es una joven mujer humilde, trabajadora, sencilla la cual se dedica al diseño y elaboración de calzado femenino. En un comienzo su taller era un pequeño espacio actualmente este a ido creciendo.

Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima para la producción de una línea de verano entre los materiales se encuentran  plantillas, cuerina, brasil, pega, hilo, suelas etc.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles F. Duartes is a young, simple, hard working, and humble woman who designs and makes women's shoes. At one time her workshop was a tiny space and today it has been growing. She will invest her loan in the purchase of prime materials for the production of a summer line. Some of the materials are: insoles,faux leather, brasil, glue, thread, soles etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make women's shoes

loans.name: Khémess

texts.fr: Khémess G. est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis juillet 2007 et a reçu 5 fois de suite du crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de maintenir son activité d'embouche bovine. Elle participe à l'amélioration du cadre et des conditions de vie familiales en soutenant son mari dans les différentes charges.
texts.en:
Khémess G. is a married woman who is 53 years old. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE since July 2007 and has had five consecutive loans. Her new loan will allow her to sustain her beef fattening business. She is contributing to her family's living conditions and environment, by supporting her husband in covering the various expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her beef fattening activity more easily

loans.name: Duyshobubu's Group

texts.en:
Duyshobubu U. is a creative individual. From childhood, she has had the ability to see the world in a different way and the things that we pass by. She has kind of a gift from above and tries to develop it. She did not study at the university though she is well educated. Her teacher was Life. Now she is 46 and a married woman. She is a brilliant mother of two sons. Her elder son is a student. His tuition is 16,000 KGS (363$). He wants to be a teacher. The youngest one is a schoolboy who studies in ninth grade. Her staggering husband works as in security at a company. What she has now is a result of years of hard work. Her business, her family, her friends, everything is deserved by her. Last year, with 1,000 KGS (22$), she started her little business which turns to a kind of national heritage. At present, she is an art teacher at the school and she sews incredible national items at home from expensive fabric. She has three types of sewing machines. She sells her fabulous works to tourists who visit the city. Her revenue is 6,000 KGS (136$). She is planning to open a factory where national items would be made. By getting a loan from Mol Bulak Finance, she wants to invest all the money in business by buying raw materials for sewing more national items. 

Gulmira S. is 45 and married. She has two daughters who are at home now. Her husband is a bus driver. She works as a cook in a café and earns 2,100 KGS (47$). She wants to get a loan to buy clothes for children. 

Nurgul A. is a widow. She is 43 and has two children. Her older daughter works in a café as a waitress. Her younger daughter is a schoolgirl. Nurgul sells bloater. She has a smoker and her turnover is 7,000 KGS (160$). Now she wants to get a loan to grow barley on her lot. 

Kumush K. is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her older son takes passengers and his income is 5,000 KGS (113$).  Her daughter works as a teacher and earns 1,800 KGS (40$). Her husband works as in security. At first, they bought 10 cattle for the family's needs 10 years ago. Now they are fattening five cattle and will sell them soon. This business began with 40,000 KGS (909$) and now they earn 3,000 KGS (68$). They want to buy four other small cattle by taking a loan.      

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing more national items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 48-year-old married mother of three children who attend school. She has been running a cafeteria for four years and has two employees to assist her. She also distributes chicken to hotels to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and her business has also grown. She hopes to expand her business and venture into other businesses in the future.  She has requested a loan of KES 60,000 to renovate her premises and buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to renovate the premises and buy a deep freezer
